verses.latin: Et factum est ut post mortem Moysi servi Domini, loqueretur Dominus ad Josue filium Nun, ministrum Moysi, dicens:
verses.english: Now, it came to pass that after the death of Moses, the servant of God, God spoke to Joshua, the son of Nun, who had been Moses' assistant, saying:

verses.latin: Moyses servus meus mortuus est: surge, et transi Jordanem istum tu, et omnis populus tecum, in terram quam ego dabo filiis Israel.
verses.english: My servant Moses is dead. Now, you and all the people with you must get up and cross this Jordan River into the land that I am giving to the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Omnem locum, quem calcaverit vestigium pedis vestri, vobis tradam, sicut locutus sum Moysi.
verses.english: Every single place that your foot steps upon, I will give to you, just as I promised Moses.

verses.latin: A deserto et Libano usque ad fluvium magnum Euphraten, omnis terra Hethæorum usque ad mare magnum Occidentis, erit terminus vester.
verses.english: From the desert and from Lebanon, stretching all the way to the great Euphrates River—all the land of the Hittites, all the way to the Great Sea in the west—that will be your territory's boundary.

verses.latin: Nemo resistet vobis cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ: sicut fui cum Moyse, ita ero tecum: non dimittam, nec derelinquam te.
verses.english: No one will be able to stand against you throughout your entire life. Just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not abandon you, nor will I ever desert you.

verses.latin: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim sorte divides populo huic terram, pro qua juravi patribus eorum, ut traderem eis.
verses.english: Be strong and courageous! For you are the one who will divide by lot this land among this people—the land which I swore to their ancestors I would give to them.

verses.latin: Tantum confortare, et esto robustus valde: ut custodias, et facias omnem legem, quam præcepit tibi Moyses servus meus: ne declines ab ea nec ad dexteram, nec ad sinistram: ut intelligas omnia quæ agis.
verses.english: Only be very strong and very courageous! So that you carefully observe and faithfully do everything in the entire Law that My servant Moses commanded you. Do not turn from it, neither to the right nor to the left, so that you may act wisely in everything you do.

verses.latin: Non recedat volumen legis hujus de ore tuo: sed meditaberis in eo die ac nocte, ut custodias et facias omnia quæ scripta sunt in eo: tunc diriges viam tuam, et intelliges.
verses.english: Do not let this Book of the Law ever depart from your mouth. Instead, meditate on it day and night, so that you may diligently observe and do everything that is written in it. Then you will make your way prosperous, and you will understand and succeed.

verses.latin: Ecce præcipio tibi: confortare, et esto robustus. Ne timeas, et ne paveas: quoniam tecum est Dominus Deus tuus in omnibus ad quæcunque perrexeris.
verses.english: Listen! I am commanding you right now: Be strong and courageous! Do not be afraid, and do not be terrified! Because the Lord your God is with you everywhere you go, no matter what you face.

verses.latin: Præcepitque Josue principibus populi, dicens:
verses.english: And Joshua then gave orders to the leaders of the people, saying:

verses.latin: Ite per medium castrorum, et præcipite populo, dicentes: Præparate vobis cibaria: quoniam post tertium diem transibitis Jordanem, et intrabitis ad possidendam terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis.
verses.english: Go through the camp and command the people, saying: 'Prepare your provisions, because after three days, you will cross the Jordan River and go in to take possession of the land which the Lord your God is giving to you.'

verses.latin: Rubenitis quoque et Gaditis et dimidiæ tribui Manasse, ait Josue:
verses.english: Joshua also spoke to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh,

verses.latin: Mementote sermonis, quem præcepit vobis Moyses servus Domini, dicens: Dominus Deus vester requiem dedit vobis, et omnem terram.
verses.english: Remember the word that Moses, the servant of the Lord, commanded you, saying: 'The Lord your God has given you rest and this entire land.'

verses.latin: Uxores vestræ, et filii vestri, et pecora vestra manebunt in terra, quam tradidit vobis Moyses trans Jordanem: vos autem omnis fortis virorum armatorum, transibitis ante fratres vestros præcingite galeis vestris, et adjuvabitis eos,
verses.english: Your wives, your children, and your livestock will remain in the land that Moses gave to you beyond the Jordan River. But all of you, every strong, armed man, will cross over ahead of your brothers, fully equipped for battle, and you will help them,

verses.latin: donec requiem præbeat Dominus fratribus vestris, sicut et vobis tribuit: et possideant ipsi terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est illis: et sic revertemini in terram possessionis vestræ, et manebitis in ea, quam vobis dedit Moyses famulus Domini trans Jordanem contra solis ortum.
verses.english: until the Lord gives rest to your brothers, just as He has given it to you, and they themselves take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving to them. Then you may return to your own land, the land of your inheritance, and settle there, the land which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave to you beyond the Jordan River, on the east side.

verses.latin: Responderuntque ad Josue, dicentes: Omnia quæ præcepisti nobis, faciemus: et quocumque miseris, ibimus.
verses.english: And they responded to Joshua, saying: 'We will do everything that you have commanded us, and wherever you send us, we will go.

verses.latin: Sicut obedivimus in cunctis Moysi, ita obediemus et tibi: tantum sit Dominus Deus tuus tecum, sicut fuit cum Moyse.
verses.english: Just as we obeyed Moses in everything, so we will also obey you. Only let the Lord your God be with you, just as He was with Moses.

verses.latin: Qui contradixerit ori tuo, et non obedierit cunctis sermonibus tuis quos præceperis ei, morietur: tu tantum confortare, et viriliter age.
verses.english: Anyone who rebels against your authority and does not obey all the words that you command him will be put to death. Only you must be strong and act with courage.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Josue filius Nun de Settim duos viros exploratores clam, et dixit eis: Ite, et videte terram, et urbem Jericho. Qui perrexerunt, et ingressi sunt domum mulieris meretricis, nomine Rahab, et manserunt apud eam.
verses.english: So Joshua, the son of Nun, sent two men secretly from Shittim as spies. He commanded them: "Go and observe the land, especially the city of Jericho." The two men departed and entered the house of a harlot named Rahab, and they lodged there.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est regi Jericho, atque dictum: Ecce viri ingressi sunt huc nocte de filiis Israel, ut explorarent terram.
verses.english: It was reported to the king of Jericho, with the message: "Look, some men from the children of Israel have entered this place tonight to spy out the land."

verses.latin: Misitque rex Jericho ad Rahab, dicens: Educ viros, qui ingressi sunt domum tuam, sunt enim exploratores, et ad explorandam omnem terram venerunt.
verses.english: So the king of Jericho sent a message to Rahab, saying: "Bring out the men who have entered your house, because they are spies, and they have come to survey all the land."

verses.latin: Et susceptos mulier abscondit, et sic locuta est: Veniunt quidem ad me viri, sed nesciebam unde essent:
verses.english: The woman, however, had taken the men and hidden them. She then spoke this way: "Indeed, men came to me, but I did not know from where they were coming."

verses.latin: cumque portae clauderentur in tenebris, et illi egressi sunt. Nescio quo abierint: persequimini cito, et comprehendetis illos.
verses.english: When the city gates were about to be closed in the dark, they left. I do not know where they went. Pursue them quickly, and you will surely overtake them.'"

verses.latin: Ipsa autem ascendere fecerat viros in tectum domus suae, et absconderat eos sub stipulae lini.
verses.english: She, however, had made the men go up to the roof of her house and hidden them under stalks of flax.

verses.latin: Hi vero, qui missi fuerant, secuti sunt vestigia eorum, via quae ducit ad Jordanem, usque ad vada: illisque egressis, statim portae clausae sunt.
verses.english: Indeed, those who had been sent by the king pursued them along the road that leads to the Jordan, all the way to the fords. As soon as the pursuers went out, the city gates were immediately closed.

verses.latin: Prius autem quam obdormirent, ascendit Rahab ad eos, et ait:
verses.english: But before the spies lay down to sleep, Rahab went up to them on the roof and said:

verses.latin: Scio quod Dominus dederit vobis terram hanc, et irruerit in nos terror vester, cunctos enim habitatores terrarum harum in vobis formido cepit.
verses.english: "I know that the Lord God has given you this land, and that your terror has fallen upon us. Indeed, a great fear of you has seized all the inhabitants of these lands."

verses.latin: Audivimus quod siccaverit Dominus aquas Maris Rubri ad introitum vestrum, quando egressi estis ex Aegypto: et quae feceritis duobus regibus Amorrhæorum, qui trans Jordanem erant, Sehon et Og, quos interfecistis.
verses.english: "We have heard how the Lord dried up the waters of the Red Sea for you when you came out of Egypt. We also heard what you did to the two kings of the Amorites, Sihon and Og, who were on the other side of the Jordan, whom you utterly destroyed."

verses.latin: Et nullus deinceps durare potuit spiritus noster, timentes vultum introitus vestri: Dominus enim Deus vester ipse est Deus in cælo sursum, et in terra deorsum.
verses.english: "And from that moment, no courage has remained within us, because we were terrified by your impending arrival. For the Lord your God, He alone is God in the universe above and on the earth below."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo jurate mihi per Dominum, ut quemadmodum ego feci misericordiam vobiscum, ita et vos faciatis cum domo patris mei: detisque mihi verum signum,
verses.english: "Now therefore, swear to me by the Lord that just as I have shown kindness to you, so also you will show kindness to my father's household. And give me a sure sign, a true promise,"

verses.latin: et salvetis patrem meum et matrem, fratresque et sorores meas, et omnia quæ illorum sunt, et eruatis animas nostras de morte.
verses.english: "—that you will save my father, my mother, my brothers, my sisters, and all that belongs to them, and that you will deliver our lives from death."

verses.latin: Qui responderunt ei: Anima nostra sit pro vobis in mortem, si tamen non prodideris sermonem hunc nostrum: cumque tradiderit nobis Dominus terram, faciemus in te misericordiam et veritatem.
verses.english: The men answered her: "Our lives for yours, even unto death, if you do not betray this matter of ours. When the Lord delivers this land to us, we will show you kindness and faithfulness."

verses.latin: Et demisit eos per funem de fenestra: domus enim ejus hærens erat muro, et habitabat in muro.
verses.english: Then she let them down by a rope through the window, because her house was built into the city wall, and she lived in the wall itself.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: In montem pergite, ne forte occurrant vobis qui missi sunt: ibique latitate tribus diebus, donec revertantur. et sic ibitis per viam vestram.
verses.english: And she said to them: "Go to the mountain, so that the men sent to pursue you do not encounter you. Hide there for three days until they have returned. Then, you may go on your way."

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: Innoxii erimus a juramento hoc, quo adjurasti nos,
verses.english: The spies said to her: "We will be free from this oath, by which you have bound us, under certain conditions,

verses.latin: si ingredientibus nobis terram, signum hoc de filo coccineo ligaveris in fenestra, per quam nos dimisisti: et patrem tuum ac matrem, et fratres tuos, et omnem cognationem tuam colliges in domum tuam.
verses.english: —if, when we enter the land, you tie this scarlet thread in the window through which you let us down. You must also gather your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your relatives into your house."

verses.latin: Qui, si extra fores domus tuæ exierit, sanguis ipsius erit in caput ejus, et nos innoxii erimus. Si quis autem tetigerit de his, qui tecum in domo fuerint, sanguis eorum redundabit in caput nostrum.
verses.english: "If anyone goes outside the doors of your house, his blood will be on his own head, and we will be innocent. But if anyone inside the house with you is harmed, their blood will be on our heads."

verses.latin: Si autem hunc sermonem nostrum prodideris, et nos innoxii erimus hujus juramenti, quo adjurasti nos.
verses.english: "However, if you betray this matter of ours, then we will also be free from this oath by which you have made us swear."

verses.latin: Quæ respondit: Sicut locuti estis, ita fiat. Dimittensque eos, cum abissent, ligavit funiculum coccineum in fenestra.
verses.english: She replied: "As you have spoken, so let it be." Then she sent them away, and when they had gone, she tied the scarlet cord in the window.

verses.latin: Illi vero pergentes, in montem venerunt, et manserunt ibi tribus diebus, donec reverterentur qui fuerant persecuti: quærentes enim per omnes vias, non repererunt.
verses.english: The men then went to the mountain and remained there for three days, until those who had pursued them returned. For the pursuers searched along all the roads but did not find them.

verses.latin: Reversique duo viri descenderunt de monte, et transierunt Jordanem: veneruntque ad Josue filium Nun, et narraverunt ei omnia quæ acciderant sibi,
verses.english: After three days, the two men returned. They descended from the mountain, crossed the Jordan River, and came to Joshua, the son of Nun. They recounted to him everything that had happened to them,

verses.latin: atque dixerunt: Tradidit Dominus omnem terram hanc in manus nostras: cuncti quoque habitatores ejus morore torquescunt.
verses.english: and said: "The Lord has truly delivered all this land into our hands, for all its inhabitants are trembling in fear because of us."

verses.latin: Misit ergo Iosue filius Nun de Settim duos viros exploratores clam, et dixit eis: Ite, et considerate terram et civitatem Jericho. Qui perrexerunt, et ingressi sunt domum mulieris meretricis, nomine Rahab, et manserunt apud eam.
verses.english: So Joshua, the son of Nun, secretly sent two men as spies from the region of Settim. He instructed them: “Go, and carefully observe the land, especially the city of Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a woman who was a harlot, named Rahab, and they stayed there with her.

verses.latin: Et nuntiatum est regi Jericho, quod venissent viri de filiis Israel nocte, explorare terram.
verses.english: And it was reported to the king of Jericho that some men from the children of Israel had come there that night to spy out the land.

verses.latin: Misitque rex Jericho ad Rahab dicens: Educ viros qui ingressi sunt domum tuam, sunt enim exploratores totius terrae.
verses.english: So the king of Jericho sent a message to Rahab, saying: “Bring out the men who have entered your house, for they are spies who have come to examine the whole land.”

verses.latin: Tollensque mulier viros, abscondit, et sic locuta est: Fateor, venerunt ad me quidem, sed nesciebam unde essent:
verses.english: But the woman took the men and hid them. She then spoke: “It is true, some men did come to me, but I did not know where they were from.

verses.latin: cumque clauderetur porta in tenebris, et illi egressi sunt: nescio quo abierunt: persequimini cito, et comprehendetis illos.
verses.english: When the city gate was about to be shut in the darkness of evening, the men left. I do not know where they went. Pursue them quickly, and you will surely overtake them.”

verses.latin: Ipsa autem ascendere fecerat viros in tectum domus suae, et palamverat eos stuppae lini.
verses.english: Now, the woman had actually made the men go up to the roof of her house and had hidden them under stalks of flax that were laid out there.

verses.latin: Qui cum abiissent per viam quae ducit ad vada Jordanis, illico post egressum eorum clausa est porta.
verses.english: The king’s men went out after them on the road that leads to the fords of the Jordan River. Immediately after the king’s men left, the city gate was closed.

verses.latin: Antequam obdormirent viri, ascendit ad eos, et ait:
verses.english: Before the spies lay down to sleep, Rahab went up to them on the roof and spoke, saying:

verses.latin: Scio quod Dominus tradiderit vobis terram hanc, et irruerit in vos terror noster, cunctos enim habitatores terrae hujus inanimavit formido vestri.
verses.english: “I know that the Lord has given this land over to you, and that our terror has fallen upon you. Indeed, the fear of you has completely disheartened all the inhabitants of this land.

verses.latin: Audivimus quod siccaverit Dominus aquas Maris Rubri ad introitum vestrum quando de Ægypto egrederemini: et quæ feceritis duobus regibus Amorrhæorum, qui trans Jordanem erant, Sehon et Og, quos interfecistis.
verses.english: We have heard how the Lord dried up the waters of the Red Sea for you when you came out of Egypt. We also heard what you did to the two kings of the Amorites who were across the Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom you utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Et nullo introeunte in hanc terram, nos perterriti sumus, et obstupuimus: vestri quippe terror irruit in omnes habitatores ejus. Dominus enim Deus vester ipse est Deus in cælo sursum, et in terra deorsum.
verses.english: Since no one else is coming into this land, we are terrified and dismayed. Indeed, the fear of you has fallen upon all its inhabitants. For the Lord your God, He is God in the sky above, and on the earth below.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo jurate mihi per Dominum, quia feci vobiscum misericordiam: ut et vos faciatis misericordiam cum domo patris mei: et detis mihi verum signum:
verses.english: Now therefore, I ask you, swear to me by the Lord, because I have shown mercy to you, that you also will show mercy to my father’s household. Give me a sure sign—

verses.latin: et salvetis patrem meum et matrem, et fratres et sorores meas, et omnia quæ illorum sunt, et eruatis animas nostras de morte.
verses.english: that you will spare my father, my mother, my brothers, my sisters, and all who belong to them, and deliver our lives from death.”

verses.latin: Qui responderunt ei: Anima nostra sit pro vobis in mortem, si tamen non prodideris sermonem hunc nostrum. Cumque tradiderit nobis Dominus terram hanc, faciemus in te misericordiam et veritatem.
verses.english: The men answered her: “May our lives be pledged for yours in death, if only you do not betray this agreement of ours. When the Lord delivers this land to us, we will show you mercy and faithfulness.”

verses.latin: Demisit ergo eos per funem de fenestra: domus enim ejus hærens muro erat.
verses.english: So she let them down by a rope through the window, for her house was built into the city wall.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Montem petere, ne forte occurrant vobis qui missi sunt: ibique latete tribus diebus, donec revertantur: et sic ibitis per viam vestram.
verses.english: And she said to them: “Go to the mountains, lest those who were sent to capture you might find you. Hide there for three days until they return. After that, you can go on your way.”

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ad eam: Innocentes erimus a juramento hoc, quo adjurasti nos,
verses.english: The spies then said to her: “We will be released from this oath which you have made us swear,

verses.latin: si ingredientibus nobis terram hanc, signum fuerit funis hujus scarlate, et ligaveris eum in fenestra per quam demisisti nos: et patrem tuum et matrem, et fratres tuos et omnem cognationem tuam congregaveris in domum tuam.
verses.english: if, when we enter this land, you tie this scarlet rope in the window through which you let us down, and if you gather your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your relatives into your house.

verses.latin: Qui extra domus tuæ atrium, quempiam de suis occiderit, ipse sibi imputabitur: nos autem erimus innocentes. Sive si a vobis fuerimus proditi, et iste sermo nostræ promissionis evanuerit.
verses.english: If anyone from your family ventures outside the doors of your house, his death will be his own responsibility—we will be innocent. However, if we are betrayed by you, then this word of our promise will become null and void.”

verses.latin: Et illa respondit: Sicut locuti estis, ita fiat. Dimittensque eos, abiit: et ligavit funem coccineum in fenestra.
verses.english: And she answered: “May it be as you have spoken.” So she sent them away, and they left. Then she tied the scarlet rope in the window.

verses.latin: Qui profecti, ad montis convenerant tramitem, et manserunt ibi tres dies, donec reverterentur qui fuerant persecuti: quæsierunt enim per omnem viam, et nihil invenerunt.
verses.english: So they departed and came to the mountain pass, and they remained there for three days until those who had pursued them returned. The pursuers had searched along every road, but they found nothing.

verses.latin: Reversique duo viri, descenderunt de monte, et transierunt Jordanem, veneruntque ad Josue filium Nun, et narraverunt ei omnia quæ acciderant sibi:
verses.english: Then the two men returned. They came down from the mountain, crossed the Jordan River, and came to Joshua, the son of Nun. They recounted to him everything that had happened to them.

verses.latin: et dixerunt: Tradidit Dominus in manus nostras omnem terram, et omnes habitatores ejus perterritos sunt formidine nostri.
verses.english: They said: “The Lord has indeed delivered all the land into our hands! And all its inhabitants are terrified with fear of us.”

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Tradidit Dominus in manus nostras omnem terram, et omnes habitatores ejus perterritos sunt formidine nostri.
verses.english: They declared: “The Lord has truly given all the land into our hands, for all its inhabitants are utterly demoralized by the fear of us.”

verses.latin: Surgens ergo Josue de nocte, movit castra de Settim, et venerunt usque ad Jordanem, ipse et omnes filii Israel, et morati sunt ibi tres dies transitu principis.
verses.english: Joshua rose from sleep during the night and moved the camp from Shittim. He, along with all the children of Israel, came to the Jordan River, and they remained there for three days, waiting to begin their crossing.

verses.latin: Et post tres dies, praecones per castrorum circuitum transierunt,
verses.english: After three days, officials went throughout the camp,

verses.latin: et praeceperunt eis, dicentes: Quando videritis arcam fœderis Domini Dei vestri, et sacerdotes stirpis Leviticæ portantes eam, vos quoque consurgite, et sequimini præcedentium vestigia:
verses.english: and commanded them, saying: 'When you see the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord your God, carried by the priests from the tribe of Levi, you also must get up and follow in their footsteps.'

verses.latin: et sit inter vos et arcam spatium cubitorum duum millium: ut procul videre possitis, et scire per quam viam ingrediamini: quia nescitis viam per quam nunquam antea transistis.
verses.english: 'But keep a distance of about two thousand cubits (which is roughly half a mile) between yourselves and the Ark. This way you can see it from afar and know by which path you should go, because you have never passed this way before.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Josue ad populum: Sanctificamini: cras enim fiet inter vos Dominus mirabilia.
verses.english: Then Joshua said to the people: 'Sanctify yourselves, for tomorrow the Lord will perform wonders among you.'

verses.latin: Et ait ad sacerdotes: Tollite arcam fœderis, et præcedite populum. Illi jussis imperiis assumptam portabant.
verses.english: And he said to the priests: 'Take up the Ark of the Covenant and go before the people.' So they took it up, as commanded, and carried it.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Hodie incipiam exaltare te coram omni Israël: ut sciant quod sicut fui cum Moyse, ita et tecum sim.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Joshua: 'Today I will begin to exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they may know that just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you.'

verses.latin: Tu autem præcipe sacerdotibus, qui portant arcam fœderis, et dic eis: Cum ingressi fueritis partem aquæ Jordanis, state in Jordane.
verses.english: 'You, therefore, command the priests who carry the Ark of the Covenant and tell them: 'When you step into the edge of the water of the Jordan, stand still in the Jordan River.''

verses.latin: Dixitque Josue ad filios Israël: Accedite huc, et audite verba Domini Dei vestri.
verses.english: Then Joshua said to the children of Israel: 'Come here, and listen to the words of the Lord your God.'

verses.latin: Et rursum: In hoc, inquit, scietis quod Dominus Deus vivens in medio vestri est, et disperdet in conspectu vestro Chananaeum et Hethæum, Hevæum et Pherezæum, Gergesæum quoque et Amorrhæum et Jebusæum.
verses.english: And again he said: 'By this you shall know that the Lord, the living God, is among you, and that He will certainly drive out before you the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Hivites, the Perizzites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, and the Jebusites.'

verses.latin: Ecce arca fœderis Domini omnis terræ antecedet vos per Jordanem.
verses.english: 'Behold, the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord of all the earth will go before you through the Jordan River.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo eligite duodecim viros de tribubus Israël, singulos per singulas tribus.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, choose twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one man from each tribe.'

verses.latin: Cumque calcaverint pedes sacerdotum, qui portant arcam fœderis Domini universæ terræ, aquas Jordanis, aquæ quæ inferiores sunt, decurrent atque deficient: quæ autem desursum veniunt, in una, et sola, specie consistent.
verses.english: 'And when the feet of the priests who carry the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord of all the earth touch the waters of the Jordan, the waters that flow downstream will be cut off and will fail. But the waters coming down from upstream will stand still, gathering into a single heap.'

verses.latin: Igitur egressus est populus de tabernaculis suis, ut transirent Jordanem: et sacerdotes qui portabant arcam fœderis, pergebant ante eos.
verses.english: So the people left their tents to cross the Jordan, and the priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant went before them.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent usque ad Jordanem, et pedes sacerdotum qui portabant arcam, tingerentur in extrema parte aquæ (Jordanis autem tunc superabat ripas suas tempore messis triticæ),
verses.english: When they had come as far as the Jordan, and the feet of the priests who carried the Ark were dipped into the very edge of the water (for the Jordan River at that time overflowed all its banks during the season of the wheat harvest),

verses.latin: steterunt aquæ descendentes in unum locum, et ad instar montis intumescentes, procul ab urbe Adam quæ est ex parte Sartan: quæ vero inferiores erant, in mare Solitudinis, quod est Mare Salsissimum, descenderunt usquequo omnino deficerent.
verses.english: the waters flowing downstream stood still in one place, rising up like a mountain, far away at the city of Adam, which is on the side of Zaretan. And those waters that flowed further down toward the Dead Sea, which is the Salt Sea, completely drained away.

verses.latin: Populus autem transiebat contra Jericho: et sacerdotes qui portabant arcam fœderis Domini, stabant super siccam humum in medio Jordanis firmiter, omni populo transeunte per arenam: donec omnes transirent Jordanem.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the people crossed over opposite Jericho. And the priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord stood firmly on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan River, while all the people passed over on the dry riverbed, until everyone had crossed the Jordan.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent omnes, dixit Dominus ad Josue:
verses.english: When everyone had completely crossed over, the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Elige duodecim viros singulos de singulis tribibus:
verses.english: 'Choose twelve men, one from each tribe,'

verses.latin: et præcipe eis ut tollant de medio Jordanis alveo, ubi steterunt pedes sacerdotum, duodecim durissimos lapides, quos ponetis in loco castrorum, in quo fixuri estis hæc nocte tabernacula.
verses.english: 'and command them to take twelve very hard stones from the middle of the Jordan Riverbed, from the very place where the priests' feet stood. You shall place these stones in the location of the camp where you are going to pitch your tents tonight.'

verses.latin: Vocavitque Josue duodecim viros, quos de filiis Israël elegerat, singulos de singulis tribibus:
verses.english: So Joshua called the twelve men whom he had chosen from the children of Israel, one from each tribe,

verses.latin: et ait ad eos: Ite ante arcam Domini Dei vestri ad medium Jordanis: et portate singuli lapides in humeris vestris, juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Israël,
verses.english: and he said to them: 'Go before the Ark of the Lord your God to the middle of the Jordan, and each of you take up a stone on your shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel,

verses.latin: ut sit signum inter vos: et quando interrogaverint vos filii vestri cras, dicentes: Quid sibi volunt isti lapides?
verses.english: 'Let this be a sign among you. And when your children ask you tomorrow, saying, 'What do these stones mean?'

verses.latin: respondebitis eis: Defecerunt aquæ Jordanis ante arcam fœderis Domini, cum transiret ipsum: idcirco positi sunt lapides isti in monumentum filiorum Israël usque in æternum.
verses.english: 'then you shall tell them: 'The waters of the Jordan were cut off before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord when it crossed over. For this reason these stones are set as a memorial for the children of Israel forever.''

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo filii Israël sicut præcepit Josue, portantes de medio Jordanis alveo duodecim lapides, sicut ei Dominus dixerat, juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Israël, in locum in quo castra fixerant. Ibi posuerunt eos.
verses.english: So the children of Israel did just as Joshua commanded. They carried twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan Riverbed, just as the Lord had told him, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel, to the place where they had pitched their camp. There they set them down.

verses.latin: Alioe quoque duodecim lapides posuit Josue in medio Jordanis alveo, ubi steterunt pedes sacerdotum qui portabant arcam fœderis: et sunt ibi usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Joshua also set up another twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan Riverbed, where the feet of the priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant had stood. And those stones are there to this very day.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem qui portabant arcam, stabant in mediis Jordanis alveo donec omnia complerentur quæ Josue ad populum ex persona Domini loquens, præceperat: et festinavit populus transire.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the priests who carried the Ark stood in the middle of the Jordan Riverbed until everything was completed that Joshua had commanded the people to do, speaking on behalf of the Lord. And the people hurried to cross over.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent omnes, transivit et arca Domini, et sacerdotes ante populum.
verses.english: When everyone had crossed over, then the Ark of the Lord and the priests crossed over ahead of the people.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Ruben, et Gad, et dimidia tribus Manasse, armati præcedebant filios Israël, sicut eis præceperat Moyses.
verses.english: The sons of Reuben, and Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh, armed for battle, marched ahead of the children of Israel, just as Moses had commanded them.

verses.latin: Quadraginta millia pugnatorum, prompta ad prælium, transierunt per campestria urbis Jericho.
verses.english: About forty thousand armed warriors, ready for battle, crossed over onto the plains of the city of Jericho.

verses.latin: In illo die magnificavit Dominus Josue in conspectu omnis Israël, ut timerent eum sicut timuerant Moysen, omnibus diebus vitæ ejus.
verses.english: On that day, the Lord exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, so that they feared him just as they had feared Moses, for all the days of Joshua's life.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Josue, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Præcipe sacerdotibus, qui portant arcam fœderis, ut ascendant de Jordane.
verses.english: 'Command the priests who carry the Ark of the Covenant to come up out of the Jordan River.'

verses.latin: Et præcepit Josue sacerdotibus, dicens: Ascendite de Jordane.
verses.english: So Joshua commanded the priests, saying: 'Come up out of the Jordan River!'

verses.latin: Cumque ascendissent sacerdotes, qui portabant arcam fœderis Domini, et siccam humum calcare cœpissent, reversæ sunt aquæ Jordanis in alveum suum, et fluebant sicut antea super omnes ripas suas.
verses.english: As the priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord came up, and as soon as the soles of their feet touched the dry ground, the waters of the Jordan returned to their channel and flowed as they did before, overflowing all their banks.

verses.latin: Populus autem ascendit de Jordane decimo die mensis primi, et castrametati sunt in Galgalis in confinio Jericho ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: The people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month and camped at Gilgal, on the eastern border of Jericho.

verses.latin: Duodecim quoque lapides, quos de Jordane tulerant, posuit Josue in Galgalis:
verses.english: And the twelve stones, which they had taken from the Jordan, Joshua set up in Gilgal.

verses.latin: et dixit ad filios Israël: Quando interrogaverint filii vestri cras patres suos, dicentes: Quid sibi volunt lapides isti?
verses.english: And he said to the children of Israel: 'When your children ask their fathers tomorrow, saying, 'What do these stones mean?'

verses.latin: docebitis eos, atque dicetis: Per siccum transivit Israël Jordanem istum,
verses.english: 'then you shall teach them and say: 'Israel crossed over this Jordan River on dry ground,'

verses.latin: quia Dominus Deus vester arefecit aquas ejus in conspectu vestro, donec transiretis: sicut fecerat prius in mari Rubro, quod siccavit ante nos donec transiremus:
verses.english: 'because the Lord your God dried up its waters before you, until you had crossed over, just as He did previously in the Red Sea, which He dried up before us until we crossed.'

verses.latin: Surgens ergo Iosue de nocte, movit castra ab Abel, et venit ad Iordanem ipse, et omnes filii Israel: ibique morati sunt tres dies.
verses.english: Joshua rose early in the morning and moved the camp from Abel. He, along with all the children of Israel, came to the Jordan River. There they stayed for three days.

verses.latin: Quibus transactis, post tres dies, egressi sunt praefecti per castrorum medium,
verses.english: After the three days had passed, the officers went throughout the camp,

verses.latin: et praeceperunt populo, dicentes: Cum videritis arcam foederis Domini Dei vestri, et sacerdotes stirpis Levi portantes eam, vos quoque consurgite, et sequimini praecedentes.
verses.english: and they gave orders to the people, saying: "When you see the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, with the priests of the tribe of Levi carrying it, then you yourselves must also get up and follow them.

verses.latin: Et sit inter vos, et arcam, spatium magnum: ne appropinquetis ad eam. quantum potest habere duo millia cubitorum mensura: et tunc scietis viam per quam ingrediamini: quia prius non ingressi estis viam hanc.
verses.english: But there must be a great distance between you and the ark; do not approach it. This distance should be about two thousand cubits, which is approximately half a mile. Then you will know which way to go, because you have never traveled this path before.

verses.latin: Dixitque Iosue ad populum: Sanctificamini: cras enim fiet inter vos Dominus mirabilia.
verses.english: Joshua also said to the people: "Sanctify yourselves, meaning, prepare yourselves spiritually and physically. For tomorrow the Lord will do wonders among you."

verses.latin: Et ait ad sacerdotes: Tollite arcam fœderis, et precedite populum. Qui fecerunt ut sibi fuerat imperatum: et tulerunt arcam, et præcedebant eos.
verses.english: And he said to the priests: "Take up the ark of the covenant and go before the people." So they did as they were commanded; they took up the ark and went ahead of them.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Iosue: Hodie incipiam exaltare te coram omni Israel, ut sciant quod sicut fui cum Moyse, ita et tecum sim.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Joshua: "Today I will begin to exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they may know that just as I was with Moses, so I will also be with you.

verses.latin: Praecipe sacerdotibus, qui portant arcam foederis, et dic: Cum ingressi fueritis partem aquæ Iordanis, state in Iordane.
verses.english: Command the priests who carry the ark of the covenant and tell them: 'When you have entered part of the water of the Jordan River, stand still in the Jordan itself.'"

verses.latin: Dixitque Iosue ad filios Israel: Accedite huc, et audite verba Domini Dei vestri.
verses.english: Joshua then said to the children of Israel: "Come here and listen to the words of the Lord your God."

verses.latin: Et rursum: In hoc, inquit, scietis quod Deus vivens in medio vestri est, et disperdat in conspectu vestro Chananaeum et Hethæum, et Hevæum et Pherezæum, et Gergesæum quoque et Amorrhæum, et Iebusæum.
verses.english: And he continued: "By this, you will know that the living God is in your midst, and that He will certainly drive out before you the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Hivite, and the Perizzite, and also the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Jebusite.

verses.latin: Ecce arca foederis Domini omnis terræ antecedet vos per Iordanem.
verses.english: Behold, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth will go before you through the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo eligite duodecim viros de tribubus Israel, singulos per singulas tribus.
verses.english: Now therefore, choose twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one man from each tribe.

verses.latin: Cumque tetigerint pedes sacerdotum, qui portant arcam Domini Dei omnis terræ, aquas Iordanis, aquæ quæ inferiores sunt, decurrent atque deficient: quæ autem desuper veniunt, in una, in loco consistant aquæ congerie.
verses.english: And when the feet of the priests who carry the ark of the Lord, the God of all the earth, touch the waters of the Jordan, the waters that flow downstream will be cut off and will run dry. But the waters coming down from upstream will stand still, forming a single heap in one place.

verses.latin: Igitur egressus est populus de tabernaculis suis, ut transiret Iordanem, et sacerdotes qui portabant arcam fœderis, pergebant ante eos.
verses.english: So the people left their tents to cross the Jordan, and the priests who carried the ark of the covenant went ahead of them.

verses.latin: Cumque ingressi fuissent Iordanem, et pedes sacerdotum, qui portabant arcam, tinguirentur in extrema parte aquæ (Iordanis autem consueverat omnes ripas suas implere tempore messis tritici) :
verses.english: And as soon as they entered the Jordan, and the feet of the priests who carried the ark were dipped in the edge of the water—for the Jordan usually overflows all its banks during the time of the wheat harvest—

verses.latin: steterunt aquæ descendentes in unum locum, et ad instar montis intumescentes longe, ab urbe Adom, quæ est in partibus Sartan: quæ vero inferiores erant, in mare Solitudinis (quod nunc vocatur Mortuum) decurrere, donec penitus deficerent. Populus autem contra Iericho trans Iordanem stetit.
verses.english: the waters coming down from upstream stood still in one heap, swelling up like a mountain far away, near the city of Adam, which is in the region of Zaretan. And the waters that were flowing downstream continued to flow into the Sea of the Desert (which is now called the Dead Sea) until they completely disappeared. Meanwhile, the people stood opposite Jericho, across the Jordan.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes vero, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, stabant super aridam humum in medio Iordanis firmiter, omnisque populus per siccum alveum transibat: donec omnes transirent Iordanem.
verses.english: But the priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord stood firmly on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan River. And all the people passed over on the dry riverbed until everyone had completely crossed the Jordan.

verses.latin: Cumque transisset omnis populus Jordanem, locutus est Dominus ad Josue, dicens:
verses.english: After all the people of Israel had completely finished crossing the Jordan River, the Lord God spoke to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Elige duodecim viros de populo, singulos de singulis tribubus,
verses.english: 'Choose twelve men from among the Israelite people—one man specifically from each of the twelve tribes.'

verses.latin: et praecipe eis atque dic: Tollite hinc de medio Jordanis alvei, ubi steterunt pedes sacerdotum firmi, duodecim lapides, quos ponetis in loco castrorum, ubi fixeritis hac nocte tentoria.
verses.english: 'And command them, saying: "Take up twelve large stones from the very middle of the Jordan River's bed, from the precise spot where the priests' feet stood firm and dry. You are to carry these stones and set them down at the campsite where you will pitch your tents tonight."'

verses.latin: Vocavitque Josue duodecim viros, quos paraverat de filiis Israel, singulos de singulis tribubus.
verses.english: So Joshua called the twelve men whom he had prepared and appointed from among the sons of Israel—one man chosen from each of the tribes.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Ite ante arcam Domini Dei vestri ad medium Jordanis: et unusquisque vestrum humero suo tollat lapidem, juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Israel,
verses.english: And Joshua said to them, 'Go ahead of the Ark of the Lord your God, into the very middle of the Jordan River. Let each one of you then lift a large stone onto his shoulder, so there will be one stone for each of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel.'

verses.latin: ut sit signum inter vos: et quando interrogaverint vos filii vestri cras, dicentes: Quid sibi volunt isti lapides?
verses.english: 'These stones are to serve as a perpetual sign among you. In the future, when your children ask you, saying: "What do these stones mean?"'

verses.latin: respondebitis eis: Quoniam defecerunt aquae Jordanis ante arcam foederis Domini, cum transiret ipsum: idcirco positi sunt lapides isti in monimentum filiis Israel usque in aeternum.
verses.english: 'You are to answer them by saying: "It is because the waters of the Jordan River were completely cut off and dried up before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, when it crossed over the Jordan! These stones were set up as a permanent memorial for the sons of Israel, to last for all time."

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo filii Israel sicut praecepit eis Josue: tollentes duodecim lapides de medio Jordanis alvei, ut eis Dominus imperaverat, juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Israel, in locum in quo castrametati sunt, posueruntque eos ibi.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel did exactly as Joshua had commanded them. They took twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan River's bed, just as the Lord God Himself had commanded them, one stone for each of the tribes of Israel. They carried them to their campsite and set them up there.

verses.latin: Alioquin et Josue duodecim lapides posuit in medio Jordanis alvei, ubi steterant pedes sacerdotum, qui portabant arcam foederis: et sunt ibi usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Furthermore, Joshua also set up another twelve stones in the very middle of the Jordan River, at the precise spot where the feet of the priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant had stood dry. Those stones remain there even to this very day as a witness.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem, qui portabant arcam, stabant in medio Jordanis, donec omnia complerentur quae jusserat Dominus Josue, ut loqueretur ad populum, juxta omnia quae locutus est Moyses ad Josue: et festinavit populus, et transiit.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the priests who were carrying the Ark remained standing firmly in the middle of the Jordan River. They stood there until everything the Lord God had commanded Joshua to tell the people was fully accomplished, just as Moses had instructed Joshua concerning all these things. And the people quickly hurried across the dry riverbed.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent omnes, transivit et arca Domini, et sacerdotes, perrexeruntque ante populum.
verses.english: After all the Israelite people had completely crossed the river, the Ark of the Lord and the priests then moved from the riverbed and crossed over to the land, proceeding to lead the people forward.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Ruben, et Gad, et dimidia tribus Manasse, praecesserunt filios Israel, sicut eis praeceperat Moyses.
verses.english: And the sons of Reuben, the sons of Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh, marched ahead of the other sons of Israel, just as Moses had specifically commanded them to do earlier.

verses.latin: Quadraginta millia pugnatorum per turmas suas, et cateras, expediti ad praelium, transierunt ad campestria Jericho.
verses.english: About forty thousand armed men, organized into their various companies and divisions, fully equipped and ready for battle, crossed over to the plains outside Jericho.

verses.latin: In illo die magnificavit Dominus Josue in conspectu omnis Israel, ut timerent eum sicut timuerant Moysen, omnibus diebus vitae illius.
verses.english: On that very day, the Lord God exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel. From that point on, the people honored him and held him in reverent awe, just as they had honored Moses, for all the days of Joshua's life.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Josue, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Praecipe sacerdotibus, qui portant arcam foederis, ut ascendant de Jordane.
verses.english: 'Command the priests who are carrying the Ark of the Covenant to come up out of the Jordan River bed.'

verses.latin: Et praecepit Josue sacerdotibus, dicens: Ascendite de Jordane.
verses.english: So Joshua immediately commanded the priests, saying: 'Come up now, out of the Jordan River!'

verses.latin: Cumque ascendissent sacerdotes, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, de medio alvei Jordanis, et plantata essent vestigia pedum eorum in sicca terra, reversae sunt aquae Jordanis in alveum suum, et fluebant sicut prius super omnes ripas suas.
verses.english: And as soon as the priests, who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, came up out of the middle of the Jordan River's bed, and the soles of their feet were firmly planted on the dry ground of the bank, the waters of the Jordan immediately rushed back into their channel. And the river began to flow over all its banks again, just as it had been flowing before the miracle.

verses.latin: Populus autem ascendit de Jordane decimo die mensis primi, et castrametatus est in Galgalis, ad orientalem plagam urbis Jericho.
verses.english: The Israelite people crossed up out of the Jordan River on the tenth day of the first month. They then set up their camp at Gilgal, which is located on the eastern side of the city of Jericho.

verses.latin: Duodecim quoque lapides, quos de Jordanis alveo tulerant, posuit Josue in Galgalis.
verses.english: And Joshua set up those twelve stones, which they had taken from the Jordan River's bed, at Gilgal, as a permanent monument.

verses.latin: Et ait ad filios Israel: Quando interrogaverint filii vestri patres suos, cras, dicentes: Quid sibi volunt lapides isti?
verses.english: Joshua then spoke to the sons of Israel and said: 'In the future, when your children ask their fathers, saying: "What do these stones mean?"'

verses.latin: docebitis eos, atque dicetis: Sicco pede transiit Israel Jordanem istum,
verses.english: 'You are to teach them and explain: "The Israelite people crossed over this Jordan River on completely dry ground—a great miracle!"'

verses.latin: quemadmodum fecit Dominus Deus vester in mari Rubro, quod siccavit usque dum transiremus,
verses.english: '...just as the Lord your God did at the Red Sea, which He completely dried up before us until we had all finished crossing through it.'

verses.latin: ut sciant omnes terrae populi fortissimam Domini manum: et ut vos quoque timeatis Dominum Deum vestrum cunctis diebus.
verses.english: '...so that all the peoples of the earth may know and understand the incredibly powerful hand of the Lord God—and so that you, the Israelite people, may also revere and fear the Lord your God for all your days, always remembering His mighty acts.'

verses.latin: Cum ergo transissent omnes, reversus est Dominus ad Josue, dicens:
verses.english: After everyone had finished crossing over the Jordan River, the Lord God spoke to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Elige duodecim viros de populo, singulos per singulas tribus:
verses.english: “Choose twelve men from the people, one man for each of the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.latin: et praecipe eis ut tollant de medio Jordanis alveo, ubi steterunt pedes sacerdotum, duodecim durissimos lapides, quos ponatis in loco, in quo fixuri estis nocte hac tentoria.
verses.english: Then command them to take twelve very hard stones from the middle of the Jordan River, from the exact spot where the priests’ feet stood still. You are to place these stones in the location where you will set up your tents tonight.”

verses.latin: Vocavitque Josue duodecim viros, quos elegerat de filiis Israel, singulos de singulis tribubus:
verses.english: So Joshua called the twelve men he had selected from the sons of Israel, one man from each tribe.

verses.latin: et dixit ad eos: Ite ante arcam Domini Dei vestri ad medium Jordanis: et portate singuli singulos lapides in humeris vestris, juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Israel,
verses.english: And he told them, “Go before the Ark of the Lord your God into the middle of the Jordan River. Each of you must carry one stone on your shoulder, corresponding to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: ut sit signum in medio vestri: et cum interrogaverint vos filii vestri cras, dicentes: Quid sibi volunt isti lapides?
verses.english: This is to be a sign among you, so that when your children ask you in the future, saying, ‘What do these stones mean?’

verses.latin: Respondebitis eis: Defecerunt aquae Jordanis ante arcam foederis Domini, cum transiret ipsum: idcirco positi sunt lapides isti in monumetum filiorum Israel usque in aeternum.
verses.english: You will answer them: ‘The waters of the Jordan were cut off and stopped flowing before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, when it crossed over the river. That is why these stones are set as a memorial for the sons of Israel forevermore.’”

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo filii Israel sicut praecepit eis Josue, portantes de medio Jordanis alveo duodecim lapides, sicut praeceperat Dominus ad Josue, juxta numerum tribuum filiorum Israel, usque ad locum in quo tentoria fixuri erant. ibique posuerunt eos.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel did exactly as Joshua commanded them. They took twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan River, just as the Lord God had commanded Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel, and carried them to the place where they were going to set up their tents for the night. And there they set them down.

verses.latin: Alios quoque duodecim lapides posuit Josue in medio Jordanis alveo, ubi steterunt pedes sacerdotum, qui portabant arcam foederis: et sunt ibi usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Joshua also set up another twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan River, right where the feet of the priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant had stood. These stones remain there even to this present day.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem, qui portabant arcam, stabant in medio Jordanis, donec omnia complerentur quae jusserat Dominus Josue, ut loqueretur ad populum, sicut Moyses praeceperat illi: et populus festinavit, et transiit.
verses.english: The priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant stood firm in the middle of the Jordan, until everything the Lord God had commanded Joshua to tell the people was completed, just as Moses had instructed him. And the people quickly crossed over.

verses.latin: Cumque transisset omnis populus, transivit et arca Domini, et sacerdotes coram populo.
verses.english: After all the people had completely crossed over, the Ark of the Lord God and the priests crossed over as well, moving in front of the people.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Ruben, et Gad, et dimidia tribus Manasse, praecedebant filios Israel, sicut eis praeceperat Moyses.
verses.english: Also, the sons of Reuben, the sons of Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh went ahead of the other sons of Israel, just as Moses had commanded them to do.

verses.latin: Quadraginta millia expedito agmine, per turmas et cuneos, praecesserant coram Domino in pugnam, ad campestria urbis Jericho.
verses.english: About forty thousand armed men, arrayed in battle formations, crossed over before the Lord God for battle on the plains near the city of Jericho.

verses.latin: In illo die magnificavit Dominus Josue in conspectu omnis Israel, ut timerent eum sicut timuerant Moysen omnibus diebus vitae ejus.
verses.english: On that very day, the Lord God made Joshua great in the sight of all Israel. So the people feared him, just as they had feared Moses throughout all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue:
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Joshua again, saying:

verses.latin: Praecipe sacerdotibus, qui portant arcam foederis, ut ascendant de Jordane.
verses.english: “Command the priests who are carrying the Ark of the Covenant to come up out of the Jordan River.”

verses.latin: Qui praecepit eis, dicens: Ascendite de Jordane.
verses.english: So Joshua gave them the command, saying, “Come up out of the Jordan River.”

verses.latin: Cumque ascendissent sacerdotes, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, de medio alveo Jordanis, et subjecta fuissent eorum vestigia aridae terrae, reversae sunt aquae Jordanis in locum suum, et fluebant sicut prius super omnes ripas suas.
verses.english: As soon as the priests who were carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord God came up from the middle of the Jordan River, and their feet touched the dry ground on the other bank, the waters of the Jordan returned to their usual course. The river flowed as it did before, covering all its banks.

verses.latin: Populus autem ascendit de Jordane decimo die mensis primi, et castrametatus est in Galgalis, in parte orientali urbis Jericho.
verses.english: The people themselves came up from the Jordan River on the tenth day of the first month. They camped at Gilgal, which is on the eastern side of the city of Jericho.

verses.latin: Duodecim quoque lapides, quos de Jordanis alveo tulerant, posuit Josue in Galgalis,
verses.english: Joshua also set up the twelve stones, which they had taken from the middle of the Jordan River, at Gilgal.

verses.latin: et ait ad filios Israel: Cum interrogaverint filii vestri patres suos in tempore futuro, dicentes: Quid sibi volunt lapides isti?
verses.english: And he said to the sons of Israel, “When your children ask their fathers in the time to come, saying, ‘What do these stones mean to us?’

verses.latin: Docebitis eos, atque dicetis: Per arentem alveum transiit Israel Jordanem istum,
verses.english: You will instruct them and say: ‘Israel crossed over this Jordan River on dry ground through the riverbed.

verses.latin: siccato Domino Deo nostro aquas ejus in conspectu nostro, donec transiremus:
verses.english: The Lord our God dried up its waters before us until we had completely crossed over.

verses.latin: sicut fecerat quondam in mari Rubro, quod siccavit ante nos, donec transiremus, ut discant omnes terrarum populi fortissimam Domini manum, et ut vos ipsi semper timeatis Dominum Deum vestrum.
verses.english: This was just like what He did once before at the Red Sea, which He also dried up before us until we had completely crossed over. This miracle happened so that all the peoples of the earth may learn that the hand of the Lord God is very mighty, and so that you yourselves may always revere the Lord your God.’”

verses.latin: Postquam audierunt omnes reges Amorrhæorum, qui habitabant trans Jordanem ad occidentalem plagam, et cuncti reges Chananæorum, qui habitabant juxta mare, quod siccasset Dominus fluenta Jordanis coram filiis Israel, donec transirent, consternatum est cor eorum, et pertimuerunt, nec voluit ultra in eis ullus residere spiritus, timentium introitum filiorum Israel.
verses.english: After all the kings of the Amorites, who lived on the western side of the Jordan River, and all the kings of the Canaanites, who lived by the sea, heard that the Lord had dried up the waters of the Jordan River before the children of Israel, until they had all crossed over, their hearts were dismayed and they were greatly afraid. There was no more courage left in them, because they feared the entry of the children of Israel into their land.

verses.latin: In tempore illo ait Dominus ad Josue: Fac tibi cultros lapideos, et secundo circumcidere filios Israel.
verses.english: At that time, the Lord said to Joshua: "Make flint knives for yourself, and circumcise the children of Israel a second time."

verses.latin: Fecitque Josue cultros lapideos de petra acutissima, et circumcidit filios Israel in colle præputiorum.
verses.english: So Joshua made very sharp flint knives from a rock, and he circumcised the children of Israel on the Hill of Foreskins.

verses.latin: Hæc autem est causa secundæ circumcisionis: omnis populus, qui egressus est de Ægypto generis masculini, universi pugnatores, mortui sunt in solitudine per longissimas vias.
verses.english: Now, this is the reason for the second circumcision: all the male people who had come out of Egypt, all the fighting men, had died in the wilderness along the very long journey.

verses.latin: Hi omnes circumcisi fuerant in Ægypto: sed in deserto, postquam egressi sunt de Ægypto, incircumcisi nati sunt.
verses.english: All these men had been circumcised in Egypt; but in the desert, after they had left Egypt, their children were born uncircumcised.

verses.latin: Quadraginta enim annis filii Israel ambulaverunt per desertum, donec consumeretur omnis multitudo pugnatorum, qui egressi sunt de Ægypto, et non audierant vocem Domini: quibus juraverat Dominus ut non ostenderet eis terram lacte et melle manantem, terram optima et uberrimam.
verses.english: For the children of Israel walked through the desert for forty years, until all the multitude of fighting men who had come out of Egypt were consumed—who had not obeyed the voice of the Lord. The Lord had sworn to them that He would not show them the land flowing with milk and honey, a most excellent and fertile land.

verses.latin: Horum igitur filii in locum successerunt patrum, et ipsi circumcisi sunt a Josue: quia sicut nati fuerant, in præputio erant, nec eos aliquis in via circumciderat.
verses.english: Therefore, the sons of these men succeeded their fathers, and they themselves were circumcised by Joshua, because they were still in their foreskins just as they had been born, and no one had circumcised them on the journey.

verses.latin: Postquam autem omnes circumcisi sunt, manserunt in eodem loco castrorum, donec sanarentur.
verses.english: After everyone was circumcised, they remained in the same place in the camp until they recovered.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Hodie abstuli opprobrium Ægypti a vobis. Et vocatum est nomen loci illius Galgala usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Joshua: "Today, I have rolled away the disgrace of Egypt from you." And the name of that place has been called Gilgal even to this present day.

verses.latin: Mansuerunt itaque filii Israel in Galgalis, et fecerunt Phase quartadecima die mensis ad vesperum in campestribus Jericho:
verses.english: So the children of Israel remained in Gilgal and celebrated the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month, in the evening, on the plains of Jericho.

verses.latin: et comederunt de frugibus terræ die altero, azymos panes, et polentam ejusdem anni.
verses.english: And on the very next day, they ate from the produce of the land: unleavened bread and parched grain from that very year.

verses.latin: Defecitque manna, postquam comederant de frugibus terræ, nec usi sunt ultra illo cibariæ Israelis, sed comedebant de frugibus præsentis anni terræ Chanaan.
verses.english: And the manna ceased, after they had eaten from the produce of the land. The children of Israel no longer used it as food, but instead ate from the produce of that current year from the land of Canaan.

verses.latin: Cum ergo esset Josue in agro Jericho, levavit oculos, et vidit virum stantem contra se, et evaginatum tenentem gladium: et perterritus Josue, abiit ad eum, et ait: Nostri es, an adversariorum?
verses.english: While Joshua was in the field near Jericho, he lifted his eyes and saw a man standing opposite him, holding a drawn sword. Joshua, terrified, went to him and said: "Are you one of us, or one of our enemies?"

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Absque hoc, ego sum princeps exercitus Domini, et nunc venio. Josue procidens in faciem terræ, adoravit, et ait: Quid Dominus meus loquitur ad servum suum?
verses.english: He replied: "Neither. I am the commander of the army of the Lord, and now I have come." Joshua fell on his face to the earth, worshipped, and said: "What does my Lord say to His servant?"

verses.latin: Et ait princeps exercitus Domini ad Josue: Solve calceamentum de pedibus tuis: locus enim in quo stas, sanctus est. Fecitque Josue sicut sibi fuerat imperatum.
verses.english: And the commander of the Lord's army said to Joshua: "Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground." And Joshua did as he had been commanded.

verses.latin: Iericho autem clausa erat atque munita, ob metum filiorum Israhel, et nemo ingrediebatur vel egrediebatur.
verses.english: Jericho was completely shut down and fortified because of the fear of the Israelites—the inhabitants had locked themselves inside, and no one could enter or leave.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Iosue: Ecce tradidi in manu tua Iericho et regem eius, omnesque fortes viros.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Joshua, saying, "Listen, I have given Jericho into your power, along with its king and all of its mighty warriors."

verses.latin: Circuite urbem omnes viri bellatores semel per diem, sic facietis sex diebus.
verses.english: "All of you warriors, march around the city once each day, and you shall do this for six days."

verses.latin: Et septem sacerdotes tollent septem bucinas quarum usus est ad jubilaeum ante arcam foederis. Septimo autem die septies circuibitis civitatem, et sacerdotes clangent bucinis.
verses.english: "And seven priests shall carry seven ram's horn trumpets—the kind used for the Jubilee celebration—and they shall walk before the Ark of the Covenant. But on the seventh day, you shall march around the city seven times, and the priests shall blow their trumpets loudly."

verses.latin: Cumque insonuerit buccina longi et tracti sonitus, et in auribus vestris insonuerit, concinet omnis populus vociferatione maxima, et muri civitatis corruent usque ad fundamentum, et intrabitis per singulos in locum qui contra vos fuerit.
verses.english: "Then, when the ram's horn trumpet sounds a long and sustained blast, and it rings in your ears, all the people shall shout with a great roar, and the city walls will collapse completely, down to their very foundations. Then, each man shall enter the city straight ahead, wherever he stands."

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo Iosue sacerdotes, et dixit ad eos: Tollite arcam foederis, et septem alii sacerdotes bucinas jubilaeas portate coram arca Domini.
verses.english: So Joshua called the priests and said to them, "Take up the Ark of the Covenant, and let seven other priests carry the Jubilee ram's horn trumpets before the Ark of the Lord."

verses.latin: Et ad populum, vade, inquit, et circuite civitatem, armati praecedant arcam Domini.
verses.english: And to the people he said, "Go, and march around the city. Let the armed men lead the way before the Ark of the Lord."

verses.latin: Itaque ut praeceperat Iosue, portante populo arcam Domini, et septem sacerdotes septem bucinas jubilaeas tenentes, ante arcam Domini pergebant, et canebant.
verses.english: So, just as Joshua had commanded, while the people carried the Ark of the Lord, seven priests, holding seven ram's horn trumpets, went forward before the Ark of the Lord and blew their trumpets.

verses.latin: Et armati praecedebant ante sacerdotes qui bucinas tenebant: et reliquum vulgus sequebatur agmen, et clangebant buccinis.
verses.english: The armed men went first, before the priests who carried the trumpets. The rest of the multitude followed the procession, and the trumpets continued to sound.

verses.latin: Praeceperat autem Iosue populo, dicens: Non clamabitis, nec audietur vox vestra, nec ullus sermo ex ore vestro egredietur, donec veniat dies in quo dicam vobis: Clamate, et vociferabimini.
verses.english: Joshua had commanded the people, saying, "You shall not shout, and your voice shall not be heard, nor shall any word come out of your mouth, until the day I tell you: 'Shout!' Then you shall shout loudly."

verses.latin: Circuivit ergo arca Domini civitatem semel in die, et reversa in castra mansit ibi.
verses.english: So the Ark of the Lord marched around the city once each day, and then returned to the camp and remained there overnight.

verses.latin: Iosue quoque de nocte consurgens, eduxit sacerdotes, et arcam Domini, et septem sacerdotes septem bucinas jubilaeas, ante arcam Domini.
verses.english: Joshua also rose early in the morning, and brought out the priests and the Ark of the Lord. The seven priests carried the seven ram's horn trumpets before the Ark of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et armati praecedebant, et reliquum vulgus sequebatur agmen, et clangebant buccinis.
verses.english: And the armed men went ahead, and the rest of the multitude followed the procession, and the trumpets sounded continually.

verses.latin: Circuieruntque civitatem secundo die semel, et reversi sunt in castra. Sic fecerunt sex diebus.
verses.english: On the second day, they marched around the city once, and then returned to the camp. They did this for six days.

verses.latin: Cumque in septimo die a nocte surrexissent, et inluxisset jam dies, circuierunt urbem sicut praedictum fuerat, septies.
verses.english: And when they rose early on the seventh day, just as dawn was breaking, they marched around the city seven times, as it had been commanded.

verses.latin: Et cum septimo gyro sacerdotes clangerent bucinis, dixit Iosue ad omnem Israhel: Clamate: tradidit enim Dominus vobis civitatem.
verses.english: And when the priests blew their trumpets loudly on the seventh circuit, Joshua said to all of Israel, "Shout! For the Lord has given you the city."

verses.latin: Sitque civitas haec anathema, et omnia quae in ea sunt, Domino: sola Rahab meretrix vivat, et omnes qui cum ea in domo fuerint: quoniam abscondit nuntios quos direximus.
verses.english: "This city, and everything in it, shall be completely consecrated to the Lord for destruction—except for Rahab the prostitute, who shall live, along with everyone who is in her house. This is because she hid the messengers whom we sent."

verses.latin: Vos autem cavete ne quippiam de anathemate tollatis, et sitis transgressoris, et totis castris Israhel peccatum et conturbatio.
verses.english: "But as for you, be careful not to take anything from what is consecrated for destruction. If you do, you will become transgressors, bringing sin and trouble upon the entire camp of Israel."

verses.latin: Omne namque argentum et aurum, et vasa aerea atque ferrea, Domino consecrata sunt, in thesauros Domini.
verses.english: "For all the silver and gold, and the vessels of bronze and iron, are consecrated to the Lord and shall be placed in the Lord's treasury."

verses.latin: Igitur omni vociferante populo, et clangentibus tubis, postquam in aures multitudinis vox et sonitus pertigit, statim muri corruerunt: et ascendit unusquisque per locum qui contra se erat, et ceperunt civitatem.
verses.english: So, when all the people shouted and the trumpets sounded, and as soon as the multitude heard the sound of the shout and the trumpets, the walls immediately collapsed. Then, each man went straight up into the city from where he stood, and they captured the city.

verses.latin: Et occiderunt omnia quae in ea erant, a viro usque ad mulierem, ab infante usque ad senem. Boves quoque et oves et asinos in ore gladii percusserunt.
verses.english: And they utterly destroyed everything in the city with the edge of the sword, from man to woman, from infant to elder. They also struck down all the cattle, sheep, and donkeys.

verses.latin: Duobus autem viris qui exploratores fuerant, dixit Iosue: Intrate in domum mulieris meretricis, et producite eam, et omnia quae illius sunt, sicut jurastis ei.
verses.english: But Joshua said to the two men who had been spies, "Go into the house of that prostitute woman, and bring her out, along with everything that belongs to her, just as you swore to her."

verses.latin: Ingressique juvenes eduxerunt Rahab, et parentes ejus, propinquos omnesque de genere illius, et extra castra Israhel collocaverunt.
verses.english: So the young men went in and brought out Rahab, her parents, her relatives, and all those of her family. They placed them outside the camp of Israel.

verses.latin: Urbem vero et omnia quae in ea erant, succenderunt, absque argento et auro et vasis aereis et ferreis, quae in thesauros domus Domini consecrarunt.
verses.english: They then burned the city and everything in it with fire, except for the silver, gold, and the vessels of bronze and iron, which they consecrated into the treasury of the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Rahab autem meretricem, et domum patris ejus, et omnia quae habebat, Iosue fecit vivere, et mansit in medio Israhel usque in praesentem diem, eo quod absconderit nuntios quos miserat, ut explorarent Iericho. In tempore illo juravit Iosue, dicens:
verses.english: But Joshua allowed Rahab the prostitute, and her father's household, and all that she possessed, to live. She has remained among Israel to this very day, because she hid the messengers whom he had sent to scout out Jericho. At that time, Joshua swore an oath, saying:

verses.latin: Maledictus homo coram Domino, qui suscitavit, et aedificaverit civitatem Iericho: in primogenito suo fundabit eam, et in novissimo liberorum suorum statuet portas ejus.
verses.english: "Cursed be the man before the Lord who rises up and rebuilds this city, Jericho. He shall lay its foundation at the cost of his firstborn son, and set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son."

verses.latin: Fuit ergo Dominus cum Iosue, et nomen ejus vulgatum est in omni terra.
verses.english: So the Lord was with Joshua, and his renown spread throughout all the land.

verses.latin: Iericho autem clausa erat atque munita, ob metum filiorum Israel, et nemo ingrediebatur vel egrediebatur.
verses.english: Now, the city of Jericho had been completely closed off and heavily fortified. This was due to the fear of the Sons of Israel. As a result, no one could enter or exit the city gates.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Iosue: Ecce tradidi in manu tua Iericho et regem eius omnesque fortes viros.
verses.english: But the Lord said to Joshua: "Listen closely! I have already given Jericho into your power, along with its king and all of its strongest warriors."

verses.latin: Circuite omnes bellatores civitatem semel per diem: sic facietis sex diebus.
verses.english: "All of you warriors must march around the city once each day. You must do this for six days."

verses.latin: Et septem sacerdotes tollant septem bucinas quarum usus est in Iubilæo, et in septima die circuite civitatem septem vicibus, et sacerdotes clangent buccinis.
verses.english: "And seven priests must carry seven trumpets—the kind used for the Jubilee celebration. On the seventh day, you must march around the city seven times, and the priests must blow their trumpets loudly."

verses.latin: Cumque insonuerit vox bucinæ longior atque concitatior, et in auribus vestris insonuerit, concinite omnes simul clamore maximo, et muri funditus corruent, et intrabit unusquisque per locum contra se.
verses.english: "When the trumpet sounds a long and more urgent blast, and it rings in your ears, then every one of you must shout together with a very loud cry. At that very moment, the city walls will utterly collapse, and each man can then enter the city directly from where he stands."

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo Iosue sacerdotes et dixit ad eos: Tollite arcam fœderis: et septem alii sacerdotes bucinas Iubilæas septem portate coram arca Domini.
verses.english: So Joshua summoned the priests and said to them: "Lift up the Ark of the Covenant. And let seven other priests carry seven Jubilee trumpets ahead of the Lord's Ark."

verses.latin: Ad populum quoque ait: Ite, et circuite civitatem, armati præcedant arcam Domini.
verses.english: He also said to the people: "Go now, and march around the city. Let the armed men go ahead of the Lord's Ark."

verses.latin: Igitur, ut Iosue præceperat, septem sacerdotes septem bucinis, quibus in Iubilæo concini solet, incedebant coram Domino, et buccinis sonabant, et arca fœderis Domini sequebatur eos.
verses.english: Therefore, just as Joshua had commanded, the seven priests with the seven trumpets—the type used for the Jubilee celebration—marched forward before the Lord, blowing their trumpets. And the Ark of the Lord's Covenant followed behind them.

verses.latin: Et armati præcedebant exercitum, et reliquum vulgus sequebatur arcam, et omnia simul bucinis cantabantur.
verses.english: The armed men marched ahead of the main army, and the rest of the people followed the Ark. All of them marched together to the sound of the trumpets.

verses.latin: Præceperat autem Iosue populo, dicens: Ne clametis, nec audiat vocem vestram quisquam, nisi cum dixero vobis: Clamate. Et tunc vociferamini.
verses.english: But Joshua had given a specific command to the people, saying: "Do not shout, and do not let anyone hear your voice until I tell you, 'Shout!' Only then are you to raise your voices loudly."

verses.latin: Circuivit ergo arca Domini civitatem semel in die, et reversa in castra, mansit ibi.
verses.english: So the Ark of the Lord marched around the city once that day. Then it returned to the camp and remained there for the night.

verses.latin: Igitur Iosue de nocte consurgens, sacerdotes arcam Domini, et alios septem sacerdotes septem bucinas quarum in Iubilæo usus est, ante arcam Domini ferre præcepit.
verses.english: So Joshua rose early in the morning. He commanded the priests to carry the Ark of the Lord and the seven other priests to carry the seven Jubilee trumpets ahead of the Lord's Ark.

verses.latin: Armati quoque præcedebant, et reliquum vulgus sequebatur arcam, et bucinis clangebatur.
verses.english: The armed men also marched ahead, and the rest of the people followed the Ark, as the trumpets were continuously blown.

verses.latin: Et circuierunt civitatem secundo die semel, reversique sunt ad castra. Sic fecerunt sex diebus.
verses.english: And they marched around the city once on the second day, and then returned to the camp. They did this same thing for six days in total.

verses.latin: Die autem septimo, diluculo consurgentes, circumierunt civitatem, sicut in gyrum facere consueverant, septem vicibus: in ipso die panes comederunt.
verses.english: But on the seventh day, they rose very early at dawn and marched around the city seven times, just as they had accustomed themselves to do. On that very day, they also ate bread (after the march).

verses.latin: Cumque septimo gyro sacerdotes clangerent buccinis, dixit Iosue ad omnem Israelem: Clamate: tradidit enim vobis Dominus civitatem.
verses.english: And when the priests blew their trumpets on the seventh circuit, Joshua said to all the people of Israel: "Now, shout! For the Lord has delivered the city into your hands!"

verses.latin: Sitque civitas hæc anathema, et omnia quæ in ea sunt, Domino: sola Rahab meretrix vivat cum omnibus qui cum ea in domo sunt: quia abscondit nuntios quos direximus.
verses.english: "And this city, along with everything in it, must be utterly devoted to destruction for the Lord. Only Rahab, the prostitute, is to live, along with everyone who is with her in her house. This is because she hid the messengers whom we sent."

verses.latin: Vos autem cavete ne quid de anathematis auferatis, et sitis anathemate et totum castrum Israel, et perturbemini.
verses.english: "But you, beware that you do not take anything from what is devoted to destruction. If you do, you yourselves will become devoted to destruction, along with the entire camp of Israel, and you will bring trouble upon yourselves."

verses.latin: Omne argentum et aurum, et vasa ænea atque ferrea, consecrata sint Domino, in thesauros Domini reponantur.
verses.english: "All silver and gold, and all vessels of bronze and iron, are to be consecrated to the Lord. They are to be placed in the Lord's treasury."

verses.latin: Igitur contremuit omnis populus, et tubis clangentibus, ac vociferante universitate, audita est vox in altum. Statimque muri corruerunt, et ascendit unusquisque per locum contra se, et ceperunt civitatem.
verses.english: Therefore, all the people shouted, and as the trumpets sounded, with everyone yelling together, the sound was heard from afar. Immediately, the city walls collapsed, and each man went up directly to the place opposite him, and they took the city.

verses.latin: Et interfecerunt omnes qui erant in ea, a viro usque ad mulierem, ab infante usque ad senem. Boves quoque et oves et asinos in ore gladii interfecerunt.
verses.english: And they killed everyone who was in the city, from man to woman, from infant to elderly person. They also killed oxen, sheep, and donkeys with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: Duobus autem viris, qui speculatores fuerant, dixit Iosue: Ingredimini domum mulieris meretricis, et producite eam, et omnia quæ illius sunt, sicut jurastis ei.
verses.english: But Joshua said to the two men who had been the spies: "Go into the house of the prostitute woman, and bring her out, and all that belongs to her, just as you swore to her."
