verses.latin: Ingressique juvenes eduxerunt Rahab et parentes eius, fratres et omnem cognationem, et substantiam eorum, et posuerunt extra castra Israel.
verses.english: So the young men went in and brought out Rahab, along with her parents, her brothers, all her relatives, and all their possessions. They then placed them outside the camp of Israel.

verses.latin: Urbem autem et omnia quæ in ea erant, succenderunt igni, absque argento et auro et vasis æneis ac ferreis, quæ in thesauros domus Domini consecrarunt.
verses.english: But the city itself and everything in it they burned with fire, except for the silver, gold, and the vessels of bronze and iron, which they consecrated into the treasury of the Lord's house.

verses.latin: Rahab vero meretricem, et domum patris eius, et omnia quæ habebat, Iosue fecit vivere, et mansit in Israel usque in præsentem diem, eo quod absconderit nuntios quos miserat ut explorarent Iericho.
verses.english: However, Joshua allowed Rahab the prostitute, her father's household, and all that she possessed to live. And she has remained in Israel even to this very day, because she had hidden the messengers whom he sent to spy out Jericho.

verses.latin: In tempore illo iuravit Iosue, dicens: Maledictus vir coram Domino, qui suscitabit et ædificabit civitatem Iericho. In primogenito suo fundabit eam, et in novissimo liberorum suorum statuet portas eius.
verses.english: At that time, Joshua made a solemn oath, saying: "Cursed before the Lord be the man who attempts to raise up and rebuild the city of Jericho! He will lay its foundation with his firstborn son, and he will set up its gates with his youngest child."

verses.latin: Fuit ergo Dominus cum Iosue, et nomen eius divulgatum est in omni terra.
verses.english: So the Lord was with Joshua, and his renown was spread throughout all the land.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israel commiserunt transgressionem, et usurpaverunt de anathemate. Fecit enim Achan filius Charmi, filii Zabdi, filii Zara de tribu Juda, aliquid de anathemate: iratusque est Dominus contra filios Israel.
verses.english: However, the Israelites committed a serious transgression. They took some of the forbidden things—items that God had commanded to be utterly destroyed or set apart for Him. Achan, the son of Carmi, who was the son of Zabdi, from the clan of Zerah of the tribe of Judah, took some of these forbidden things. Because of this, the Lord became very angry with the Israelites.

verses.latin: Cumque misisset Iosue de Iericho viros contra Hai, quae est juxta Bethaven a parte orientis urbis Bethel, dixit eis: Ite, et explorate terram. Qui praecepta illius exsequentes, exploraverunt Hai.
verses.english: Joshua sent some men from Jericho to the city of Ai, which is located near Beth-aven, to the east of the city of Bethel. He commanded them, 'Go and scout out the land around Ai.' The men followed his orders and scouted Ai.

verses.latin: Et reversi dixerunt ei: Ne ascendat omnis populus, sed duo vel tria millia virorum pergant, et expugnent urbem: quoniam perpauci sunt hostes.
verses.english: When they returned, they reported to Joshua, 'There’s no need for our entire army to go. Only about two or three thousand men are needed to go up and conquer the city of Ai, because there are very few people there.'

verses.latin: Ascenderunt ergo illuc de populo, quasi tria millia virorum: qui statim terga verterunt, fugeruntque a viris urbis Hai.
verses.english: So about three thousand men from the Israelite army went up to Ai. But as soon as they faced the men of Ai, they turned and fled.

verses.latin: Cecideruntque ex eis triginta sex viri: et persecuti sunt eos de porta usque Sabaim, percusseruntque ac fugerunt in declivi: et contabuit cor populi, et factum est quasi aqua.
verses.english: Thirty-six of the Israelite men were killed. The men of Ai pursued them from the city gate all the way to Shebarim, striking them down on the slope as they fled. At this, the hearts of the Israelite people melted in fear and became like water, losing all courage.

verses.latin: Iosue vero scissis vestibus suis, corruit in terram ante arcam Domini usque ad vesperam, tam ipse, quam omnes senes Israel: et miserunt pulverem super capita sua.
verses.english: When Joshua heard what happened, he tore his clothes in grief and fell to the ground on his face before the Ark of the Lord. He remained there until evening, along with all the elders of Israel, and they threw dust on their heads as a sign of mourning and humiliation.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Heu, Domine Deus, quid voluisti traducere populum istum Jordanem, ut traderes nos in manus Amorrhaei, et perderes? Utinam in solitudine mansissemus trans Jordanem!
verses.english: Joshua cried out, 'Oh, Lord God! Why did You bring this people across the Jordan River, only to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites so they could destroy us? If only we had been content to stay on the other side of the Jordan, in the wilderness!'

verses.latin: Mi Domine, quid dicam, postquam versus est Israel coram hostibus suis?
verses.english: 'My Lord, what can I say now that Israel has turned its back and fled before its enemies?'

verses.latin: Audient Chananaei, et omnes habitatores terrae, et circumdabunt nos, atque delebunt nomen nostrum de terra: et quid facies nomini tuo magno?
verses.english: 'The Canaanites and all the other inhabitants of the land will hear about this defeat. They will surround us and wipe out our name from the face of the earth. What then will You do for Your great Name and reputation?'

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Iosue: Surge, cur jaces pronus in terra?
verses.english: The Lord said to Joshua, 'Stand up! Why are you lying prostrate on the ground?'

verses.latin: Peccavit Israel, et praevaricatus est pactum meum: et de anathemate tulit, et furatus est, et mentitus est, et abscondit in vasis suis.
verses.english: 'Israel has sinned! They have violated My covenant, the solemn agreement I made with them. They have taken some of the forbidden things, stolen them, lied about it, and hidden them among their own possessions.'

verses.latin: Nec poterit stare Israel coram hostibus suis, donec auferatur qui iniquitate polluitur, de medio vestri.
verses.english: 'Because of this, the Israelites will not be able to stand against their enemies until the one who is defiled by this wickedness is removed from among you.'

verses.latin: Surge, sanctifica populum, et dic eis: Sanctificamini in crastinum: haec enim dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Anathema est in medio tui, Israel: non poteris stare coram hostibus tuis, donec auferatur ex te qui hoc scelere contaminatus est.
verses.english: 'Get up! Sanctify the people, and tell them, 'Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow.' For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'There are forbidden things in your midst, Israel. You will not be able to stand against your enemies until the one contaminated by this crime is removed from you.''

verses.latin: Et accedent mane singuli per tribus suas: et quamcumque tribum sors designaverit, accedet per cognationes suas: et cognatio per domos, et domus per viros.
verses.english: 'In the morning, you must present yourselves by your tribes. The tribe that the Lord indicates by lot will come forward by its clans. The clan that the Lord indicates will come forward by its families. And the family that the Lord indicates will come forward, man by man.'

verses.latin: Quicumque fuerit deprehensus hoc scelere, comburetur igni cum omni substantia sua: quia praevaricatus est pactum Domini, et fecit iniquitatem in Israel.
verses.english: 'The person who is discovered to have committed this crime will be burned with fire, along with everything he owns. This is because he has violated the Lord's covenant and has brought wickedness upon Israel.'

verses.latin: Igitur Iosue consurgens diluculo, applicuit Israel per tribus suas: et deprehensa est tribus Juda.
verses.english: So Joshua rose early in the morning and brought Israel forward by its tribes, and the tribe of Judah was indicated by the Lord.

verses.latin: Quae cum juxta cognationes suas esset oblata, deprehensa est cognatio Zarahi. Et illam per domos offerens, invenit Zabdi.
verses.english: Then he brought the clans of Judah forward, and the clan of Zerah was indicated. He then brought the families of Zerah forward, man by man, and Zabdi was indicated.

verses.latin: Domum quoque ejus per singulos viros producens, invenit Achan filium Charmi, filii Zabdi, filii Zarahi de tribu Juda.
verses.english: Finally, he brought Zabdi's family forward, man by man, and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, was indicated.

verses.latin: Et dixit Iosue ad Achan: Fili mi, da gloriam Domino Deo Israel, et confitere, et indica mihi quid feceris: ne abscondas.
verses.english: Joshua said to Achan, 'My son, give glory to the Lord, the God of Israel, and confess. Tell me what you have done; do not hide it from me.'

verses.latin: Responditque Achan Iosue, et ait: Vere ego peccavi Domino Deo Israel, et haec sunt quae feci.
verses.english: Achan replied to Joshua, saying, 'It is true; I have sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel. This is what I did.'

verses.latin: Vidi enim inter spolia pallium coccineum valde bonum, et ducentos siclos argenti, regulamque auream quinquaginta siclorum: et concupiscens abstuli, et abscondi in terra contra medium tabernaculi mei, et argentum subter defossum est.
verses.english: 'Among the plunder, I saw a beautiful Babylonian cloak, two hundred shekels of silver, and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels. I desired these things and so I took them. I have hidden them in the ground inside my tent, with the silver buried underneath.'

verses.latin: Misit ergo Iosue ministros: qui currentes ad tabernaculum illius, repererunt omnia abscondita in eodem loco, et argentum simul.
verses.english: Joshua immediately sent messengers, and they ran to Achan's tent. They found everything hidden in that very place, including the silver.

verses.latin: Auferentesque de tabernaculo, tulerunt ad Iosue, et ad omnes filios Israel, et projecerunt coram Domino.
verses.english: They took them out of the tent, brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites, and laid them before the Lord.

verses.latin: Tollens itaque Iosue Achan filium Zarahi, et argentum, et pallium, et regulam auream, et filios ejus, et filias, et boves, et asinos, et oves, et tentorium, et omnem supellectilem ejus, cunctaque universi Israel, duxerunt ad vallem Achor.
verses.english: Then Joshua, along with all the Israelites, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the cloak, the bar of gold, his sons and daughters, his oxen, donkeys, sheep, his tent, and all his other possessions. They brought all these to the Valley of Achor.

verses.latin: Ubi dixit Iosue: Quia turbasti nos, conturbet te Dominus in hac die. Lapidavitque eum omnis Israel, et cuncta quae illius erant, igne succensa sunt.
verses.english: There, Joshua said, 'Because you have brought trouble upon us, may the Lord bring trouble upon you this very day.' Then all the Israelites stoned him to death. They also burned everything that belonged to him with fire, including his family members and animals, after stoning them.

verses.latin: Et coacervaverunt super eum acervum lapidum magnum, qui permanet usque in praesentem diem. Et aversus est furor Domini ab eis. Vocatumque est nomen loci illius, Vallis Achor, usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: They raised a large pile of stones over him, which remains to this day. Then the fierce anger of the Lord turned away from them. That is why the name of that place has been called the Valley of Achor, meaning 'Valley of Trouble', to this very day.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israel commiserunt transgressionem in anathemate: siquidem Achan filius Charmi filii Zabdi filii Zarae de tribu Juda, tulit aliquid de anathemate: iratusque est Dominus contra filios Israel.
verses.english: The people of Israel committed a grave sin regarding the items devoted to God under the ban—those things meant for complete destruction and not for human plunder. Indeed, Achan, son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, took some of these devoted items for himself. Because of this act of disobedience, the Lord God’s anger burned against all the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Cumque Josue misisset de Jericho viros contra Hai, quae est juxta Bethaven, ex parte orientis urbis Bethel, dixit eis: Ite, et explorate terram. Qui perrexerunt, et exploraverunt Hai.
verses.english: After this, Joshua sent men from Jericho to go to Ai, a city near Beth-Aven, located to the east of the city of Bethel. He commanded them: 'Go and scout out the land.' So, they went and thoroughly explored Ai.

verses.latin: Et reversi dixerunt ei: Non ascendat omnis populus, sed duo vel tria millia virorum pergant, et expugnent urbem: quoniam perpauci sunt hostes.
verses.english: When they returned, they reported to Joshua: 'There is no need for all the people to go up. Only two or three thousand men should go and attack the city, because the enemies there are very few.'

verses.latin: Ascenderunt ergo illuc de populo circiter tria millia virorum: qui statim terga verterunt hostibus suis,
verses.english: So, about three thousand men from the people went up to Ai. But immediately, they turned their backs and fled from their enemies,

verses.latin: Et caesi sunt ex eis triginta sex viri: persecutique sunt eos ab elephanto, donec converterentur, percussitque eos in descensu: et pertimuit cor populi, et ad instar aquae liquefactum est.
verses.english: and thirty-six men from Israel were killed. The enemy pursued them from the gate of the city to Shebarim—a place where the ground slopes downwards—and struck them down on the descent. Because of this defeat, the heart of the people of Israel melted away in fear, like water.

verses.latin: Josue vero scidit vestimenta sua, et procidit in terram ante Arcam Domini usque ad vesperam, tam ipse quam omnes senes Israel: et miserunt pulverem super capita sua.
verses.english: When Joshua heard of this, he tore his clothes in grief and threw himself prostrate on the ground before the Ark of the Lord God. He lay there until evening, joined by all the elders of Israel. They also threw dust upon their heads as a sign of mourning and humiliation.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Heu mihi, Domine Deus, quid voluisti traducere populum istum Jordanem, ut traderes nos in manus Amorrhaei, et perderes? Utinam in solitudine mansissemus trans Jordanem!
verses.english: And Joshua cried out: 'Oh, my Lord God, why did You ever bring this people across the Jordan River? Was it only to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites so they could destroy us? If only we had remained in the wilderness on the other side of the Jordan!'

verses.latin: Mi Domine, quid dicam, videns Israel aversus hostes suos?
verses.english: 'My Lord, what can I say now that I see Israel turning their backs and fleeing from their enemies?'

verses.latin: Fugient Amorrhaei, et omnes habitatores terrae Chanaan, audito. Et circumdabunt nos, ac delebunt nomen nostrum de terra: quid facies nomini tuo magno?
verses.english: 'When the Amorites and all the inhabitants of the land of Canaan hear of this defeat, they will surround us and wipe out our name from the face of the earth. What then will You do for Your great name, Lord God?'

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Josue: Surge, quare jaces pronus in terra?
verses.english: Then the Lord God said to Joshua: 'Stand up! Why are you lying prostrate on the ground like this?'

verses.latin: Peccavit Israel, et praevaricatus est pactum meum: feceruntque de anathemate furtum, et mentiti sunt, ac celare non potuerunt. Nam de iis quae sub anathemate erant, tulerunt aliquid.
verses.english: 'Israel has sinned! They have violated My covenant, the one I commanded them to keep. They secretly stole from the devoted items—those things under the ban—and then they lied about it and tried to hide it. Yes, they took some of the things that were meant to be completely set apart for Me.'

verses.latin: Nec poterit Israel stare coram hostibus suis, sed fugiet eos: quia factus est anathema. Non ero ultra vobiscum, donec deleatis anathema de medio vestri.
verses.english: 'Therefore, the people of Israel will not be able to stand before their enemies; instead, they will flee from them. This is because they themselves have become subject to the ban, by taking what was devoted. I will no longer be with you unless you remove the devoted thing from among you.'

verses.latin: Surge, sanctifica populum, et dic: Sanctificamini in crastinum: haec enim dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Anathema in medio tui est, Israel: non poteris stare coram hostibus tuis, donec auferatur ex te, qui hoc scelere polluctus est.
verses.english: 'Get up! Go and sanctify the people for tomorrow. Tell them: "Purify yourselves for tomorrow, because this is what the Lord God of Israel says: 'There is a devoted thing among you, O Israel! You will not be able to stand before your enemies until you remove from your midst the one who has been defiled by this wicked act.'"'

verses.latin: Et accedetis mane singuli per tribus vestras: et quamcumque tribum sors designaverit, accedet per cognationes suas: et cognatio per domos, et domus per viros.
verses.english: 'In the morning, you must come forward, each of your tribes. Then, the tribe that the Lord God designates by lot must come forward by its clans. The clan chosen by lot must come forward by its households, and the household chosen by lot must come forward man by man.'

verses.latin: Et quicumque fuerit deprehensus hoc scelere, comburetur igni cum omnibus suis, eo quod transgressus sit pactum Domini, et fecerit in Israel facinus horrendum.
verses.english: 'The person who is discovered to be guilty of this wicked act shall be burned with fire, along with everything he owns. This is because he has violated the Lord God's covenant and has committed a horrific crime against Israel.'

verses.latin: Josue ergo mane consurgens, applicavit Israel per tribus suas, et deprehensa est tribus Juda.
verses.english: So Joshua rose early in the morning and brought Israel forward by their tribes, and the tribe of Judah was designated by lot.

verses.latin: Quae cum applicata esset per cognationes suas, deprehensa est cognatio Zarahi. Et illam adducens per domos, inventa est domus Zabdi.
verses.english: When he brought the clans of Judah forward, the clan of Zerah was designated by lot. And when he brought that clan forward by its households, the household of Zabdi was found.

verses.latin: In cujus domo singulos viros jubens offerri, inventus est Achan filius Charmi filii Zabdi filii Zarae de tribu Juda.
verses.english: Then, when he commanded each man in Zabdi’s household to come forward individually, Achan, son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, was found to be the guilty one.

verses.latin: Et dixit Josue ad Achan: Fili mi, da gloriam Domino Deo Israel, et confitere, et indica mihi quid feceris, ne abscondas.
verses.english: Joshua then said to Achan: 'My son, give glory to the Lord God of Israel and make a confession. Tell me what you have done; do not hide it from me.'

verses.latin: Responditque Achan Josue, et ait: Vere ego peccavi Domino Deo Israel, et haec sunt quae feci.
verses.english: Achan responded to Joshua, saying: 'Indeed, I have sinned against the Lord God of Israel, and this is what I did: '

verses.latin: Vidi enim inter spolia pallium coccineum valde bonum, et ducentos siclos argenti, et regulam auream quinquaginta siclorum: et concupiscens abstuli, et abscondi in terra contra medium tabernaculi mei, et argentum subter defossum.
verses.english: 'Among the spoils I saw a very beautiful scarlet cloak, two hundred shekels of silver, and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels. I coveted them, so I took them. I buried them in the ground inside my tent, with the silver hidden underneath.'

verses.latin: Misit ergo Josue ministros, qui currentes ad tabernaculum illius, repererunt omnia abscondita in eodem loco, et argentum simul.
verses.english: So Joshua sent messengers, who ran to Achan’s tent. There, they found everything hidden in that very place, including the silver.

verses.latin: Auferentesque de tabernaculo, attulerunt ad Josue, et ad omnes filios Israel, et projecerunt coram Domino.
verses.english: They took the items from the tent, brought them to Joshua and all the people of Israel, and laid them out before the Lord God.

verses.latin: Tollens itaque Josue Achan filium Zarae, et argentum, et pallium coccineum, et regulam auream, filiosque et filias ejus, boves, et asinos, et oves, ac tabernaculum, et omnia supellectilem ejus, et universum Israel cum eo, duxerunt ad vallem Achor.
verses.english: Then Joshua, along with all the people of Israel, took Achan, son of Zerah, and the silver, the scarlet cloak, the bar of gold, his sons and daughters, his oxen, donkeys, and sheep, his tent, and all his possessions. They led him and everything he owned to the Valley of Achor.

verses.latin: Ubi dixit Josue: Quia turbasti nos, conturbet te Dominus in hac die. Lapidavitque eum omnis Israel, et cuncta quae illius erant, igne combusta sunt.
verses.english: There, Joshua said to Achan: 'Because you have troubled us by your sin, may the Lord God trouble you this very day.' Then all the people of Israel stoned him to death, and everything that belonged to him was burned with fire.

verses.latin: Et congeriem lapidum magnam super eum congerunt, quae permanet usque in praesentem diem. Et aversus est furor Domini ab eo. Vocatumque est nomen loci illius, Vallis Achor, usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: And they piled a great heap of stones over him, which remains to this very day as a memorial. After this, the Lord God's intense anger turned away from the people of Israel. That place has been called the Valley of Achor—meaning 'Trouble'—even to the present day.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Josue: Ne timeas, nec paveas: tolle tecum omnem multitudinem pugnatorum, et consurgens ascende in urbem Hai. Ecce tradidi in manu tua regem civitatis hujus, et populum, et urbem, et terram illius.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Joshua, saying, 'Do not be afraid, nor be terrified! Take all your warriors with you, and go up against the city of Ai. Indeed, I have delivered into your hands the king of this city, its people, the city itself, and all its surrounding territory.'

verses.latin: Faciesque urbi Hai, et regi ejus sicut fecisti Jericho, et regi illius: absque ea praeda, quam diripueris tibi, et omnia animantia. Pone in insidiis post urbem.
verses.english: You shall do to the city of Ai and its king just as you did to Jericho and its king. However, this time you may take all the plunder and animals as spoil for yourselves. Set an ambush behind the city.

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo Josue, et omnis exercitus pugnatorum cum eo, ut ascenderent in Hai: electosque fortissimos viros triginta millia, et misit eos nocte.
verses.english: So Joshua and all his warriors rose up to march against Ai. He chose thirty thousand of his most valiant men and sent them out during the night.

verses.latin: Et praecepit eis dicens: Videte, ut celeter in insidiis sitis post civitatem, nec recedatis procul a civitate: sed omnes estote parati.
verses.english: And he gave them these orders: 'Make sure you hide yourselves in ambush behind the city. Do not move too far from the city itself. Instead, all of you must be ready.'

verses.latin: Et ego, et caeterus populus qui mecum est, accedemus ex adverso contra urbem. Cumque exierint contra nos, sicut prius, fugiemus, et terga vertemus, donec abstrahamus eos de civitate.
verses.english: 'My main army, and I along with them, will advance against the city from the front. When the men of Ai come out against us, just as they did before, we will pretend to flee and turn our backs, until we have lured them far away from their city.'

verses.latin: Putantes quod fugiamus, et sequantur nos, donec elongemur ab urbe: et tunc erigetis vos de insidiis, et absque ulla dubitatione ingrediemini civitatem: tradetque eam Dominus Deus vester in manus vestras.
verses.english: 'They will think that we are truly fleeing and will pursue us until we are far from the city. At that very moment, you are to rise up from your ambush and, without any hesitation, enter the city. The Lord your God will deliver it into your hands.'

verses.latin: Cumque ceperitis, succendite eam, ita ut de insidiis locus apparuerit vobis.
verses.english: 'And when you have captured it, set it on fire, so that the smoke from the ambush site will be a clear signal to us.'

verses.latin: Cumque ceperitis civitatem, succendite eam: et quicquid feceritis, me praecedente, facite.
verses.english: 'And when you have captured the city, set it on fire. Whatever you do, make sure to do it exactly as I have commanded you—for I will be leading you.'

verses.latin: Dimisitque eos Josue, et perrexerunt ad insidiarum locum, sederuntque inter Bethel et Hai, ad occidentalem plagam urbis Hai. Josue autem media nocte stetit in valle.
verses.english: Joshua then sent them out, and they went to the place of ambush, settling themselves between Bethel and Ai, on the western side of the city of Ai. Joshua himself spent that night in the valley with the main army.

verses.latin: Surrexitque Josue primo mane, et recensuit exercitum, et ascendit cum senioribus in urbem Hai, omni agmine pugnatorum in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: Joshua rose early in the morning, reviewed his army, and then, with the elders of Israel, he marched up against the city of Ai, with all the armed forces following him.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset atque ascendisset ex adverso civitatis, stetit ad aquilonem urbis, cujus erat inter medium vallis.
verses.english: When he had arrived and advanced opposite the city, he positioned his forces to the north of the city, with a valley lying between them and Ai.

verses.latin: Et constituit triginta millia virorum insidias inter Bethel et Hai ex occidentali plaga ejusdem civitatis.
verses.english: He had stationed the thirty thousand men in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the western side of that city.

verses.latin: Totus autem exercitus, qui ad aquilonem urbis erat, post tergum Josue, et ejus acies: ita ut, occidente plaga illius civitatis, extremum agmen contingentis exercitus esset, et inter medium eorum vallis.
verses.english: So the main army, which was to the north of the city, was behind Joshua and his battle lines, positioned so that the rear guard of the army touched the western side of Ai, with the valley still between them.

verses.latin: Videntes autem cives Hai, praeceperunt illis, et in ipso statim mane urbem egressi sunt, atque processerunt contra Israel in pugnam, ipseque rex et omnis populus civitatis ad locum campestrem: ignorabant enim quod post tergum urbs insidiis circumdata esset.
verses.english: When the citizens of Ai saw this, they swiftly gave orders, and at once, in the very early morning, they marched out of the city and advanced to battle against Israel, the king himself and all the people of the city proceeding to the flat plain. They did not know that the city had been surrounded by an ambush from behind.

verses.latin: Josue vero, et omnis Israel, videntes fugiebant a conspectu eorum per viam solitudinis.
verses.english: Joshua, with all the men of Israel, pretended to flee before them by way of the wilderness path.

verses.latin: At illi vociferantes, et se mutuo cohortantes, insecuti sunt eos. Cumque recessissent quoque de civitate, et essent persequentium itinere deducti,
verses.english: But the men of Ai, shouting and encouraging one another, pursued them. As the men of Ai were drawn away from their city, following the pursuers along the road,

verses.latin: nullus remansit in civitate Hai, et Bethel, qui non persequeretur Israel: dimissisque urbibus apertis, et incustoditis, insecuti sunt Josue.
verses.english: no one remained in either the city of Ai or Bethel who did not join the pursuit of Israel. With their cities left open and unguarded, they pursued Joshua.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Extende clypeum, qui in manu tua est, contra urbem Hai, quoniam tibi tradam eam. Cum extendisset Josue clypeum contra civitatem,
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Joshua, 'Stretch out the shield—or javelin—that is in your hand towards the city of Ai, for I will deliver it to you.' When Joshua stretched out his shield—or javelin—towards the city,

verses.latin: insidiae, quae latitabant ad occidentalem urbis plagam, statim intraverunt civitatem, et ceperunt eam. Et nullo prohibente succenderunt urbem.
verses.english: the men in ambush, who had been hiding on the western side of the city, immediately entered the city and captured it. Without anyone to stop them, they set the city on fire.

verses.latin: Jamque viri Hai, respicientes, viderunt fumum urbis ad caelum usque conscendere: nec ultra habuerunt ultra quo et illuc vel huc fugerent: praesertim cum hi qui fugiebant ad solitudinem, et contra se venire cernerent, et eos qui subverterant civitatem.
verses.english: And now the men of Ai, looking back, saw the smoke of their city ascending up towards the sky. They no longer had anywhere to flee, neither this way nor that. Especially when those who had pretended to flee into the wilderness now turned and advanced against them, along with those who had completely overturned the city.

verses.latin: Josue vero, et omnis Israel, videntes quod capta esset civitas, et fumus ex urbe conscenderet, reversi sunt, et percusserunt viros Hai.
verses.english: Joshua, and all the men of Israel, seeing that the city had been captured and that smoke was ascending from it, turned around and attacked the men of Ai.

verses.latin: Siquidem et illi, qui ceperant Hai, egressi ex urbe, occurrerunt eis, et facti sunt hostes in medio, his ex hac, et illis ex illa parte: ita ut nullo eorum remanente, vel effugiente, cæderentur.
verses.english: Indeed, those who had captured Ai also came out of the city to meet them, and the men of Ai found themselves trapped, with enemies on both sides, those from the front and those from the rear. So they were struck down, with none of them remaining or escaping.

verses.latin: Regem quoque urbis Hai apprehensum vivum, obtulerunt Josue.
verses.english: They also seized the king of the city of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.

verses.latin: Itaque omnibus interfectis civibus Hai in loco campestri, et in solitudine quo fugerant, et uno gladio corruentibus, reversi sunt omnes in Hai, et percusserunt eam in ore gladii.
verses.english: So, when all the citizens of Ai who had fled to the plain and into the wilderness were killed, falling by a single sword—meaning a single decisive battle—all the men of Israel returned to Ai and struck down its inhabitants with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: Fueruntque qui caesi sunt in illa die, virorum ac mulierum, duodecim millia omnes, urbis Hai.
verses.english: The total number of those killed on that day, both men and women, was twelve thousand—all the people of the city of Ai.

verses.latin: Josue vero non contraxit manum, quam extenderat, tenens clypeum, donec interficerentur omnes habitatores Hai.
verses.english: Joshua did not withdraw his hand, which he had stretched out holding the shield—or javelin—until all the inhabitants of Ai had been utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Jumenta vero et spolia civitatis, diviserunt sibi filii Israel, sicut praeceperat Dominus Josue.
verses.english: But the livestock and the plunder of the city, the sons of Israel divided among themselves, just as the Lord had commanded Joshua.

verses.latin: Urbs autem Hai succensa est, et perpetua solitudo effecta, usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: The city of Ai, however, was burned to the ground and turned into a permanent desolation, remaining so to this very day.

verses.latin: Regem quoque ejus suspendit in patibulo usque ad vesperum solis. Et in solis occasu praecepit Josue, et deposuerunt cadaver ejus de cruce. Projectumque in foveam, quam fecerant juxta introitum civitatis, imposuerunt super eum magnum acervum lapidum, qui permanet usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Its king he also hanged on a gallows until the evening sun. At sunset, Joshua gave the order, and they took his body down from the cross. They threw it into a pit that they had dug near the entrance of the city and raised a great pile of stones over it, which remains there to this very day.

verses.latin: Tunc aedificavit Josue altare Domino Deo Israel in monte Hebal,
verses.english: Then Joshua built an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal.

verses.latin: sicut praeceperat Moyses famulus Domini filiis Israel, et scriptum est in volumine legis Moysi: altare lapidibus inchoatis, quos ferrum non tetigit: et obtulit super eo holocausta Domino, et immolavit pacificas victimas.
verses.english: He built it just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded the children of Israel, and as it is written in the book of the Law of Moses: an altar of unhewn stones, which no iron tool had touched. And upon it, he offered burnt offerings to the Lord and sacrificed peace offerings.

verses.latin: Et scripsit super lapides deuteronomium legis Moysi, quam scripserat coram filiis Israel.
verses.english: And there, on those stones, he wrote a copy of the Law of Moses—a reiteration of the Law—which he had written in the presence of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Omnis quoque populus, et majores natu, et duces, ac judices stabant ex utraque parte arcae in conspectu sacerdotum levitici generis, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini: et advena, et indigena media ex parte. Dimidia pars eorum juxta montem Garizim, et dimidia juxta montem Hebal, sicut praeceperat Moyses famulus Domini, et benedicerent populo Israel.
verses.english: All the people, including the elders, the leaders, and the judges, stood on both sides of the ark in the presence of the priests of the Levitical lineage who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. Both the sojourner and the native-born Israelite were there, with half of them standing near Mount Gerizim and the other half near Mount Ebal, just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded for the blessing of the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Post haec legit omnia verba benedictionis et maledictionis, et cuncta quae scripta erant in legis volumine.
verses.english: After this, Joshua read all the words of blessing and cursing, and everything else that was written in the book of the Law.

verses.latin: Nihil ex his quae Moyses jusserat, reliquit intactum, quin universa legeret in conspectu omnis multitudinis Israeliticae, et mulierum ac parvulorum, et advenarum qui inter eos morabantur.
verses.english: He left nothing unspoken that Moses had commanded, but read all of it in the presence of the entire assembly of Israel, including the women, the children, and the sojourners who lived among them.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Ne timeas, neque Metuas: tolle tecum omnes viros bellatores, et consurgens ascende in urbem Hai. Ecce tradidi in manu tua regem civitatis hujus, et populum, et urbem, et terram ejus.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Joshua, saying, "Do not be afraid, and do not be terrified. Take with you all your fighting men, and go up against the city of Ai. Behold, I have delivered into your hand the king of this city, along with its people, the city itself, and its land."

verses.latin: Faciesque urbi Hai, sicut fecisti Jericho, et regi ejus: praeterquam de praeda, et jumentis, quae vobis tantum relinquentur. Pone insidias post urbem.
verses.english: You will do to the city of Ai and its king exactly as you did to Jericho and its king, except that you may keep the plunder and livestock for yourselves. Now, set an ambush behind the city.

verses.latin: Surrexitque Josue, et omnis exercitus bellatorum cum eo, ut ascenderent in Hai: et elegit triginta millia virorum fortissimorum, et misit ad noctem
verses.english: So Joshua rose up, and all the army of fighting men with him, to go up to Ai. He chose thirty thousand of his most courageous warriors and sent them out by night.

verses.latin: praecepitque eis, dicens: Videte ut latitetis post urbem a tergo, nec longius recedatis:
verses.english: He commanded them, saying, "See that you lie in ambush behind the city; do not go too far away from it."

verses.latin: et ego, et reliqua multitudo quae mecum est, accedemus ex adverso contra urbem. Cum ergo exierint contra nos, sicut prius, fugiemus, et terga vertemus,
verses.english: "I and the rest of the army that is with me will approach the city from the front. When they come out against us, just as they did before, we will flee and turn our backs."

verses.latin: donec fugientes pellamus eos, et elongentur a civitate: putabunt enim nos fugere, sicut prima vice: et cum fugerimus,
verses.english: "We will keep fleeing until we have drawn them far away from the city. They will think that we are fleeing, just as we did the first time. And when we have fled,"

verses.latin: vos consurgetis de insidiis, et absque ulla dubitatione ingrediemini civitatem: tradetque eam Dominus Deus vester in manus vestras.
verses.english: "you will rise up from your ambush and enter the city without any doubt or hesitation, for the Lord your God will deliver it into your hands."

verses.latin: Cumque occupaveritis, succendite eam, et quod jussum est, facite: videte, ne declines ad dexteram vel ad sinistram.
verses.english: "And when you have captured it, burn the city with fire. Do exactly as I have commanded you. See to it that you do not turn aside to the right or to the left."

verses.latin: Dimisitque eos, et abierunt ad locum insidiarum, sederuntque inter Bethel et Hai, ad occidentalem plagam urbis Hai. Josue autem nocte illa in medio populi mansit.
verses.english: So Joshua sent them out, and they went to the place of ambush, positioning themselves between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city of Ai. Joshua himself remained that night in the midst of the people.

verses.latin: Seditque consurgens diluculo, et recensuit exercitum, ascenditque cum senioribus in fronte agminis.
verses.english: Joshua rose early in the morning and reviewed the army. Then he ascended with the elders at the head of the troops.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent omnes bellatores qui cum eo erant, et ascendissent, properaverunt, et venerunt ex adverso civitatis, atque consederunt ad septentrionalem urbis partem: inter quam et Hai vallis erat.
verses.english: When all the fighting men who were with him had come and gone up, they hurried and came opposite the city, taking up position on the north side of the city. There was a valley between them and Ai.

verses.latin: Et quinque millia virorum posuerat ad latendum inter Bethel et Hai, ex occidentali parte ejusdem civitatis:
verses.english: And Joshua had also placed five thousand men in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the western side of that same city.

verses.latin: Omnis autem exercitus, qui in aquilonem urbis venerat, et reliqui de quibus ad insidias dictum erat, pergebant, et tendebant castra ad occidentem ejusdem civitatis: et Josue noctu illa pertransivit mediam vallem.
verses.english: Now, all the main army that had come to the north of the city, and the remaining men who had been designated for the ambush, marched on and set up their camp to the west of that same city. Joshua, during that night, passed through the middle of the valley, moving undetected.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset rex Hai, festinavit diluculo, et egressus est cum omni exercitu civitatis contra Israel in pugnam, statuto tempore, ad campestrem locum: ignorabatque quod laterent a tergo urbis insidiae.
verses.english: When the king of Ai saw this, he hurried out early in the morning and went forth with all the army of the city against Israel to battle, at a predetermined time, in the plain. He was entirely unaware that an ambush lay hidden behind the city.

verses.latin: Josue vero, et omnis Israel, simulans fugam, terga verterunt per viam solitudinis.
verses.english: But Joshua and all Israel, feigning flight, turned their backs and headed along the way towards the wilderness.

verses.latin: At illi vociferantes, in vicem se hortabantur ut persequerentur: et sic cunctos abstraxerunt, qui in civitate erant, fugientesque persequuti sunt.
verses.english: And the men of Ai, shouting loudly, urged one another to pursue them. In this manner, they drew out all those who were in the city, pursuing the fleeing Israelites.

verses.latin: Nec unus quidem remansit in civitate Hai et Bethel, qui non persequeretur Israel: dimissisque urbibus apertis, insequuti sunt Josue.
verses.english: Not a single man remained in the cities of Ai or Bethel who did not pursue Israel. Leaving their cities open and defenseless, they followed after Joshua.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Extende clypeum, qui in manu tua est, contra urbem Hai, quoniam tibi tradam eam.
verses.english: The Lord then said to Joshua, "Extend the shield or javelin that is in your hand towards the city of Ai, because I will deliver it to you."

verses.latin: Cumque extendisset, statim hii qui in insidiis latebant, consurrexerunt de loco suo, et currentes inierunt civitatem, occupaveruntque et succenderunt igni.
verses.english: And as soon as Joshua extended his hand, those who were lying in ambush immediately rose from their place. They ran and entered the city, captured it, and set it on fire.

verses.latin: Viri autem civitatis, qui sequebantur Josue, respicientes, et videntes fumum urbis ad caelum usque surgentem, non potuerunt ultra evadere huc illucque: praesertim cum hii qui simulaverant fugam, et tendebant ad solitudinem, contra persecutores suos fortiter resisterent.
verses.english: The men of the city who were pursuing Joshua looked back and saw the smoke of their city rising towards the sky. They could no longer escape in any direction, especially since those who had feigned flight towards the wilderness now turned and vigorously resisted their pursuers.

verses.latin: Videntes itaque Josue, et omnis Israel, quod capta esset civitas, et fumus de urbe consurgeret, reversi sunt, et percusserunt virorum Hai.
verses.english: So when Joshua and all Israel saw that the city had been captured and that smoke was rising from it, they turned back and struck down the men of Ai.

verses.latin: Sed et hii qui occupaverant Hai, egredientes de civitate, occursuri fuerunt suis, medioque hostium trucidati sunt qui ex utraque parte pugnabant, ita ut nullo eorum reliquiae fierent.
verses.english: And those who had occupied Ai also came out from the city to meet their own men. Thus, the enemies were trapped and slaughtered in the middle, fighting from both sides, so that not a single one of them was left alive.

verses.latin: ipsum quoque regem Hai apprehenderunt viventem, et obtulerunt Josue.
verses.english: They also seized the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.

verses.latin: Igitur interfecit omnis Israel habitatores, qui fuerant in Hai, in agris, atque in solitudine, ad quam fugerant: et ceciderunt universi in ore gladii, usque ad unum. Reversique percusserunt civitatem.
verses.english: So all Israel killed the inhabitants of Ai who had been in the fields and in the wilderness to which they had fled. All of them fell by the edge of the sword, until not a single one remained. Then the Israelites returned and struck down the city itself.

verses.latin: Porro omnium qui in eo die ceciderant, tam virorum quam feminarum, sed et ipsius civitatis Hai, fuerunt duodecim millia hominum.
verses.english: And the total number of all those who fell on that day, both men and women, including the inhabitants of the city of Ai itself, was twelve thousand people.

verses.latin: Josue vero non avertit manum, quam extenderat tenens clypeum, donec interficerentur omnes habitatores Hai.
verses.english: Joshua did not withdraw his hand, which he had extended while holding the shield or javelin, until all the inhabitants of Ai had been utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Et caetera praedam, et pecora urbis ejus, divisit Israel sibi, sicut praeceperat Dominus Josue.
verses.english: But the rest of the plunder and the livestock of that city Israel divided among themselves, just as the Lord had commanded Joshua.

verses.latin: Urbem quoque Hai succendit, et fecit tumulum sempiternum: desertum usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Joshua then burned the city of Ai, reducing it to a permanent mound of ruins, a desolate place even to this present day.

verses.latin: Regem quoque ejus suspendit in patibulo usque ad vesperam solis. Cumque occumberet sol, praecepit Josue, et deposuerunt cadaver ejus de cruce. Projectumque est in ipso introitu portae illius civitatis, et congesserunt super eum acervum lapidum magnum, qui permanet usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Its king, he also hung on a gallows until the setting of the sun. When the sun went down, Joshua commanded them, and they took his corpse down from the gallows. It was then thrown at the very entrance of that city's gate, and they piled a great heap of stones over it, which remains there even to this present day.

verses.latin: Tunc aedificavit Josue altare Domino Deo Israel in monte Ebal,
verses.english: At that time, Joshua built an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal.

verses.latin: sicut praeceperat Moyses famulus Domini filiis Israel, et scriptum est in volumine legis Moysi: altare de lapidibus inpolitis, quos ferrum non tetigit: et obtulit super eo holocausta Domino, et immolavit pacificas victimas.
verses.english: He built it exactly as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded the children of Israel, and as it is written in the book of the Law of Moses: an altar of unhewn stones, which no iron tool had touched. And upon it, he offered burnt offerings to the Lord and sacrificed peace offerings.

verses.latin: Et scripsit super lapides deuteronomium legis Moysi, quod scripserat coram filiis Israel.
verses.english: And upon these stones, Joshua wrote a copy of the Law of Moses, the Second Law, which Moses had written in the presence of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et omnis populus, et majores natu, et duces, et judices, stabant ex utraque parte arcae in conspectu sacerdotum levitici generis, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, et advena, et indigena media ex parte montis Garizim, et media ex parte montis Ebal, sicut praeceperat Moyses famulus Domini, ut benedicerent populo Israel.
verses.english: And all the people, including the elders, the leaders, and the judges, stood on both sides of the Ark in the sight of the priests of the Levitical lineage, who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord. Both the foreigners and the native-born Israelites stood, half of them in front of Mount Gerizim and half in front of Mount Ebal, just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded them to bless the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Post haec legit omnia verba benedictionis, et maledictionis, et cuncta quae scripta erant in legis volumine.
verses.english: After this, Joshua read all the words of the blessing and the curse, and everything else that was written in the book of the Law.

verses.latin: Nihil ex his quae jussit Moyses, tacuit, sed universa replicavit coram omni multitudine Israel, et mulieribus, ac parvulis, et advenis qui inter exercitum morabantur.
verses.english: He did not omit anything that Moses had commanded, but recounted everything before the entire congregation of Israel, including the women, the little ones, and the foreigners who lived among the army.

verses.latin: Factum est autem ut audito sermone his omnibus regibus trans Jordanem in montanis et campestribus, in litore maris Mediterranei, et secundum oram magni maris, hii quoque qui habitabant in Hethaeo, et Amorrhaeo, et Chananaeo, et Pherezaeo, et Hevaeo, et Jebusaeo:
verses.english: Now, when all these kings heard the news—the kings from across the Jordan, in the mountains and in the plains, on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, and along the entire shore of the Great Sea—these also, who lived in the lands of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites,

verses.latin: convenerunt in unum ut pugnarent contra Josue et Israel uno animo et eadem sententia.
verses.english: they gathered together to fight against Joshua and the people of Israel. They did this with a single purpose and common agreement.

verses.latin: Hi quoque qui habitabant in Gabaon, audita universa quae fecerat Josue Jericho et Hai,
verses.english: However, the people who lived in Gibeon, when they heard all that Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai—the complete destruction of those cities—

verses.latin: et ipsi callide cogitantes, assumptis cibariis veteribus, sacculos in asinos suos imposuerunt, et utres vinarios scissos et resutos,
verses.english: they too began to plot deceitfully. They took old, moldy provisions and loaded them into worn-out sacks onto their donkeys. They also had wine skins that were old, torn, and badly patched up.

verses.latin: et calciamenta perantiqua posuerunt in pedibus, et vetustissimis vestimentis induti sunt: panes quoque in viaticum, asperi, et in pulverem comminuti.
verses.english: They put on very old, worn-out sandals and dressed themselves in extremely old clothing. Even the bread they brought for their journey was dry, crumbly, and reduced to dust.

verses.latin: Perrexeruntque ad Josue in castra Galgal, et dixerunt ei, atque principibus Israel: De terra longinqua venimus, cupientes foedus inire vobiscum.
verses.english: Then they went to Joshua, at the camp in Gilgal, and said to him and to the leaders of Israel: 'We have come from a very distant land, because we want to make a treaty with you.'

verses.latin: Responderuntque viri Israel Gabaonitis: Ne forte habitetis in terra nostra, et non possimus foedus inire vobiscum.
verses.english: The men of Israel replied to the Gibeonites: 'Perhaps you live in our land. If that were the case, we are forbidden to make a treaty with you.'

verses.latin: At illi ad Josue: Servi, inquiunt, tui sumus. Dixitque ad eos Josue: Quinam estis? et unde venistis?
verses.english: But they said to Joshua, 'We are your servants.' Joshua then asked them, 'Who are you, and where have you come from?'

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: De terra longinqua valde venerunt servi tui ad nomen Domini Dei vestri: audivimus enim famam potentiae ejus, cuncta quae fecit in Aegypto,
verses.english: They replied: 'Your servants have come from a very distant land because of the fame of the name of the Lord your God. For we have heard about His great power, and all that He did in Egypt—'

verses.latin: et universa quae fecit duobus regibus Amorrhaeorum trans Jordanem, Sehon regi Hesebon, et Og regi Basan, qui erant in Astaroth:
verses.english: —and everything He did to the two kings of the Amorites across the Jordan: namely, Sihon, king of Heshbon, and Og, king of Bashan, who was in Ashtaroth.

verses.latin: quam ob rem locuti sunt majores natu et omnes habitatores terræ nostræ ad nos, dicentes: Tollite in manibus cibaria in viam, et ite obviam eis, et dicite: Servi vestri sumus, foedus inite nobiscum.
verses.english: 'Therefore, the elders and all the inhabitants of our land spoke to us, saying: "Take provisions for your journey, go to meet them, and say: 'We are your servants; make a treaty with us.'"'

verses.latin: Hi sunt panes nostri: calidi fuerunt quando egressi sumus de domibus nostris in diem quo profecti sumus ut veniremus ad vos, nunc vero aridi, et in pulverem comminuti:
verses.english: 'Look at our bread: it was warm and fresh when we left our homes on the day we set out to come to you. But now, as you can see, it is dry and crumbled into dust.'

verses.latin: utres quoque isti vinarii novi erant quos implevimus: nunc rupti sunt et scissi: et vestimenta ista et calciamenta, quibus induimur et quae habemus in pedibus, ob nimiam longitudinem viæ, pene consumpta sunt.
verses.english: 'These wineskins also were new when we filled them, but now they are torn and split. And these clothes and sandals, which we are wearing and on our feet, are almost completely worn out because of the exceedingly long journey.'

verses.latin: Acceperunt igitur viri Israel de cibariis eorum, et os Domini non interrogaverunt.
verses.english: So the men of Israel accepted their provisions and were convinced by their story. However, they did not consult the Lord for guidance.

verses.latin: Fecitque Josue cum eis pacem, et inito foedere pollicitus est ut viverent: principes quoque multitudinis juraverunt eis.
verses.english: Joshua then made peace with them, entering into a treaty and promising that they would be allowed to live. The leaders of the community also swore an oath to them.

verses.latin: Post tres autem dies foederis initi, audierunt quod in vicino essent, et in terra sua habitarent.
verses.english: However, three days after the treaty was made, the Israelites heard that the Gibeonites were actually living nearby, and that they were inhabitants of their very own land.

verses.latin: Moveruntque castra filii Israel, et venerunt in civitates eorum tertio die: quarum haec erant nomina, Gabaon, et Caphira, et Beroth, et Cariathiarim.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel moved their camp and, on the third day, arrived at the Gibeonites' cities. These were the names of their cities: Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.

verses.latin: Et non percusserunt eos filii Israel, eo quod jurassent eis principes multitudinis per Dominum Deum Israel. Murmuravit ergo omnis multitudo contra principes.
verses.english: The sons of Israel did not attack them, because the leaders of the community had sworn an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel, making it a sacred and binding promise. Therefore, the entire community grumbled and complained against their leaders.

verses.latin: Qui responderunt eis: Juravimus illis in nomine Domini Dei Israel, et idcirco non possumus eos contingere.
verses.english: The leaders replied to them: 'We have sworn an oath to them in the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, and therefore we cannot touch them to harm them.'

verses.latin: Sed hoc faciemus eis: conservemus eos, et vivant, ne irascatur super nos Dominus, et in nobis jurejurando commisso vindicetur.
verses.english: 'But this is what we will do to them: we will let them live and preserve their lives, lest the Lord become angry with us and punish us for breaking the oath we swore.'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque principes: Vivent, ut in usus omnis multitudinis ligna cædant, et aquas hauriant. Et ut loquebantur, ita se habuit.
verses.english: The leaders then said: 'They will live, but they will be assigned to cut wood and draw water for the service of the entire community.' And what the leaders said, so it was done.

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo Josue Gabaonitas, et dixit ad eos: Cur nos decipere voluistis, ut diceretis: Procul habitamus a vobis, cum in medio nostri sitis?
verses.english: Then Joshua summoned the Gibeonites and said to them: 'Why did you want to deceive us by saying, "We live far from you," when you actually live right in our midst?'

verses.latin: Idcirco sub maledicto eritis, et non deficiet de stirpe vestra ligna cædens, aquasque hauriens in domo Dei mei.
verses.english: 'Therefore, you will be under a curse, and your descendants will never cease to be woodcutters and water-drawers for the house of my God, the sanctuary of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Responderuntque Josue, et dixerunt: Consultum est servis tuis, ut quocumque iretis, traditurus esset Dominus Deus tuus locum, et omnes habitatores ejus. Timuimus ergo valde, et providentes animabus nostris, hoc fecimus.
verses.english: They replied to Joshua, and said: 'It was clearly revealed to your servants that the Lord your God intended to hand over the entire land and all its inhabitants to you, wherever you went. Therefore, we were greatly afraid, and acting to save our lives, we did this.'

verses.latin: Nunc autem in manu tua sumus: quod tibi bonum et rectum videtur, fac nobis.
verses.english: 'Now behold, we are in your hand. Do to us whatever seems good and right in your eyes.'

verses.latin: Fecit ergo eis sicut dixerat, et liberavit eos de manu filiorum Israel, ut non occiderentur.
verses.english: So Joshua did as he had declared, and he delivered them from the hand of the sons of Israel, so that they were not killed.

verses.latin: Constituitque in die illo ligna cædentes, et aquas adtrahentes in usus universi populi, et altaris Domini, usque in præsentem diem, in loco quem elegisset Dominus.
verses.english: On that very day, Joshua appointed them to be woodcutters and water-drawers for the needs of the entire community and for the altar of the Lord, a service that continues even to this present day, in the place that the Lord would choose for His dwelling.

verses.latin: Audientes autem omnes reges trans Iordanem qui habitabant in montanis et in campestribus in maritimis quoque partibus Magnae Syriae et Phoenices id est hii qui juxta magnum mare erant et trans fluvium Hethaeus et Amorrhoeus et Chananaeus et Pherezaeus et Hevaeus et Iebusaeus
verses.english: But when all the kings across the Jordan River heard of these things—those who lived in the hill country, in the plains, and along the coastal parts of Greater Syria and Phoenicia, that is, those near the Great Sea—the Mediterranean Sea—and those beyond the Euphrates River, including the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—

verses.latin: congregati sunt pariter ut pugnarent contra Iosue et Israel uno animo atque sententia.
verses.english: they all gathered together, united in mind and purpose, to fight against Joshua and the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Hi vero qui habitabant in Gabaon audientes omnia quae fecerat Iosue Iericho et Hai
verses.english: However, the people who lived in Gibeon, having heard everything that Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,

verses.latin: et ipsi per rursum calliditate sunt usi accipiens cibaria vetusta et sacci asininis scissos et resarcitos et calceamenta perantiqua quae consuta erant ruptis pelles in pedibus
verses.english: they too resorted to trickery. They took old, worn-out provisions, torn and mended sacks for their donkeys, and very old, patched-up sandals on their feet.

verses.latin: vestiti quoque erant veteribus indumentis panesque quos in viam detulerant duri erant et in pulverem comminuti.
verses.english: They were also dressed in old garments, and the bread they carried for their journey was hard and crumbled into dust.

verses.latin: Perrexeruntque ad Iosue qui tunc morabatur in Galgalis et dixerunt ei atque omni simul Israeli : De terra longinqua venimus obsecramus vos ut ineatis foedus nobiscum.
verses.english: They came to Joshua, who was then staying in Gilgal, and said to him, and to all the Israelites assembled, "We have come from a distant land. We earnestly ask you to make a covenant with us."

verses.latin: Responderuntque viri Israel Gabaonitis atque dixerunt: Ne forte habitetis in terra nostra et non possimus foedus inire vobiscum.
verses.english: The men of Israel answered the Gibeonites and said, "Perhaps you live in our land, and in that case, we cannot make a covenant with you."

verses.latin: At illi ad Iosue: Servi tui sumus, dixerunt. Cui Iosue: Quinam, inquit, estis, et unde venistis?
verses.english: But they said to Joshua, "We are your servants." Joshua asked them, "Who are you, then, and where have you come from?"

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: De terra longinqua valde venerunt servi tui ad nomen Domini Dei vestri. Audivimus enim famam potentiae eius omnia quae fecit in Aegypto
verses.english: They answered: "Your servants have come from a very distant land because of the fame of the Lord your God. For we have heard of His mighty power, all that He did in Egypt,"

verses.latin: et duobus regibus Amorrhoeorum trans Iordanem Seon regi Hesebon et Og regi Basan qui fuit in Astaroth.
verses.english: "and to the two kings of the Amorites across the Jordan River: Sihon, king of Heshbon, and Og, king of Bashan, who was in Ashtaroth."

verses.latin: Unde locuti sunt nobis maiores nostri et omnes habitatores terrae dicentes: Tollite in manibus cibaria in via proficiscimini obviam eis et dicite: Servi vestri sumus, foedus inite nobiscum.
verses.english: "Therefore, our elders and all the inhabitants of our land told us, saying: 'Take provisions with you for the journey, and go to meet them, and say: "We are your servants; make a covenant with us."'"

verses.latin: Ecce panis iste quem egressi sumus de domibus nostris calidum cepimus, quando profecti sumus ad vos, hodie vero siccus est et in pulverem comminutus.
verses.english: "See, this bread, which we took warm from our homes when we set out to come to you, is now dry and crumbled into dust."

verses.latin: Utre aquarii quando implevimus novi erant, et nunc rupti atque consuti sunt. Vestes istae et calciamenta quibus induimur et quae habemus in pedibus, propter longissimam viam vetustate consumpta sunt.
verses.english: "These wineskins, which we filled, were new, but now they are torn and mended. These garments and sandals which we are wearing on our feet are worn out from the very long journey."

verses.latin: Susceperunt igitur viri cibaria eorum et os Domini non interrogaverunt.
verses.english: So the men of Israel accepted their provisions but did not consult the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Fecitque Iosue cum eis pacem et pepigit foedus ut viverent et iuraverunt principes multitudinis.
verses.english: Joshua then made peace with them and struck a covenant to let them live, and the leaders of the assembly swore an oath to it.

verses.latin: Post tres autem dies initi foederis audierunt quod in vicino essent et in media eorum regione habitarent.
verses.english: However, three days after the covenant was made, they heard that the Gibeonites were actually nearby and lived right in the midst of their region.

verses.latin: Moveruntque castra filii Israel et venerunt in civitates eorum die tertio quarum haec erant nomina: Gabaon et Cafira et Beroth et Cariathiarim.
verses.english: So the children of Israel broke camp and came to their cities on the third day. These were their names: Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.

verses.latin: Et non percusserunt eos filii Israel eo quod iurassent eis principes multitudinis in nomine Domini Dei Israel. Murmuravit ergo omnis exercitus contra principes.
verses.english: But the children of Israel did not strike them down, because the leaders of the assembly had sworn an oath to them in the name of the Lord, the God of Israel. Therefore, the entire army grumbled against the leaders.

verses.latin: Qui responderunt eis: Iuravimus, inquiunt, illis in nomine Domini Dei Israel et idcirco non possumus eos contingere.
verses.english: The leaders answered them, saying, "We have sworn an oath to them in the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, and therefore we cannot touch them."

verses.latin: Sed hoc faciemus eis: Salvi sint, et in lignorum caedem aquarumque conportationem in utilitatem cunctae multitudinis sempiternae serviant.
verses.english: "But we will do this for them: let them live, but they will eternally serve the entire assembly by cutting wood and carrying water."

verses.latin: Locutique sunt principes de Gabaonitis ut viverent et sicut dixerant principes caederent ligna et aquas conporterent in omnem multitudinem.
verses.english: So the leaders spoke concerning the Gibeonites, that they should live, and as the leaders had said, they should cut wood and carry water for the entire assembly.

verses.latin: Vocavit autem Iosue illos et locutus est eis dicens: Cur nos decipere voluistis ut diceretis: De longinquo valde habitamus a vobis, cum in medio nostri sitis?
verses.english: Then Joshua called them and spoke to them, saying, "Why did you want to deceive us, by saying, 'We live very far away from you,' when in fact you are right in our midst?"

verses.latin: Idcirco eritis maledicti et non deficiet de stirpe vestra ligna caedens aquasque portans in domum Dei mei.
verses.english: "Therefore, you will be cursed, and there will never cease from your descendants those who cut wood and carry water for the house of my God."

verses.latin: Qui responderunt Iosue et dixerunt: Timuimus valde ne auferretis animas nostras a facie vestra propter hanc causam fecimus sermonem istum. Audivimus enim quod praecepisset Dominus Deus tuus Moysi servo suo ut tecum omnes interficeret habitatores terrae.
verses.english: They answered Joshua and said, "We were very afraid that you would take our lives from us, because of this we did this thing. For we heard that the Lord your God had commanded His servant Moses to destroy all the inhabitants of the land with you."

verses.latin: Nunc igitur in manu tua sumus. Quodcumque tibi rectum videtur et bonum, facito nobis.
verses.english: "Now therefore, we are in your hand. Whatever seems right and good to you, do to us."

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Iosue eis sicut locutus est et liberavit eos de manu filiorum Israel ut non occiderentur.
verses.english: So Joshua did to them as he had spoken, and he delivered them from the hand of the children of Israel, so that they were not killed.

verses.latin: Attamen statuit eos in die illa in ligna caedendos et aquas conportandos in usum universi populi et altaris Domini usque in praesentem diem in loco quem elegisset.
verses.english: Nevertheless, on that day, he appointed them to be woodcutters and water carriers for the use of all the people and for the altar of the Lord, right up to the present day, in the place which God would choose.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo, ut audisset Adonisedec rex Jerusalem, quod cepisset Josue Hai, et subvertisset eam (sicut enim fecerat Jericho et regi ejus, sic fecerat Hai et regi illius), et quod Gabaonitae sponte se dedissent Israeli, et essent in foedere.
verses.english: When Adonisedec, the king of Jerusalem, heard the news that Joshua had taken Ai and utterly destroyed it—repeating the same total destruction he had brought upon Jericho and its king for Ai and its king—he also heard that the Gibeonites had willingly surrendered to Israel and entered into a peace treaty with them.

verses.latin: timuerunt valde Gabaon enim civitas magna erat, et quasi una de regalibus civitatibus, et major oppido Hai, omnesque viri ejus robustissimi.
verses.english: They feared greatly, for Gibeon was a large city, one counted among the royal cities, and it was even greater than the town of Ai. All of its men were very strong warriors.

verses.latin: Misit itaque Adonisedec rex Jerusalem ad Oham regem Hebron, et ad Pharam regem Jerimoth, et ad Japhia regem Lachis, et ad Dabir regem Eglon, dicens:
verses.english: So Adonisedec, the king of Jerusalem, sent messengers to Hoham, the king of Hebron; to Piram, the king of Jarmuth; to Japhia, the king of Lachish; and to Debir, the king of Eglon, saying this:

verses.latin: Venite ad me, et ferte praesidium, ut percutiamus Gabaon, quia sponte se tradidit Josue et filiis Israel.
verses.english: “Come to me and provide military aid, so that we may attack Gibeon, because they have willingly surrendered to Joshua and the sons of Israel.”

verses.latin: Congregati igitur abierunt quinque reges Amorrhaeorum: rex Jerusalem, rex Hebron, rex Jerimoth, rex Lachis, rex Eglon, simul cum suis exercitibus, et castrametati sunt per circuitum Gabaon, oppugnantes eam.
verses.english: So these five kings of the Amorites gathered together—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon—and they marched with their armies. They set up camp around Gibeon and began to besiege it.

verses.latin: Miserunt autem habitatores Gabaon ad Josue in castra Gilgal, atque dixerunt: Ne subtrahas manus tuas ab auxiliariis tuis: ascende cito, et libera nos, ferque praesidium: quoniam convenerunt adversum nos omnes reges Amorrhaeorum, qui habitant in montanis.
verses.english: The inhabitants of Gibeon then sent a message to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal, saying, “Do not withdraw your help from your servants! Come up quickly and deliver us; bring us military aid, for all the kings of the Amorites who live in the hill country have gathered against us.”

verses.latin: Ascenditque Josue de Gilgal, et omnis exercitus virorum fortissimorum cum eo, et omnes robusti bellatores.
verses.english: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, and the entire army of very strong men went with him, along with all his robust warriors.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Ne timeas eos: in manus enim tuas tradidi illos, nullusque ex eis tibi resistere poterit.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Joshua, saying, “Do not fear them. For I have delivered them into your hands; none of them will be able to resist you in battle.”

verses.latin: Ascenditque Josue de Gilgal tota nocte, et super eos improvisus irruit.
verses.english: Joshua marched up from Gilgal throughout the entire night, and he unexpectedly attacked them at dawn.

verses.latin: Conturbavitque eos Dominus a facie Israel: et percussit plaga magna in Gabaon, persecutusque est eos per viam ascensus Bethoron, et usque Azeca et Maceda.
verses.english: The Lord threw them into confusion before Israel, and Joshua struck them with a great slaughter at Gibeon. He then pursued them along the road that ascends to Beth-Horon, and continued the chase as far as Azekah and Makkedah.

verses.latin: Cumque fugerent filios Israel, et essent in descensu Bethoron, misit Dominus super eos lapides grandes de caelo usque ad Azeca, et mortui sunt multo plures lapidibus grandinis, quam quos gladio percusserant filii Israel.
verses.english: As they fled from the sons of Israel and were on the descent from Beth-Horon, the Lord sent large hailstones down on them from the sky all the way to Azekah. Many more of them died from these hailstones than those whom the sons of Israel struck down with the sword.

verses.latin: Tunc locutus est Josue Domino in die qua tradidit Deus Amorrhaeum in manu Israel, dixitque coram in conspectu Israel: Sol, contra Gabaon ne movearis, et luna contra vallem Ajalon.
verses.english: Then Joshua spoke to the Lord on the day when God delivered the Amorites into the hand of Israel. He said publicly, in the sight of all Israel, “Sun, do not move from your position over Gibeon! And Moon, do not move from your position over the Valley of Ajalon!”

verses.latin: Steteruntque sol et luna, donec ulcisceretur se gens de inimicis suis. Nonne scriptum est hoc in Libro justorum, stetit sol in medio caeli, et non festinavit occumbere spatio unius diei?
verses.english: The sun stood still, and the moon remained in its place, until the nation of Israel had avenged themselves upon their enemies. Is this not written in the Book of Jasher? The sun stood in the middle of the sky and did not hasten to set for about an entire day.

verses.latin: Non fuit ante et postea tam longa dies, obediens Dominus voci hominis, et pugnans pro Israel.
verses.english: Neither before nor since has there been such a long day, for the Lord obeyed the voice of a man, and the Lord fought on behalf of Israel.

verses.latin: Reversusque est Josue cum omni Israel in castra Galgal.
verses.english: Joshua then returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.

verses.latin: Porro quinque reges fugerant, et se absconderant in spelunca urbis Maceda.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the five kings had fled and hidden themselves in a cave near the city of Makkedah.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est Josue, quod inventi essent quinque reges in spelunca urbis Maceda.
verses.english: It was reported to Joshua that the five kings had been found hiding in a cave near the city of Makkedah.

verses.latin: Qui praecepit, et ait: Volvite saxa grandia ad os speluncae, et ponite super ea viros, qui custodiant eos.
verses.english: Joshua gave orders, saying, “Roll large stones against the mouth of the cave, and place men over them to guard them.”

verses.latin: Vos autem nolite stare, sed persequimini hostes, et caeditis extremos: nullum deinceps concedite urbium ad quas confugerant introire, quos Dominus Deus vester conclusit in manibus vestris.
verses.english: He continued, “But you are not to stand still! Instead, pursue the enemies and strike down their rear guard. Do not allow any of them to re-enter the cities to which they were fleeing, for the Lord your God has delivered them into your hands.”

verses.latin: Igitur omnes prope concisi sunt, et paucissimi evaserunt, qui ingressi sunt civitates munitas.
verses.english: Consequently, nearly all of the enemy were cut down, and only a very small number escaped, making it into fortified cities.

verses.latin: Reversusque est omnis exercitus in Maceda ad Josue sanus et integer: nullusque mutire ausus est contra filios Israel.
verses.english: Then the entire army returned to Joshua at Makkedah, safe and sound. No one dared to utter a word against the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Praecepitque Josue, dicens: Aperite os speluncae, et educite ad me quinque reges de spelunca.
verses.english: Joshua then commanded, saying, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out those five kings to me from the cave.”

verses.latin: Feceruntque sic, et eduxerunt ad eum quinque reges de spelunca: regem Jerusalem, regem Hebron, regem Jerimoth, regem Lachis, regem Eglon.
verses.english: So they did as he commanded and brought the five kings out of the cave to him: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

verses.latin: Cumque educti essent, vocavit omnes viros Israel, et ait principibus exercitus, qui secum erant: Ite, et ponite pedes vestros super colla regum istorum. Cumque illi accessissent, et subjectis pedibus calcasent colla eorum,
verses.english: When the kings had been brought out, Joshua called for all the men of Israel and said to the commanders of the army who were with him, “Come forward and place your feet upon the necks of these kings.” When they had come forward and placed their feet on their necks,

verses.latin: rursum ait: Nolite timere, neque paveatis, confortamini, et estote robusti: sic enim faciet Dominus cunctis hostibus vestris, adversum quos dimicatis.
verses.english: Joshua said to them again, “Do not be afraid or discouraged. Be strong and courageous! For in this very way, the Lord will treat all your enemies against whom you fight.”

verses.latin: Percussitque Josue, et interfecit eos, appendens in lignis quatuor, qui pependerunt usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Joshua then struck them down and killed them, hanging their bodies on four separate trees. They hung there until the evening.

verses.latin: Cumque occumberet sol, praecepit, et deposuerunt cadavera eorum de patibulis: projeceruntque in speluncam, in qua latuerant, et posuerunt super os ejus saxa ingentia, quae permanent usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: When the sun was setting, Joshua gave the order, and they took their bodies down from the stakes. They then threw them into the cave where they had hidden, and they placed enormous stones over its mouth, which remain there to this very day.

verses.latin: Eodem quoque die Macedam cepit Josue, et percussit eam in ore gladii, regemque illius interfecit, et omnes qui fuerant in ea, nullas in ea relinquens reliquias: fecitque regi Maceda, sicut fecerat regi Jericho.
verses.english: On that very day, Joshua captured Makkedah. He struck the city with the edge of the sword, killing its king and all the people in it, leaving no survivors. He treated the king of Makkedah just as he had treated the king of Jericho.

verses.latin: Transivitque cum omni Israel de Maceda in Lebna, et oppugnabat eam:
verses.english: Joshua then marched with all Israel from Makkedah to Libnah, and he attacked it.

verses.latin: quam et tradidit Dominus in manu Israel cum rege suo, percusseruntque urbem in ore gladii, et omnes animas quae in ea morabantur, nullas in ea relinquentes reliquias. Feceruntque regi Lebna sicut fecerant regi Jericho.
verses.english: The Lord also delivered Libnah and its king into the hand of Israel. Joshua struck the city with the edge of the sword, and every living soul who resided in it, leaving no survivors there. They treated the king of Libnah just as they had treated the king of Jericho.

verses.latin: De Lebna transivit in Lachis cum omni Israel: et exercitu per gyrum posito, oppugnabat eam.
verses.english: From Libnah, Joshua passed on to Lachish with all Israel. They encamped around it and attacked it.

verses.latin: Tradiditque Dominus Lachis in manu Israel, et cepit eam die secunda, atque percussit in ore gladii omnes animas, quae in ea fuerant, sicut fecerat Lebna.
verses.english: The Lord delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel, and they captured it on the second day. Joshua struck every living soul who had been in it with the edge of the sword, just as he had done to Libnah.

verses.latin: Eo tempore ascendit Horam rex Gezer, ut ferret auxilium Lachis: quem percussit Josue cum omni populo ejus usque ad internicionem.
verses.english: At that very time, Hoham, the king of Gezer, came up to provide aid to Lachish. But Joshua struck him and all his people until not one survivor remained.

verses.latin: Transivitque de Lachis in Eglon, et pertransivit cum omni Israel: obseditque, atque pugnavit contra eam.
verses.english: Joshua then moved from Lachish to Eglon, passing through with all Israel. He besieged the city and fought against it.

verses.latin: Cepitque eam in eodem die, et in ore gladii percussit omnes, qui in ea fuerant, interfecitque cunctas animas, sicut fecerat Lachis.
verses.english: He captured it on the same day and struck all who were in it with the edge of the sword, killing every living soul, just as he had done to Lachish.

verses.latin: Ascendit quoque cum omni Israel de Eglon in Hebron, et pugnavit contra eam:
verses.english: Joshua also went up from Eglon to Hebron with all Israel and fought against it.

verses.latin: cepitque eam, et percussit in ore gladii, regem quoque ejus, et omnia oppida regionis illius, universasque animas, quae in ea fuerant: nihil in ea relinquens reliquiarum, sicut fecerat Eglon, sic fecit et Hebron, cuncta consumens quae in ea repperit.
verses.english: He captured it and struck it with the edge of the sword, along with its king, all its towns in that region, and every living soul who was in it. He left no survivors in it. Just as he had done to Eglon, so he did to Hebron, utterly destroying everything he found within it.

verses.latin: Inde reversus in Dabir, cepit eam, atque in ore gladii percussit regem quoque ejus, et omnia oppida per circuitum, universasque animas, quae in ea fuerant.
verses.english: Then Joshua returned to Debir, captured it, and struck it with the edge of the sword. He also killed its king, all the surrounding towns, and every living soul who was in it.

verses.latin: Non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias: sicut fecerat Hebron, et Lebna, et regibus earum, ita fecit Dabir et regi ejus.
verses.english: He left no survivors in it. Just as he had done to Hebron and Libnah and their kings, so he did to Debir and its king.
