verses.latin: Perussit itaque Josue omnem terram montanam, et meridianam atque campestrem et Asedoth, cum regibus suis: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias, sed omne quod spirare poterat, interfecit, sicut praeceperat ei Dominus Deus Israel.
verses.english: So Joshua struck down all the land of the hill country, the Negeb in the south, the lowland, and the slopes, along with all their kings. He left no survivors in any of it, but utterly destroyed everything that could breathe, just as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Adonisedec rex Ierusalem, videlicet quomodo cepisset Iosue Hai, et subvertisset eam (sicut enim fecerat Jericho et regi ejus, sic fecit Hai et regi illius), et quomodo Gabaonitae sponte se dedissent Israeli, et essent in foedere eorum:
verses.english: When Adonisedec, the king of Jerusalem, heard that Joshua had captured Ai and utterly destroyed it—he had done the same to Ai and its king as he had done to Jericho and its king—and that the Gibeonites had willingly surrendered to Israel and were now allied with them:

verses.latin: timuit valde, et omnes urbis Gabaonitis, eo quod esset civitas magna, et inter regales, et major oppido Hai, et omnes viri ejus fortissimi.
verses.english: he feared greatly, especially because the city of Gibeon was a great city, counted among the royal cities, larger than the town of Ai, and all its men were very strong warriors.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Adonisedec rex Ierusalem ad Oham regem Hebron, et ad Pharam regem Ierimoth, et ad Iaphia regem Lachis, et ad Dabir regem Eglon, dicens:
verses.english: So Adonisedec, the king of Jerusalem, sent messengers to Hoham, the king of Hebron, and to Piram, the king of Jarmuth, and to Japhia, the king of Lachish, and to Debir, the king of Eglon, saying:

verses.latin: Venite ad me, et ferte praesidium, ut percutiamus Gabaon, quia dedit se Iosue, et filiis Israel.
verses.english: “Come to me and bring your forces, so that we may attack Gibeon. For it has surrendered to Joshua and the children of Israel.”

verses.latin: Convocati igitur, abierunt quinque reges Amorrhaeorum: rex Ierusalem, rex Hebron, rex Ierimoth, rex Lachis, et rex Eglon, ipsi et omnes copiae eorum: ascenderuntque, et castrametati sunt per gyrum Gabaon, obpugnantes eam.
verses.english: So, having been called together, the five kings of the Amorites went: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon. They, along with all their armies, went up and encamped around Gibeon, attacking it.

verses.latin: Miseruntque habitatores Gabaon ad Iosue, qui tunc morabatur in Galgalis, atque dixerunt ei: Ne subtrahas manus tuas ab auxiliis servorum tuorum: ascende cito, et libera nos, ferque praesidium: quia convenerunt adversum nos omnes reges Amorrhaeorum, qui habitant in montanis.
verses.english: And the inhabitants of Gibeon sent a message to Joshua, who at that time was staying at Gilgal, and they said to him: “Do not withdraw your aid from your servants. Come up quickly and deliver us, and bring us help, because all the kings of the Amorites who live in the mountains have gathered against us.”

verses.latin: Ascenditque Iosue de Galgalis, et omnis exercitus bellatorum cum eo, et fortissimi viri.
verses.english: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, and the entire army of warriors with him, including all his strongest men.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Iosue: Ne timeas eos: in manus enim tuas tradidi illos: nullusque ex eis tibi resistere poterit.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Joshua: “Do not fear them. For I have delivered them into your hands, and none of them will be able to resist you.”

verses.latin: Irruit itaque Iosue super eos repente, tota nocte de Galgalis ascendens.
verses.english: So Joshua suddenly attacked them, having marched all night from Gilgal.

verses.latin: Et conturbavit eos Dominus a facie Israel: contrivitque plaga magna in Gabaon, et persecutus est viam ascensus Bethoron, et percussit usque Azeca, et Maceda.
verses.english: And the Lord threw them into confusion before Israel, and crushed them with a great slaughter at Gibeon. And Israel pursued them by the way leading up to Beth-horon, striking them all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.

verses.latin: Cumque fugerent ab Israel, et essent in descensu Bethoron, misit Dominus super eos lapides grandinis magnos de caelo usque Azeca: et multo plures interierunt lapidibus grandinis, quam quos gladio percusserant filii Israel.
verses.english: And as they were fleeing from Israel and were on the descent of Beth-horon, the Lord sent large hailstones down upon them from the sky all the way to Azekah. Many more died from the hailstones than those whom the children of Israel had killed with the sword.

verses.latin: Tunc locutus est Iosue ad Dominum in die qua tradidit Dominus Amorrhaeum in conspectu filiorum Israel, et dixit in conspectu ejus: Sol contra Gabaon ne movearis, et luna contra vallem Ajalon.
verses.english: Then Joshua spoke to the Lord on the day when the Lord delivered the Amorites into the sight of the children of Israel. He said in the sight of all the people: “Sun, stand still over Gibeon, and Moon, stand still over the Valley of Aijalon.”

verses.latin: Steteruntque sol et luna, donec ulcisceretur se gens de inimicis suis. Nonne scriptum est hoc in libro Iustorum? Stetit itaque sol in medio caeli, et non properavit occumbere spatio unius diei.
verses.english: And the sun stood still and the moon stopped, until the nation had taken vengeance on its enemies. Is this not written in the Book of Jashar? So the sun stood still in the middle of the sky, and it did not hasten to set for a whole day.

verses.latin: Non fuit ante et postea tam longa dies, obediens Dominus voci hominis, et pugnans pro Israel.
verses.english: There has not been a day so long, before or since, when the Lord obeyed the voice of a man and fought for Israel.

verses.latin: Reversusque est Iosue, et omnis Israel cum eo, in castra Galgalis.
verses.english: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, returned to the camp at Gilgal.

verses.latin: Nam quinque reges fugerant, et se absconderant in spelunca urbis Maceda.
verses.english: For the five kings had fled and hidden themselves in a cave near the city of Makkedah.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est Iosue quod inventi essent quinque reges latentes in spelunca urbis Maceda.
verses.english: And it was reported to Joshua that the five kings had been found hiding in a cave near the city of Makkedah.

verses.latin: Qui praecepit, et ait: Volvite saxa ingentia ad os speluncae, et ponite super ea viros qui eos diligenter custodiant.
verses.english: He commanded and said: “Roll large stones to the mouth of the cave, and station men over them to guard them carefully.”

verses.latin: Vos autem nolite stare, sed persequimini hostes, et omnes extremos agminis fugientium caedite: ne permittatis eos urbium suarum intrare praesidia, quos tradidit Dominus Deus vester in manus vestras.
verses.english: “But you, do not stand still. Instead, pursue your enemies and strike down all the stragglers of their fleeing army. Do not allow them to enter the protection of their cities, for the Lord your God has delivered them into your hands.”

verses.latin: Caesarum igitur tanta caede hostium, et prope jam consumptis, his videlicet qui evadere potuerant, et ingressi fuerant civitates munitas,
verses.english: So, after such a great slaughter of their enemies, and almost completely destroying them—meaning those who had been able to escape and enter fortified cities—

verses.latin: reversus est omnis exercitus ad Iosue in Maceda, sanus, et incolumis: nullusque contra filios Israel mutire ausus est.
verses.english: the entire army returned to Joshua at Makkedah, safe and sound. No one dared to utter a word against the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Iosue: Aperite os speluncae, et producite mihi quinque reges de spelunca.
verses.english: And Joshua said: “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out the five kings from the cave to me.”

verses.latin: Feceruntque ita: et eduxerunt ad eum quinque reges de spelunca: regem Ierusalem, regem Hebron, regem Ierimoth, regem Lachis, et regem Eglon.
verses.english: And they did so. They brought out the five kings to him from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

verses.latin: Cumque educti essent, vocavit omnes viros Israel, et ait principibus exercitus, et ducibus bellatorum qui secum erant: Ite, et ponite pedes super colla regum istorum. Cumque illi accessissent, et pedibus calcaverunt colla eorum,
verses.english: And when they were brought out, Joshua called all the men of Israel, and he said to the commanders of the army and the leaders of the warriors who were with him: “Come forward and place your feet on the necks of these kings.” So they came near and stepped on their necks.

verses.latin: rursum dixit ad eos: Nolite timere, neque trepidare: confortamini, et estote robusti: sic enim faciet Dominus cunctis hostibus vestris, adversum quos dimicatis.
verses.english: Again he said to them: “Do not be afraid, nor be dismayed. Be strong and be firm, for the Lord will do this to all your enemies against whom you fight.”

verses.latin: Percussitque Iosue, et interfecit eos, suspenditque in quinque arboribus: fueruntque suspensi usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: And Joshua struck them and killed them, and he hanged them on five trees. They remained hanging until evening.

verses.latin: Cumque occumberet sol, praecepit Iosue, ut deponerent eos de patibulis. Qui depositos projecerunt in speluncam in qua latuerant, et posuerunt super os ejus saxa ingentia, quae permanent usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: And when the sun was setting, Joshua commanded them to take them down from the gallows. So they took them down and threw them into the cave where they had hidden, and they placed large stones over its mouth, which remain there to this very day.

verses.latin: Eodem quoque die Macedam cepit Iosue, et percussit eam in ore gladii, regemque illius, et omnes habitatores ejus interfecit: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias: fecitque regi Maceda, sicut fecerat regi Jericho.
verses.english: On that same day, Joshua captured Makkedah and struck it down with the edge of the sword. He killed its king and all its inhabitants, leaving no survivors in it. And he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.

verses.latin: Transivitque Iosue, et omnis Israel cum eo de Maceda ad Lebna, et pugnabat contra eam:
verses.english: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, passed from Makkedah to Libnah, and he fought against it.

verses.latin: quam tradidit Dominus cum rege suo in manus Israel, percussitque urbem in ore gladii, et omnes habitatores ejus: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias: fecitque regi Lebna, sicut fecerat regi Jericho.
verses.english: The Lord delivered it, along with its king, into the hands of Israel. Joshua struck the city with the edge of the sword, and all its inhabitants. He left no survivors in it, and he did to the king of Libnah as he had done to the king of Jericho.

verses.latin: Inde transivit Iosue, et omnis Israel cum eo de Lebna in Lachis: et exercitu per gyrum disposito, oppugnavit eam.
verses.english: From there, Joshua, and all Israel with him, passed from Libnah to Lachish. Having arranged his army all around it, he attacked it.

verses.latin: Tradiditque Dominus Lachis in manus Israel, et cepit eam die altero, ac percussit in ore gladii, omnesque mortuos in ea, sicut fecerat Lebna.
verses.english: And the Lord delivered Lachish into the hands of Israel. Joshua captured it on the second day and struck it down with the edge of the sword, killing everyone in it, just as he had done to Libnah.

verses.latin: Eo tempore ascendit Horam rex Gezer ut opem ferret Lachis: quem percussit Iosue cum omni populo ejus, usque ad internecionem.
verses.english: At that time, Horam, the king of Gezer, came up to bring aid to Lachish. Joshua struck him and all his people until not one was left alive.

verses.latin: Transivitque Iosue, et omnis Israel cum eo de Lachis in Eglon, et circumdedit, atque oppugnavit eam,
verses.english: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, passed from Lachish to Eglon. They surrounded it and attacked it.

verses.latin: cepitque eam in eodem die, et in ore gladii percussit omnes qui erant in ea, juxta ritum caesis quae in Lebna fecerat.
verses.english: He captured it on that same day and struck down with the edge of the sword everyone who was in it, in the same manner as the slaughter he had carried out in Libnah.

verses.latin: Ascendit quoque Iosue, et omnis Israel cum eo de Eglon in Hebron, et pugnabat contra eam,
verses.english: Joshua also went up, and all Israel with him, from Eglon to Hebron, and he fought against it.

verses.latin: cepitque eam, et percussit in ore gladii, regem quoque ejus, et omnes civitates regionis illius, universosque habitatores ejus: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias: sicut fecerat Eglon, sic fecit Hebron, et universis urbibus ejus.
verses.english: He captured it and struck it down with the edge of the sword. He also struck down its king and all the cities of that region, and all its inhabitants. He left no survivors in it. Just as he had done to Eglon, so he did to Hebron and to all its surrounding towns.

verses.latin: Reversus inde Iosue, et omnis Israel cum eo in Dabir, pugnavit contra eam,
verses.english: Returning from there, Joshua, and all Israel with him, went to Debir and fought against it.

verses.latin: et cepit ac vastavit, omnemque animam quae in ea fuerat interfecit: non dimisit in illa ullas reliquias. Sicut fecerat Hebron et Lebna, sic fecit Dabir et regi ejus.
verses.english: He captured it and utterly destroyed it, killing every living soul that was in it. He left no survivors there. Just as he had done to Hebron and Libnah, so he did to Debir and its king.

verses.latin: Perussit itaque Iosue omnem terram montanam, et australem atque campestrem, et Asedoth, cum regibus suis: non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias, sed omne quod spirabat interfecit, sicut praeceperat ei Dominus Deus Israel.
verses.english: So Joshua struck down all the mountainous land, and the southern region, and the lowlands, and the slopes of the mountains, along with all their kings. He left no survivors in it, but killed everything that breathed, just as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.

verses.latin: Audivit autem Iabin rex Asor et misit ad Iobab regem Madon et ad regem Semeron atque ad regem Achsaph
verses.english: When Jabin, the king of Hazor, heard what had happened, he sent messengers to Jobab, the king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph.

verses.latin: atque ad reges qui ad aquilonem erant montium et campestrium locorum ad meridiem Ceneroth et in campestribus ac regionibus Dor juxta mare
verses.english: He also sent to the kings in the northern mountainous regions, and in the plains south of Chinneroth, and in the lowlands, and in the region of Dor, which is by the sea.

verses.latin: Cananæo quoque ab oriente et occidente et Amorræo atque Hethæo et Pherezæo ac Jebusæo in montanis Hevæo sub Hermon in terra Maspha.
verses.english: He also sent to the Canaanites in the east and west, and to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, and the Jebusites who lived in the mountainous areas, and to the Hivites who lived below Mount Hermon in the land of Mizpah.

verses.latin: Egressique sunt omnes cum turmis suis populus plurimus sicut arena quæ est in littore maris equorumque et curruum infinita multitudo.
verses.english: So all these kings went out with their armies; a great many people, as numerous as the sand on the seashore, with an endless multitude of horses and chariots.

verses.latin: Convenientesque simul venerunt et castrametati sunt ad aquas Merom ut pugnarent contra Israël.
verses.english: They gathered together and came as one, and they camped by the waters of Merom to fight against the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Josue: Ne timeas eos cras enim hac hora ego dabo omnes istos vulneratos in conspectu Israël equos eorum subnervabis et currus eorum igne conbures.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Joshua: "Do not be afraid of them, because tomorrow at this very hour, I will hand all these people over, defeated, into the presence of Israel. You will hamstring their horses, rendering them useless, and burn their chariots with fire."

verses.latin: Venitque Josue et omnis exercitus cum eo adversus illos ad aquas Merom repente et inruerunt super eos.
verses.english: So Joshua and all his army came upon them suddenly at the waters of Merom and attacked them.

verses.latin: Tradiditque illos Dominus in manu Israël qui percusserunt eos et persecuti sunt omnes usque ad Sidonem magnam et aquas Maserephoth et campum Maspha ab orientali parte fugaveruntque illos percusseruntque usque ad internicionem.
verses.english: The Lord handed them over into the power of Israel, who struck them down and pursued all of them as far as Great Sidon, and to Misrephoth-Maim, and to the Valley of Mizpah on the east. They drove them away and struck them down until there was no one left alive.

verses.latin: Fecitque Josue sicut præceperat Dominus equos eorum subnervavit et currus conbusit igne.
verses.english: And Joshua did exactly as the Lord had commanded: he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.

verses.latin: Reversusque in tempore illo cepit Asor et regem ejus interfecit gladio Asor enim antiquitus inter omnia regna hæc principatum tenebat.
verses.english: At that time, Joshua returned and captured Hazor and killed its king with the sword, because Hazor had historically held the chief authority among all these kingdoms.

verses.latin: Et percussit omnem animam quæ ibidem morabatur interfecitque eam non dimisit in ea ullas reliquias sed cuncta vastavit usque ad solitudinem.
verses.english: And he struck down every living soul who resided there, utterly destroying them. He left no survivors in Hazor, but utterly devastated everything until it was desolate.

verses.latin: Cunctas quoque urbes et reges earum cepit Josue et percussit in ore gladii usque ad internicionem sicut præceperat ei Moyses famulus Domini.
verses.english: Joshua also captured all the other cities of these kings and their kings themselves, striking them down with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them, just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded him.

verses.latin: Exceptis his urbibus quæ erant in collibus et in tumulis sitæ cunctas Josue conbusit haec una Asor murata arte plurima.
verses.english: However, Joshua did not burn down any of the cities located on hills or mounds, except for Hazor alone, which he had burned down because it was a very heavily fortified city.

verses.latin: Omnemque prædam civitatum istarum et pecora diviserunt filii Israël sibimetipsis Absque omni anima non reliquerunt quemquam ex his quæ capi potuerant.
verses.english: But all the plunder from these cities and the livestock, the sons of Israel divided among themselves. They did not leave any person alive from all those they were able to capture.

verses.latin: Sicut præceperat Moyses famulus Domini Josue ita omnia conplevit non præteriit ex omnibus mandatis unum verbum quod jussit Dominus Mosi.
verses.english: Just as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had commanded Joshua, so Joshua completely fulfilled everything. He did not omit a single word from all the commands that the Lord had given to Moses.

verses.latin: Cepit itaque Josue omnem terram montanam et australem et terram Gosen et planitiem et occidentalem plagam montemque Israël et campestria ejus
verses.english: So Joshua took control of all the mountain country, and all the Negeb region in the south, and all the land of Goshen, and the plain, and the western region, and the mountainous country of Israel, and its lowlands.

verses.latin: a monte Halac qui ascendit in Seir usque Baalgad in planitie Libani subter montem Hermon cunctosque reges eorum conprehendit percussit et interfecit.
verses.english: He took the land from Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, all the way to Baal-gad in the Valley of Lebanon, below Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings, struck them down, and killed them.

verses.latin: Multo tempore pugnavit Josue contra reges istos.
verses.english: Joshua fought against these kings for a long time.

verses.latin: Non fuit civitas quæ se traderet filiis Israël præter Hevæum qui habitabat in Gabaon omnes enim bellantes cepit.
verses.english: There was not a single city that surrendered to the sons of Israel, except for the Hivites who lived in Gibeon. Joshua captured all the rest through warfare.

verses.latin: Domini enim sententia fuerat ut induraret corda eorum et pugnarent contra Israël et caderent et non mererentur ullam clementiam ac perirent sicut præceperat Dominus Mosi.
verses.english: For it was the Lord's will to harden their hearts so that they would fight against Israel and fall, and not deserve any mercy, and perish, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: In illo tempore venit Josue et interfecit Enacim de montanis Hebron et Dabir et Anab et de omni monte Juda et Israël urbesque eorum delevit.
verses.english: At that time, Joshua came and wiped out the Anakim from the mountainous regions of Hebron, Debir, and Anab, and from all the mountain country of Judah and Israel. He utterly destroyed their cities.

verses.latin: Non sunt reliquit ullus de stirpe Enacim in terra filiorum Israël absque Gaza et Geth et Azoto in quibus residui fuerunt.
verses.english: There were no Anakim left alive in the land of the sons of Israel, except in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod, where some survivors remained.

verses.latin: Cepit ergo Josue omnem terram sicut locutus est Dominus ad Mosen et dedit eam in possessionem filiis Israël secundum partes et tribus suas. Cessavitque terra a prœliis.
verses.english: So Joshua took possession of all the land, just as the Lord had promised to Moses. He gave it as an inheritance to the sons of Israel, according to their divisions and their tribes. And then the land had rest from the battles.

verses.latin: His igitur auditis, misit Iabin rex Asor ad Iobab regem Madon, et ad regem Semeron, et ad regem Achsaph:
verses.english: After hearing all these things, King Jabin of Hazor sent messengers to King Jobab of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph;

verses.latin: ad reges quoque septentrionalium partium, qui propinquiora loca tenebant, montanos et campestres ad meridiem Ceneroth, Samarites quoque et Nafeth Dor per maritimam regionem:
verses.english: He also sent to the kings of the northern regions, who held the nearby territories: to the mountain dwellers and those who lived in the plains south of Chinnereth (which is the Sea of Galilee), and to the Samarites and the Nafeth Dor who lived along the coastal region.

verses.latin: ad Chanaanæum quoque ab oriente et occidente, et Amorrhæum, atque Hethæum, ac Pherezæum, et Iebusæum in montanis: Eveum quoque qui habitabat sub Hermon in terra Maspha.
verses.english: He sent also to the Canaanites in the east and west, and to the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Jebusites in the mountains; and to the Hivites who lived under Mount Hermon, in the land of Mizpah.

verses.latin: Egressique sunt omnes cum turmis suis, populus multus nimis, sicut arena quæ est in littore maris ad multitudinem: et equi eorum atque currus innumerabiles.
verses.english: So they all came out with their armies—a vast multitude of people, as numerous as the sand on the seashore; and their horses and chariots were beyond counting.

verses.latin: Convenientesque simul, castrametati sunt ad aquas Merom, ut pugnarent contra Israël.
verses.english: And gathering together, they encamped by the waters of Merom, so that they could fight against Israel.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Iosue: Ne timeas eos: cras enim hac hora ego dabo omnes istos vulnerandos in conspectu Israël: equos eorum subnervabis, et currus igne combures.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Joshua: 'Do not be afraid of them, because at this time tomorrow, I will deliver all these people to be wounded before Israel. You shall hamstring their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.'

verses.latin: Venitque Iosue, et omnis exercitus cum eo, adversus illos ad aquas Merom repente, et irruerunt super eos.
verses.english: So Joshua and all his army came against them suddenly by the waters of Merom, and they rushed upon them.

verses.latin: Tradiditque illos Dominus in manu Israël: qui percusserunt eos, et persecuti sunt usque ad Sidonem magnam, et aquas Maserephoth, campumque Masphe, ad orientem: cecideruntque omnes absque ullis reliquiis.
verses.english: And the Lord delivered them into the hand of Israel, who struck them down and pursued them as far as Great Sidon, and to the waters of Misrephoth, and to the valley of Mizpah to the east. All of them fell, with no one left remaining.

verses.latin: Fecitque Iosue sicut præceperat Dominus, equos eorum subnervavit, et currus combussit igne.
verses.english: And Joshua did just as the Lord had commanded: he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.

verses.latin: Revertensque statim cepit Asor, et regem ejus interfecit gladio. Asor enim antiquitus caput erat omnium regnorum istorum.
verses.english: Then, immediately returning, he captured Hazor and put its king to death with the sword. For Hazor in ancient times was the capital city of all these kingdoms.

verses.latin: Et percussit omnem animam quæ ibi morabatur, in ore gladii desolavitque eam: non est ultra remansit anima ulla, quin universa consumerentur: et ipsam Asor incendio concremavit.
verses.english: And he struck down every living person who lived there with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them; no soul remained alive, but all were consumed. And he burned Hazor itself with fire.

verses.latin: Cunctasque urbes illas, et reges earum cepit Iosue, et percussit in ore gladii, atque delevit, sicut præceperat ei Moyses famulus Domini.
verses.english: Joshua captured all those cities and their kings, and struck them down with the edge of the sword, and completely destroyed them, just as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Absque urbibus quæ erant in collibus et tumulis sitæ, ad quarum eversionem Israël non pugnavit, unam tantum Asor Iosue succendit.
verses.english: However, Israel did not fight to overthrow the cities that were situated on hills and mounds; only Hazor did Joshua burn down.

verses.latin: Omnemque prædam civitatum istarum, et pecora, diviserunt sibi filii Israël: omnes homines occiderunt, nec reliquerunt ullos saltem respirantes.
verses.english: And all the plunder of these cities, and the livestock, the sons of Israel divided among themselves. They killed all the people, leaving no one breathing.

verses.latin: Sicut præceperat Moyses famulus Domini sibi, ita Iosue cuncta complevit: nihilque ex his omisit quæ mandata fuerant sibi.
verses.english: Just as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded him, so Joshua carried out everything. He omitted nothing of what had been commanded to him.

verses.latin: Cepit igitur Iosue omnem terram montanam, et meridianam, terramque Gosen, et planitiem, atque occidentalem plagam: montemque Israël, et campestria ejus,
verses.english: So Joshua took all the mountain land, and the southern land, and the land of Goshen, and the plain, and the western region; and the mountain of Israel, and its plains,

verses.latin: a monte Calvo, qui ascendit in Seir, usque Baalgad in planitie Libani subter montem Hermon: cunctosque reges eorum comprehendit, percussit et interfecit.
verses.english: from Mount Halak, which ascends to Seir, as far as Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon, below Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings, struck them down, and put them to death.

verses.latin: Multo tempore pugnavit Iosue contra reges istos.
verses.english: For a long time Joshua fought against these kings.

verses.latin: Non fuit civitas quæ se traderet filiis Israël, præter Hevæum, qui habitabat in Gabaon: omnes enim bellantes cepit.
verses.english: There was not one city that surrendered to the sons of Israel, except for the Hivites who lived in Gibeon; for Joshua captured all of them by war.

verses.latin: Domini enim fuerat sententia ut induraret corda eorum, et pugnarent contra Israël, et caderent, et non mererentur ullam clementiam, ac perirent, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: For it was the Lord's decision to harden their hearts, so that they would fight against Israel, and fall, and not deserve any mercy, but perish, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: In illo tempore venit Iosue, et interfecit Enacim de montanis, de Hebron, et Dabir, et Anab, et de omni monte Iuda et Israël, urbesque eorum delevit.
verses.english: At that time Joshua came and utterly destroyed the Anakim from the mountains—from Hebron, and from Debir, and from Anab, and from all the mountains of Judah and Israel. He also destroyed their cities.

verses.latin: Non reliquit ullum de stirpe Enacim in terra filiorum Israël: absque Gazar, et Azoto, et Geth, in quibus parvum quid remansit.
verses.english: He left none of the Anakim stock in the land of the sons of Israel, except for a small remnant in Gaza, and in Ashdod, and in Gath.

verses.latin: Cepit ergo Iosue omnem terram, sicut locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, et dedit eam in possessionem filiis Israël, secundum partes et tribus eorum: et quievit terra a præliis.
verses.english: So Joshua took all the land, just as the Lord had spoken to Moses, and he gave it as a possession to the sons of Israel, according to their divisions and tribes. And the land rested from war.

verses.latin: Hi sunt reges terrae, quos percusserunt filii Israel, et possederunt terram eorum trans Jordanem ad orientem solis: a torrente Arnon usque ad montem Hermon, et omnem orientalem plagam quae pertinet ad planitiem.
verses.english: These are the kings of the land whom the sons of Israel defeated. They took possession of their land on the other side of the Jordan River, to the east, stretching from the Arnon ravine all the way to Mount Hermon, encompassing the entire eastern plain.

verses.latin: Sehon rex Amorrhaeorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon, dominatus est ab Aroer, quae sita est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et mediae partis in torrente, atque dimidiae Galaad, usque ad torrentem Jaboc, qui est terminus filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, ruled from Aroer, which is situated on the bank of the Arnon ravine, including the middle section of the ravine itself, and half of Gilead, extending all the way to the Jabbok ravine, which marks the boundary of the sons of Ammon.

verses.latin: Et a solitudine, usque ad mare Ceneroth, contra orientem, et usque ad mare Solitudinis, quod est mare salsissimum, ad orientalem plagam per viam quae ducit Betsimoth: et ab australi parte sub Asedoth Phasga.
verses.english: His territory also extended from the desert all the way to the Sea of Chinneroth—the Sea of Galilee—on its eastern side, and south to the Dead Sea, which is the Salt Sea, along the eastern route that leads to Beth Jeshimoth, and from the southern part below the slopes of Pisgah.

verses.latin: Terminique Og regis Basan, de reliquiis Raphaim, qui habitavit in Astaroth et Edrai, et dominatus est in monte Hermon, et in Salecha, et in omni Basan usque ad terminos Gesuri et Machati, et dimidiam partem Galaad, terminos Sehon regis Hesebon.
verses.english: The boundaries of Og, king of Bashan, one of the last of the Rephaim giants, who lived in Ashtaroth and Edrei, stretched from Mount Hermon and Salecah, and included all of Bashan, extending to the borders of Geshur and Maachath, as well as half of Gilead, which was the territory of Sihon, king of Heshbon.

verses.latin: Ipsos percusserunt Moyses famulus Domini, et filii Israel: divisitque Moyses terram in possessionem Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiae tribus Manasse.
verses.english: Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the sons of Israel defeated these kings. And Moses divided their land as a possession for the tribes of Reuben and Gad, and for half of the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Hi sunt reges terrae, quos percusserunt Josue et filii Israel trans Jordanem contra occidentem, de Baalgad in campo Libani, usque ad montem, cujus pars ascendit in Seir: deditque Josue eam in possessionem tribubus Israel, singulis partem suam.
verses.english: These are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the sons of Israel defeated on the western side of the Jordan River. Their territory stretched from Baal-gad in the Valley of Lebanon, all the way to Mount Halak, whose slopes rise toward Seir. Joshua then gave this land as a possession to the tribes of Israel, each tribe receiving its portion.

verses.latin: In montanis et in campestribus, in campestribus quoque et in Asedoth, et in solitudine et in australi parte: Hethaeus et Amorrhaeus, Chananaeus et Pherezaeus, Hevaeus et Jebusaeus.
verses.english: This land included the hill country, the plains, the western foothills, the desert, and the Negeb—the southern region. It was the land of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.

verses.latin: Rex Jericho unus: rex Hai, quae est juxta Bethel, unus:
verses.english: The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is near Bethel, one;

verses.latin: rex Jerusalem unus, rex Hebron unus,
verses.english: the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;

verses.latin: rex Jerimoth unus, rex Lachis unus,
verses.english: the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;

verses.latin: rex Eglon unus, rex Gazer unus,
verses.english: the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;

verses.latin: rex Dabir unus, rex Gader unus,
verses.english: the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;

verses.latin: rex Herma unus, rex Hered unus,
verses.english: the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;

verses.latin: rex Lebna unus, rex Odollam unus,
verses.english: the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;

verses.latin: rex Maceda unus, rex Bethel unus,
verses.english: the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;

verses.latin: rex Thappua unus, rex Hepher unus,
verses.english: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;

verses.latin: rex Aphac unus, rex Leseron unus,
verses.english: the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;

verses.latin: rex Ason unus, rex Baalath unus,
verses.english: the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;

verses.latin: rex Meron unus, rex Semeron unus,
verses.english: the king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;

verses.latin: rex Achsaph unus, rex Thanac unus,
verses.english: the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;

verses.latin: rex Mageddo unus, rex Cades unus,
verses.english: the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;

verses.latin: rex Jecnaam de Carmelus unus, rex Dor et provinciarum Dor unus,
verses.english: the king of Dor, and of the region of Dor, one;

verses.latin: rex gentium Galgal unus, rex Tersa unus.
verses.english: the king of Goiim in Gilgal, one; the king of Tirzah, one.

verses.latin: Omnes reges triginta unus.
verses.english: All these kings total thirty-one.

verses.latin: Hi sunt reges terræ, quos percusserunt filii Israël, et possederunt terram eorum trans Jordanem ad solis ortum, a torrente Arnon usque ad montem Hermon, et omnem orientalem plagam quæ jacet ad solitudinem.
verses.english: These are the kings of the land whom the people of Israel defeated and whose land they took possession of. This was the territory east of the Jordan River, stretching from the Arnon stream all the way to Mount Hermon, including all the eastern plains that lead into the desert.

verses.latin: Sehon rex Amorrhæorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon, dominatus est ab Aroër, quæ sita est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et mediæ partis in torrente, dimidiæque Galaad, usque ad torrentem Jaboc, qui est terminus filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: One of them was Sihon, king of the Amorites, who ruled from Heshbon. His dominion extended from Aroer, which lies on the bank of the Arnon stream, through the middle of that stream's valley, and half of Gilead, up to the Jabbok stream, which served as the boundary for the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et a solitudine usque ad mare Ceneroth, contra orientem, et mare solitudinis, quod est mare Salsissimum, ad orientalem plagam per viam quæ ducit Betsimoth: et ab australi parte sub Asedoth Phasga.
verses.english: His territory also stretched from the desert to the Sea of Chinnereth in the east, and to the Sea of the Desert—which is the Salt Sea—on the eastern side, along the road that leads to Beth Jeshimoth. On the southern side, his border extended below the slopes of Pisgah.

verses.latin: Terminus quoque Og regis Basan, de reliquiis Raphaim, qui habitavit in Astaroth et Edrai, et dominatus est in monte Hermon, et in Salecha, et in omni Basan usque ad terminos Gesuri et Machati,
verses.english: The territory of Og, king of Bashan, was also conquered. He was one of the last of the Rephaim giants who lived in Ashtaroth and Edrei. He ruled over Mount Hermon, Salecah, and all of Bashan, extending to the borders of Geshur and Maachath.

verses.latin: et dimidiam partem Galaad, terminos Sehon regis Hesebon. Percusseruntque eos Moyses famulus Domini, et filii Israël: tradiditque terram eorum Moyses famulus Domini, Rubenitis et Gaditis et dimidiæ tribui Manasse.
verses.english: His dominion also included half of Gilead, up to the border of Sihon, king of Heshbon. Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the people of Israel defeated these kings. Moses, the Lord's servant, then gave their land as a possession to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Hi sunt reges terræ, quos percusserunt Josue et filii Israël trans Jordanem ad occidentem, de Baalgad in campo Libani, usque ad montem cujus pars ascendit in Seir: tradiditque eam Josue in possessionem tribubus Israël, singulis partem suam,
verses.english: These are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the people of Israel defeated west of the Jordan River. Their territory stretched from Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon all the way to Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir. Joshua gave this land as a possession to the tribes of Israel, assigning each tribe its own portion.

verses.latin: tam in montanis quam in campestribus atque humilioribus locis: in Saltu, et ad australem plagam.
verses.english: This distribution included lands in the mountainous regions, the western foothills, the plains, the southern desert, and the Arabah valley.

verses.latin: Hethæus et Amorrhæus, et Chananeus, et Pherezæus, et Hevæus, et Jebusæus.
verses.english: The people who inhabited these lands included the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

verses.latin: Rex Jericho unus: rex Hai, quæ est ex latere Bethel, unus:
verses.english: The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is near Bethel, one;

verses.latin: rex Jerusalem unus: rex Hebron unus:
verses.english: the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;

verses.latin: rex Jerimuth unus: rex Lachis unus:
verses.english: the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;

verses.latin: rex Eglon unus: rex Gazer unus:
verses.english: the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;

verses.latin: rex Dabir unus: rex Gader unus:
verses.english: the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;

verses.latin: rex Herma unus: rex Ader unus:
verses.english: the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;

verses.latin: rex Lebna unus: rex Odollam unus:
verses.english: the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;

verses.latin: rex Maceda unus: rex Bethel unus:
verses.english: the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;

verses.latin: rex Taphua unus: rex Hepher unus:
verses.english: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;

verses.latin: rex Aphec unus: rex Saron unus:
verses.english: the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;

verses.latin: rex Madon unus: rex Asor unus:
verses.english: the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;

verses.latin: rex Semeron Meron unus: rex Achsaph unus:
verses.english: the king of Shimron-Meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;

verses.latin: rex Thanach unus: rex Mageddo unus:
verses.english: the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;

verses.latin: rex Cades unus: rex Jecnaam de Carmel unus:
verses.english: the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;

verses.latin: rex Dor, et provinciæ Dor, unus: rex gentium Galgal, unus:
verses.english: the king of Dor, and its region, one; the king of Goyim in Gilgal, one;

verses.latin: rex Thersa unus: omnes reges triginta et unus.
verses.english: the king of Tirzah, one. In total, these are thirty-one kings.

verses.latin: Iosue senex processerat, magnæque ætatis, et dixit Dominus ad eum: Senuisti, et es multæ ætatis, et latissima terra superest, quæ necdum est divisa.
verses.english: Joshua had grown old and was very advanced in years. And the Lord said to him, "You are old, and very advanced in years, yet a vast territory remains which has not yet been divided among the tribes."

verses.latin: Hæc est terra quæ derelicta est: omnes regiones Philisthiim, universaque Gessuri.
verses.english: This is the territory that remains to be conquered: all the regions of the Philistines, and all of Geshur.

verses.latin: A Sihor, quæ est contra Ægyptum, usque ad fines Accaron contra aquilonem: terram Chanaan, quæ in quinque principes Philisthiim dividitur, Gazæos, et Azotios, Ascalonitas, Gethæos, et Accaronitas. Et Hevæi ab australi parte.
verses.english: It extends from the Shihor River, which is near Egypt, all the way to the northern border of Ekron. This is the land of the Canaanites, which is ruled by five Philistine lords: the leaders of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron. It also includes the Hivites in the south.

verses.latin: Ab australi parte omnis terra Chanaan, et Maara Sidoniorum usque Apheca et fines Amorrei:
verses.english: And from the south, all the land of Canaan, from Mearah of the Sidonians as far as Aphek and the territory of the Amorites.

verses.latin: Et terra Gæbali, et omnis Libani contra orientem a Baalgad sub monte Hermon, usque ad introitum Emath.
verses.english: And the land of Gebal, and all of Lebanon to the east, from Baal-gad at the foot of Mount Hermon, all the way to the entrance of Hamath.

verses.latin: Omnes qui habitant montem a Libano usque ad aquas Maserephoth, universique Sidonii: ego eos delebo a facie filiorum Israël: sic tamen ut in sorte mittas Israëlitis, sicut præcepi tibi.
verses.english: All who live in the mountainous region from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, and all the Sidonians—I will indeed drive them out from before the Israelites. You are to distribute this land by lot to the Israelites, just as I commanded you, even though it is not yet fully conquered.

verses.latin: Et nunc divide terram hanc in possessionem novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse.
verses.english: Therefore, you are to divide this land as an inheritance for the nine tribes, and for the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Cum quibus Ruben et Gad, et media tribus Manasse, acceperunt terram trans Jordanem contra orientem, quam dedit eis Moyses famulus Domini.
verses.english: (It is with these tribes that) Reuben and Gad, and the other half-tribe of Manasseh, received their territory east of the Jordan River, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, had already given to them.

verses.latin: Ab Aroer, quæ est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et oppido, quod in valle situm est, et universa planitie Medaba usque Dibon:
verses.english: Their territory began from Aroer, which is on the bank of the Arnon Gorge, and from the city in the middle of that valley, encompassing all the plain of Medeba as far as Dibon.

verses.latin: Et omnes civitates Sehon regis Amorræorum, qui regnavit in Hesebon, usque ad terminos filiorum Ammon:
verses.english: It included all the cities of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, extending all the way to the border of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et Galaad, et terminos Gessuri et Machati, omnemque montem Hermon, et universam Basan usque Salecah:
verses.english: It also included Gilead, the territory of Geshur and Maacah, all of Mount Hermon, and all of Bashan as far as Salecah.

verses.latin: Omne regnum Og in Basan, qui regnavit in Astaroth et Edrai, ipse fuit de reliquiis Raphaim: percussitque eos Moyses, atque delevit.
verses.english: This was the entire kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei. He was one of the last of the Rephaim giants. Moses had defeated them and completely destroyed them.

verses.latin: Nolueruntque filii Israël delere Gessuri et Machati: sed habitaverunt in medio Israël usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: However, the Israelites did not drive out the inhabitants of Geshur and Maacah. Instead, they have lived among Israel to this very day.

verses.latin: Tribui autem Levi non dedit possessionem: sed sacrificia et victimæ Domini Dei Israël, ipsa est ejus possessio, sicut locutus est illi.
verses.english: But to the tribe of Levi, Moses did not give any territorial inheritance. Instead, the sacrifices and offerings made to the Lord, the God of Israel, are their inheritance, just as He had commanded them through Moses.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo Moyses tribui filiorum Ruben juxta cognationes suas:
verses.english: So Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of Reuben, according to their clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum ab Aroer, quæ sita est in ripa torrentis Arnon, et in medio vallis, et universa planities quæ ducit Medabam:
verses.english: Their territory extended from Aroer, located on the bank of the Arnon Gorge, including the city in the middle of the valley and all the plain leading to Medeba.

verses.latin: Hesebon, et universæ villæ ejus, quæ sunt in campestribus: Dibon, et Bamothbaal, et oppidum Baalmaon,
verses.english: It included Heshbon and all its associated towns in the plains, along with Dibon, Bamoth-baal, and Beth-baal-meon.

verses.latin: Et Jassa, et Cedimoth, et Mephaath,
verses.english: Also Jahaz, Kedemoth, and Mephaath.

verses.latin: Et Cariathaim, et Sabama, et Sarathasahar in monte convallis.
verses.english: And Kiriathaim, Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar on the hill in the valley.

verses.latin: Bethphogor, et Asedoth Phasga, et Bethiesimoth,
verses.english: Beth-peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth.

verses.latin: Omnesque urbes campestres, universumque regnum Sehon regis Amorræi, qui regnavit in Hesebon, quem percussit Moyses cum principibus Madian: Eveo, et Recem, et Sur, et Hur, et Robe, duces Sehon, habitatores terræ.
verses.english: This included all the cities of the plain, and the entire kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon. Moses had defeated Sihon and also killed the Midianite princes: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were the leaders allied with Sihon and living in that land.

verses.latin: Balaam quoque filium Beor ariolum interfecerunt filii Israël gladio cum ceteris interfectis.
verses.english: The Israelites also killed Balaam, the son of Beor, the diviner, with the sword, along with all the others who were slain.

verses.latin: Factusque est terminus filiorum Ruben Jordan. Hæc est possessio Rubenitarum per cognationes suas, urbes et villæ earum.
verses.english: The Jordan River formed the western border for the descendants of Reuben. This was the inheritance of the Reubenites according to their clans, including their cities and their villages.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Moyses tribui Gad, et filiis ejus per cognationes suas.
verses.english: Moses also gave an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, according to their clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum Jazer, et omnes civitates Galaad, et dimidia pars terræ filiorum Ammon usque Aroer, quæ est contra Rabbath.
verses.english: Their territory included Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites, as far as Aroer, which is opposite Rabbah.

verses.latin: Et de Hesebon usque Ramoth Masphe, et Botonim: et ab Manaim usque ad fines Daban.
verses.english: It also extended from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir.

verses.latin: Et in valle Betharam, et Bethnemra, et Succoth, et Saphon, residuam partem regni Sehon regis Hesebon: Jordanis quoque terminus ejus usque ad extremam partem maris Cenereth trans Jordanem orientem.
verses.english: And in the valley, their cities included Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, which comprised the remaining portion of the kingdom of Sihon, king of Heshbon. The Jordan River was its western border, extending to the furthest point of the Sea of Chinnereth, on the east side of the Jordan.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio filiorum Gad per cognationes suas, urbes, et villæ earum.
verses.english: This was the inheritance of the Gadites, according to their clans, including their cities and their villages.

verses.latin: Dedit et Moyses dimidiæ tribui Manasse, et filiis ejus juxta cognationes suas.
verses.english: Moses also gave an inheritance to the half-tribe of Manasseh, according to their clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque possessio eorum a Manaim, et universa Basan, omnia regna Og regis Basan, cunctaque villæ Jair, quæ sunt in Basan, sexaginta oppida.
verses.english: Their territory extended from Mahanaim, including all of Bashan, all the kingdoms of Og king of Bashan, and all the sixty towns of Jair that are in Bashan.

verses.latin: Et dimidia pars Galaad, et Astaroth, et Edrai civitates regni Og in Basan, filiis Machir filii Manasse, dimidiæ parti filiorum Machir juxta cognationes suas.
verses.english: It also included half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, cities of Og's kingdom in Bashan. This was given to the children of Machir, son of Manasseh, specifically to the half of the Machirites according to their clans.

verses.latin: Hæc est quæ præcepit Moyses, ut distribueretur in campestribus Moab, trans Jordanem contra Jericho ad orientem.
verses.english: These are the inheritances that Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, on the east side of the Jordan, across from Jericho.

verses.latin: Tribui autem Levi non dedit Moyses possessionem: Dominus enim Deus Israël, ipse est possessor eorum, sicut locutus est illi.
verses.english: But to the tribe of Levi, Moses gave no territorial inheritance. For the Lord, the God of Israel, Himself is their inheritance and their portion, just as He had promised them.

verses.latin: Josue autem senuerat, et grandaevus erat, et dixit Dominus ad eum: Senex factus es, et grandaevus, et latissima terra superest, quae necdum divisa est.
verses.english: Joshua had indeed grown very old and was advanced in age. The Lord then spoke to him, saying: “You have indeed become old and very advanced in age, and there remains a vast, extensive land that has not yet been divided among the tribes.”

verses.latin: Haec est terra, quae superest: omnis Galilaea, et tota Philisthiim, et Gessuri,
verses.english: This is the remaining territory: specifically all of Galilee, the entire land of the Philistines, and Geshur,

verses.latin: A nilo, qui irrigat Aegyptum, usque ad terminos Accaron contra Aquilonem: terra Chanaan, quae in quinque principes Philisthinorum dividitur, Gazaeos, et Azotios, Ascalonitas, Gethaeos, et Accaronitas, et Hevaeos.
verses.english: Starting from the Nile River, which irrigates Egypt, stretching all the way to the border of Ekron towards the north. This is the land of Canaan, which is controlled by the five lords of the Philistines—specifically the lords of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron—and also the Hivites, who were also within this territory.

verses.latin: Et a meridie omnis terra Chanaan, et Maara Sidoniorum usque Apheca et terminos Amorrei.
verses.english: Also, from the south, all the rest of the land of Canaan, from Maarah of the Sidonians, stretching all the way to Aphekah and the territory of the Amorites.

verses.latin: Et terra Gethri, et Libani usque ad aquas Maserephoth, et omnes Miserephoth, et usque ad Sidonios.
verses.english: And the land of the Gethrites, and all of Lebanon, reaching up to the waters of Misrephoth, and all of Misrephoth, and up to the land of the Sidonians.

verses.latin: Omnes qui habitant montem a Libano usque ad aquas Maserephoth, universi Sidonii. Ego depellam eos a facie filiorum Israël: sic tantum ut sorte distribueretur Israëli, sicut præcepi tibi.
verses.english: All those who live in the mountains, from Lebanon up to the waters of Misrephoth, and all the Sidonians: I Myself will drive them out from before the people of Israel. Your task, Joshua, is only to distribute this land by lot to Israel, just as I have commanded you.

verses.latin: Et nunc divide terram hanc in possessionem novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse.
verses.english: Therefore, you must now divide this land into portions as an inheritance for the nine tribes of Israel, and for the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Alter quoque dimidius, qui est cum eo, ac Ruben et Gad, possederunt terram quam tradidit eis Moyses trans Jordanem ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: The other half of Manasseh, along with the tribes of Reuben and Gad, had already taken possession of the territory that Moses, the servant of the Lord, had given them on the eastern side of the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Ab Aroër, quæ sita est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et in media civitate ejus, universamque planitiem Madaaba usque Dibon:
verses.english: Their territory began from Aroer, which is located on the bank of the Arnon River, and included the city itself in the middle of the valley, and the entire plain of Medeba, stretching as far as Dibon.

verses.latin: et omnes civitates Sehon regis Amorrhæi, qui regnavit in Hesebon, usque ad terminos filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: It included all the cities of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, and extended up to the borders of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et Galaad, et terminos Gessuri, et Maachati, et omnem montem Hermon, et universam Basan usque Salecha,
verses.english: Their land also included Gilead, and the territories of Geshur and Maachah, and the entire Mount Hermon region, and all of Bashan, reaching to Salecah.

verses.latin: omne regnum Og in Basan, qui regnavit in Astaroth et Edrai, ipse fuit de reliquiis Raphaim: percussitque eos Moyses, atque delevit.
verses.english: It encompassed all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei—he was one of the last of the Rephaim giants. Moses had defeated them and utterly destroyed them.

verses.latin: Nolueruntque filii Israël delere Gessuri, et Maachati: sed habitaverunt in medio Israël, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: However, the people of Israel did not completely drive out the Geshurites and Maachathites, but instead, they lived among Israel, and their descendants remain to this very day.

verses.latin: Tribui vero Levi non dedit possessionem: sed sacrificia et victimæ Domini Dei Israël, ipsius est hereditas, sicut locutus est illi.
verses.english: But to the tribe of Levi, Moses gave no territorial inheritance, no land portion. Instead, the offerings by fire and sacrifices made to the Lord God of Israel are their inheritance, as the Lord Himself spoke to Moses.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo Moyses tribui filiorum Ruben juxta cognationes suas:
verses.english: So Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of the people of Reuben, according to their family clans.

verses.latin: fuitque terminus eorum ab Aroër, quæ sita est in ripa torrentis Arnon, et in media civitate ejus, et universam planitiem quæ ducitur in Madaaba,
verses.english: Their territory began from Aroer, which is situated on the bank of the Arnon River, and included the city in the middle of the valley, and all the plain that extends towards Medeba.

verses.latin: Hesebon, et universas urbes ejus, quæ sunt in campestribus: Dibon, et Bamoth Baal, et civitatem Baalmaon,
verses.english: It included Heshbon and all its cities that are in the plain: Dibon, and Bamoth-Baal, and the city of Beth-Baal-Meon,

verses.latin: et Jahasa, et Cedemoth, et Mephaath,
verses.english: and Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath,

verses.latin: et Cariathaim, et Sabama, et Sarathasar in monte valli.
verses.english: and Kiriathaim, and Sibmah, and Zereth-Shahar on the hill of the valley.

verses.latin: Et Bethphogor, et Asedoth Phasga, et Bethjesimoth,
verses.english: It also included Beth-Peor, and the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-Jesimoth,

verses.latin: omnes urbes campestres, universumque regnum Sehon regis Amorrhæi, principis, qui regnavit in Hesebon, quem percussit Moyses cum principibus Madian, Hevæi, et Recem, et Sur, et Ur, et Robe, duces Sehon, habitatores terræ.
verses.english: all the cities of the plain, and the entire kingdom of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, the ruler who reigned in Heshbon. Moses had defeated him along with the chieftains of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba—these were the commanders of Sihon, who lived in that territory.

verses.latin: Balaam quoque filium Beor ariolum occiderunt filii Israël gladio cum ceteris interfectis.
verses.english: The people of Israel also put Balaam, the son of Beor, the diviner, to death with the sword, along with the others who were slain.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus Ruben Jordan: hæc est possessio Ruben juxta cognationes suas, urbium et vicularum singula.
verses.english: And the Jordan River formed the boundary of Reuben's territory. This is the inheritance of the people of Reuben, according to their family clans, including all their cities and villages.

verses.latin: Dedit quoque Moyses tribui Gad filiis Gad per cognationes suas:
verses.english: Moses also gave an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the people of Gad, according to their family clans.

verses.latin: fuitque terminus eorum Jazer, et omnes civitates Galaad, et dimidia pars terræ filiorum Ammon usque Aroër, quæ est contra Rabba:
verses.english: Their territory included Jazer and all the cities of Gilead, and half of the land of the Ammonites, up to Aroer, which is opposite Rabbah.

verses.latin: et a Hesebon usque Ramoth Masphe, et Betonim: et a Manaim usque ad terminos Dabir.
verses.english: It extended from Heshbon to Ramath-Mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the borders of Debir.

verses.latin: Et in valle Betharam, et Bethnemra, et Succoth, et Saphon, reliquam partem regni Sehon regis Hesebon: Jordanis, et terminus ejus usque ad extremam partem maris Cenereth trans Jordanem ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: And in the valley: Beth-Haram, Beth-Nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, which comprised the remaining part of the kingdom of Sihon, the king of Heshbon. The Jordan River was its boundary, extending to the end of the Sea of Chinnereth (the Sea of Galilee), on the eastern side of the Jordan.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio filiorum Gad per cognationes suas, urbium et vicularum singula.
verses.english: This is the inheritance of the people of Gad, according to their family clans, including all their cities and villages.

verses.latin: Dedit et Moyses dimidiæ tribui Manasse juxta cognationes suas:
verses.english: Moses also gave an inheritance to the half-tribe of Manasseh, according to their family clans.

verses.latin: fuitque terminus eorum a Manaim, et universa Basan, et universum regnum Og regis Basan, cunctaque oppida Jair, quæ sunt in Basan, sexaginta civitates:
verses.english: Their territory began from Mahanaim, and included all of Bashan, and the entire kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, and all the sixty towns of Jair which are in Bashan.

verses.latin: Et dimidia pars Galaad, et Astaroth, et Edrai urbes regni Og in Basan: his data sunt filiis Machir filii Manasse, dimidiæ parti filiorum Machir juxta cognationes suas.
verses.english: It also included half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan. These were given to the people of Machir, the son of Manasseh, to the half of the people of Machir, according to their family clans.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt quæ distribuit Moyses in campestribus Moab, trans Jordanem contra Jericho ad orientalem plagam.
verses.english: These are the portions that Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan River, opposite Jericho, on the eastern side.

verses.latin: Tribui vero Levi non dedit Moyses possessionem: Dominus enim Deus Israël ipse est possessor eorum, sicut locutus est illi.
verses.english: However, Moses gave no territorial inheritance to the tribe of Levi. For the Lord God of Israel Himself is their inheritance and their portion, just as He had spoken to Moses.

verses.latin: Haec sunt quae possederunt filii Israel in terra Chanaan, quae dedit illis Moyses et Eleazar sacerdos, et Josue filius Nun.
verses.english: This is the full record of the land that the sons of Israel possessed in the land of Canaan, the land which Moses had assigned to them, and which Eleazar the priest and Joshua, the son of Nun, then formally distributed among them.

verses.latin: Haec sunt quae possederunt filii Israel in terra Chanaan, quas dederunt eis Eleazar sacerdos, et Josue filius Nun, et principes familiarum per tribus Israel:
verses.english: These are the inheritances that the descendants of Israel received in the land of Canaan. Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the leaders of the families from the tribes of Israel distributed these inheritances to them.

verses.latin: sorte omnia divisimus, sicut præceperat Dominus in manu Moysi, novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui.
verses.english: They divided all these inheritances by lot, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses, for the nine and a half tribes.

verses.latin: Duæ enim tribus, et media tribus, acceperant trans Jordanem possessionem: quam juxta Moysen famulum Domini dederat eis, præter Levitas, qui nihil acceperant partis in terra.
verses.english: For two tribes and half a tribe had already received their inheritance beyond the Jordan River, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, had given to them. This was apart from the Levites, who had not received any portion of land.

verses.latin: Filii vero Joseph duabus erant divisi tribubus, Manasse et Ephraim: nec acceperunt Levitæ in terra quicquam, nisi urbes ad habitandum, et suburbana earum ad alenda pecora et jumenta sua.
verses.english: The descendants of Joseph, however, were divided into two tribes: Manasseh and Ephraim. And the Levites received nothing in the land, except cities to dwell in, and the pasture lands surrounding those cities for their cattle and their other livestock.

verses.latin: Sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi, ita fecerunt filii Israel, et diviserunt terram.
verses.english: So the descendants of Israel did just as the Lord had commanded Moses, and they divided the land.

verses.latin: Accesserunt itaque filii Juda ad Josue in Galgala, et locutus est ei Caleb filius Jephone Cenezæus: Tu scis quid locutus sit Dominus ad Moysen virum Dei de me et te in Cadesbarne.
verses.english: Then the descendants of Judah came to Joshua in Gilgal, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, spoke to him: 'You know what the Lord spoke to Moses, the man of God, concerning me and you at Kadesh-barnea.'

verses.latin: Quadraginta annorum eram quando me misit Moyses famulus Domini de Cadesbarne, ut considerarem terram hanc, et renuntiavi ei quod mihi verum videbatur.
verses.english: 'I was forty years old when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out this land. And I brought him back a report that I believed was true.'

verses.latin: Fratres autem mei qui ascenderant mecum, dissolverunt cor populi: et ego secutus sum Dominum Deum meum.
verses.english: 'But my brothers who went up with me caused the people to lose heart. Yet I fully followed the Lord my God.'

verses.latin: Et juravit Moyses in die illo, dicens: Terra quam calcasti pede tuo, erit possessio tua et filiorum tuorum in æternum, quia secutus es Dominum Deum meum.
verses.english: 'And on that day, Moses swore an oath, saying: "The land upon which your foot has walked shall be an inheritance for you and your descendants forever, because you have fully followed the Lord my God."'

verses.latin: Majorque nunc sum, extendente Domino vitam meam, ex eo tempore quo locutus est verbum istud ad Moysen, quando ambulabat Israel in solitudine. Quadraginta et quinque anni sunt ex quo locutus est mihi Dominus sermonem istum, et nunc octoginta quinque annorum sum.
verses.english: 'And now I am older, for the Lord has extended my life since the time He spoke this word to Moses, when Israel was walking in the wilderness. It has been forty-five years since the Lord spoke this promise to me, and now I am eighty-five years old.'

verses.latin: Usque hodie fortis sum sicut tunc temporis, in quo me misit Moyses ad contemplandam terram: ejusdem roboris viresque sunt mihi, tam ad bellandum quam ad gradiendum.
verses.english: 'Even to this day, I am as strong as I was at that time when Moses sent me to observe the land. I still have the same strength and vigor, both for fighting battles and for traveling long distances.'

verses.latin: Da ergo mihi montem istum, quem pollicitus est Dominus, te audiente, in quo sicut audisti, Enacim sunt, et civitates magnæ atque munitae: si forte sit Dominus mecum, et potuero auferre eos.
verses.english: 'Therefore, give me this mountain land, which the Lord promised, in your hearing. In this place, as you have heard, are the Anakim, and great and fortified cities. Perhaps the Lord will be with me, and I will be able to drive them out.'

verses.latin: Benedixitque ei Josue, et tradidit ei Hebron in possessionem.
verses.english: So Joshua blessed him and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.

verses.latin: Atque ex eo facta est Hebron Caleb filio Jephone Cenezæo possessio usque in præsentem diem: eo quod secutus sit Dominum Deum Israel.
verses.english: And from that time, Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, even to this present day, because he had fully followed the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Nomen Hebron antea vocabatur Cariath Arbe: Adam maximus inter Enacim ibi situs est: et terra cessavit a præliis.
verses.english: The name of Hebron was formerly called Kiriath Arba. Adam, the greatest man among the Anakim, was laid to rest there. And the land was at peace from battles.

verses.latin: Facta est ergo sors filiorum Juda per cognationes suas usque ad terminum Edom, desertum Sin, contra meridiem, et ad extremam partem australis plagae.
verses.english: The inheritance for the tribe of Judah was then allocated, according to their clans. This lot extended to the border of Edom, specifically to the wilderness of Zin, facing south and reaching the extreme southern part of the region.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum a plaga meridiana, a summitate maris salsissimi,
verses.english: Their southern border began at the southernmost tip of the Salt Sea,

verses.latin: et a sinu ejus, qui respicit ad meridiem. Egrediturque in ascensionem Scorpionis, et pertransit in Senna, ascenditque de Cades Barne, et pervenit in Esrom, ascendensque Addar, et circumiens Carcaa,
verses.english: And from its bay, which faces south, the boundary went up to the Ascent of Akrabbim. It then passed through Zin, went up from Kadesh-Barnea, reached Hezron, ascended to Addar, and circled around Karkaa.

verses.latin: atque inde pertransiens in Asemona, et perveniens ad torrentem Aegypti: eruntque exitus ejus maris magni. Hic erit terminus vester meridianus.
verses.english: From there, it passed through Heshmon and reached the Brook of Egypt. The boundary ended at the Great Sea. This was to be your southern border.

verses.latin: Ab orientalique plaga, initium maris salsissimi usque ad Jordanem. Et ea quae respiciunt ad aquilonem, a lingua maris salsissimi, et a finibus Jordanis.
verses.english: The eastern boundary was from the start of the Salt Sea up to the Jordan River. For the northern side, it began at the northern inlet of the Salt Sea and extended to the banks of the Jordan.

verses.latin: Ascenditque terminus in Beth Hagla, et pertransit ab aquilone Beth Araba, ascendens ad lapidem Boen, filii Ruben.
verses.english: The boundary then went up to Beth Hoglah, passed north of Beth Arabah, and ascended to the Stone of Bohan, a landmark of the descendants of Reuben.

verses.latin: Et tendens usque ad fines Debir de valle Achor, contra septentrionem aspiciens ad Galgal, quae est ex latere ascensionis Adommim, ab australi parte torrentis: pertransit aquas, id est, fontis solis: et erunt exitus ejus ad fontem Rogel.
verses.english: It then stretched to the borders of Debir in the Valley of Achor, looking north towards Gilgal, which is on the side of the Ascent of Adummim, south of the wadi. It passed through the waters of En Shemesh—which is the Spring of the Sun. Its end point would be at En Rogel.

verses.latin: Ascenditque postea per vallem filii Ennom ex latere Jebusaei ad meridiem, haec est Jerusalem: et inde se extendens ad verticem montis qui est contra Gehennom ad occidentem in parte septentrionali vallis Raphaim.
verses.english: After that, it went up through the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, along the southern side of the Jebusite city—this is Jerusalem. From there, it stretched to the summit of the mountain west of the Valley of Hinnom, which is on the northern side of the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Pertransitque a vertice montis usque ad fontem aquae Nephtoa: et pervenit usque ad vicos montis Ephron: inclinaturque in Baala, quae est Cariathiarim, id est, civitas silvarum.
verses.english: It then passed from the mountaintop to the Spring of Nephtoah, and reached the villages of Mount Ephron. The boundary turned towards Baalah, which is Kiriath-Jearim—meaning 'the City of Forests'.

verses.latin: Et circuit de Baala contra occidentem in montem Seir: transitque juxta latus montis Jarim ad aquilonem, hoc est, Cheslon: et descendit in Bethsames, pertransitque Thamna.
verses.english: From Baalah, it circled westward to Mount Seir. It passed by the northern side of Mount Jearim—also known as Chesalon—then descended to Beth Shemesh, and passed through Timnah.

verses.latin: Et pervenit juxta latus Accaron ad aquilonem: et incurvatur in Sechrona, atque pertransit montem Baala: et pervenit in Jabneel: et maris magni littus terminatur.
verses.english: It reached the northern side of Ekron, curved to Shikkeron, passed Mount Baalah, and came to Jabneel. The boundary then ended at the coast of the Great Sea.

verses.latin: Hinc quoque a mari magno terminus occidentalis. Hic est terminus filiorum Juda per circuitus suos in cognationibus suis.
verses.english: Thus, the Great Sea formed the western boundary. These were the boundaries for the clans of the tribe of Judah, marking their territories all around.

verses.latin: Caleb vero filio Jephone dedit partem in medio filiorum Juda, sicut praeceperat ei Dominus: Cariatharbe patris Enac, ipsa est Hebron.
verses.english: But to Caleb, son of Jephunneh, a portion was given among the tribe of Judah, just as the Lord had commanded. This was Kiriath-Arba, the city of Anak's father—which is Hebron.

verses.latin: Delevitque ex ea Caleb tres filios Enac, Sesai, et Ahiman, et Tholmai de stirpe Enac.
verses.english: From there, Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, all from the lineage of Anak.

verses.latin: Atque inde conscendens, venit ad habitatores Dabir, quae prius vocabatur Cariathsepher, id est, civitas litterarum.
verses.english: From there, he went up and came to the inhabitants of Debir, which was formerly called Kiriath-Sepher—meaning 'the City of Books'.

verses.latin: Dixitque Caleb: Qui percusserit Cariathsepher, et vastaverit eam, dabo ei Axam filiam meam uxorem.
verses.english: Caleb then said, 'Whoever attacks Kiriath-Sepher and captures it, I will give him Achsah, my daughter, as his wife.'

verses.latin: Cepitque eam Othoniel filius Cenez, frater Caleb junior: deditque ei Axam filiam suam uxorem.
verses.english: And Othniel, son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, captured it. So Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as his wife.

verses.latin: Quae cum pergeret, suasit viro suo ut peteret agrum a patre suo. Suspiravitque in asino: cui Caleb ait: Quid habes?
verses.english: As she was leaving with her husband, she urged him to ask her father for a field. When she dismounted from her donkey, Caleb asked her, 'What do you want?'

verses.latin: At illa respondit: Da mihi benedictionem: terram arentem dedisti mihi et aquosam quoque da. Dedit itaque ei Caleb irriguum superius et inferius.
verses.english: She replied, 'Give me a gift. You have given me dry land, but also give me springs of water.' So Caleb gave her the upper and lower springs.

verses.latin: Haec est possessio tribus filiorum Juda per cognationes suas.
verses.english: This then is the inheritance for the tribe of Judah, divided among their families.

verses.latin: Fueruntque civitates ab extremis partibus filiorum Juda juxta terminos Edom a meridie: Cabseel et Eder et Jagur,
verses.english: The cities in the southernmost part of the tribe of Judah, near the border of Edom, were Kabzeel, Eder, and Jagur.

verses.latin: et Cina et Dimona et Adada,
verses.english: And Kinah, Dimonah, and Adadah.

verses.latin: et Cades et Asor et Jethnam,
verses.english: And Kadesh, Hazor, and Ithnan.

verses.latin: Ziph et Telem et Baloth,
verses.english: Ziph, Telem, and Bealoth.

verses.latin: et Asor nova et Carioth, Hesron, haec est Asor.
verses.english: And New Hazor, Kirioth Hezron—which is also called Hazor.

verses.latin: Amam, Sama et Molada,
verses.english: Amam, Shema, and Moladah.

verses.latin: et Asergadda et Hesemon et Bethphelet,
verses.english: And Hazar-Gaddah, Heshmon, and Beth-Pelet.

verses.latin: et Hasersual et Bersabee et Baziothia,
verses.english: And Hazar-Shual, Beersheba, and Bizjothiah.

verses.latin: Baala et Iim et Esem,
verses.english: Baalah, Iim, and Ezem.

verses.latin: et Eltolad et Cesil et Harma,
verses.english: And Eltolad, Chesil, and Hormah.

verses.latin: et Siceleg et Medemena et Sansanna,
verses.english: And Ziklag, Madmannah, and Sansannah.

verses.latin: Lebaoth et Silim et Ain et Remmon. Omnes civitates viginti novem, et villae earum.
verses.english: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon. All these cities total twenty-nine, along with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: In campestribus vero: Estaol et Saraa et Asna,
verses.english: Now in the lowlands were Eshtaol, Zorah, and Ashnah.

verses.latin: et Zanoe et Engannim et Tappua et Enaim,
verses.english: And Zanoah, En-Gannim, Tappuah, and Enam.

verses.latin: et Jarmuth et Adullam, et Socho et Azeca,
verses.english: And Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah.

verses.latin: et Saraim et Adithaim et Gedera et Gederothaim: quatuordecim civitates, et villae earum.
verses.english: And Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim. These fourteen cities, with their villages.

verses.latin: Senan et Hadassa et Magdalgal,
verses.english: Zenan, Hadashah, and Migdal-Gad.

verses.latin: Delean et Masepha et Jecthel,
verses.english: Dilean, Mizpah, and Joktheel.

verses.latin: Lachis et Bascath et Eglon,
verses.english: Lachish, Bozkath, and Eglon.

verses.latin: et Chebbon et Leheman et Chetlis.
verses.english: And Cabbon, Lahmas, and Kithlish.

verses.latin: Fuit autem sors filiorum Juda per cognationes suas, ab extremitatibus meridianis Coreæ, in desertum Sin, usque ad australem plagam Cadesbarne.
verses.english:
The territory allotted to the tribe of Judah, divided among their families,
began from the southernmost limits of Coreae, extending into the desert of Sin,
and reached as far as the southern region of Kadesh-barnea.

verses.latin: Eratque eis terminus meridianus a summitate maris salsissimi, et a lingua ejus quæ respicit ad meridiem.
verses.english:
Their southern boundary started from the farthest reach of the Salt Sea—the Dead Sea—
at its southern tongue, which faces south.

verses.latin: Exiensque in ascensionem scorpionis, et pertransiens in Sena, ascendebatque ad Cadesbarne, et perveniebat in Hezron, ascendensque ad Addar, et circuiens Carcaa,
verses.english:
The boundary then went up to the Ascent of Scorpions, passed through Sena,
ascended to Kadesh-barnea, and reached Hezron.
From there, it went up to Addar and encircled Karkaa.

verses.latin: atque inde transiens in Asemona, et perveniens ad torrentem Ægypti, eruntque exitus ejus maris magni: hic erit vobis terminus meridianus.
verses.english:
From Karkaa, it continued to Azmon and reached the Brook of Egypt.
The boundary then ended at the Great Sea—the Mediterranean coast.
This entire line marked your southern border.

verses.latin: Terminus autem orientalis, mare salsissimum usque ad extrema Jordanis: et confinium aquilonis a lingua maris usque ad eam partem Jordanis quæ respicit ad aquilonem.
verses.english:
The eastern boundary was the Salt Sea—the Dead Sea—extending to where the Jordan River empties into it.
The northern boundary began from the northernmost bay of the Salt Sea,
continuing along the Jordan River, in the direction that faces north.

verses.latin: Ascenditque terminus in Bethhagla, et pertransiit ab aquilone in Betharabam, ascendensque ad lapidem Bohën filii Ruben.
verses.english:
The boundary then went up to Beth-hoglah, passing from the north to Beth-arabah,
and ascended to the Stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben.

verses.latin: Et tendens ultra de valle Achor in Debara, et de Galgal, quæ respicit ad ascensionem Adommim, ab australi parte torrentis, pertransit ad aquas, id est, fontem Solis: et erunt exitus ejus ad fontem Rogel.
verses.english:
From there, the boundary extended beyond the Valley of Achor to Debar,
and from Gilgal—which faces the Ascent of Adummim on the south side of the wadi—
it passed to the waters, meaning the Spring of the Sun. Its final point was the Spring of Rogel.

verses.latin: Et ascendit per vallem filii Ennom ex latere Jebusæi ad meridiem, hæc est Jerusalem: et inde se extendens ad verticem montis qui est contra Gehennom ad occidentem, in finibus vallis Raphaim contra aquilonem.
verses.english:
Then it went up through the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, on the south side of the Jebusite territory—
which is Jerusalem. From there, it extended to the summit of the mountain opposite Gehenna on the west,
at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Et pervenit usque ad fontem aquæ Nephtoa, et ad montes Ephron: inclinataque est in Baala, quæ est Cariathiarim,
verses.english:
It reached the Spring of Nephtoah and the mountains of Ephron.
Then it curved towards Baalah, which is Kiriath-jearim.

verses.latin: Et circuibat de Baala contra occidentem in montem Seir, et transiit juxta latus montis Jarim ad aquilonem, hoc est, Cheslon: et descendit in Bethsames, pertransivitque in Thamna.
verses.english:
From Baalah, it circled westward to Mount Seir and passed by the northern slope of Mount Jearim—
also known as Cheslon. Then it descended to Beth-shemesh and passed through Timnah.
