verses.latin: Et pervenit juxta latus Accaron ad aquilonem ex latere, et curvatur in Sechrona, et pertransit montem Baala: et veniens in Jebneel, æquatur mari magno.
verses.english:
It reached the northern side of Ekron, then curved to Shikkeron, and passed Mount Baalah.
It then came to Jabneel and extended to the Great Sea—the Mediterranean coast.

verses.latin: Ipse vero est terminus occidentalis maris magni: hic erit confinium filiorum Juda per circuitum in cognationibus suis.
verses.english:
The western boundary itself was the Great Sea—the Mediterranean coast.
This completes the boundary for the tribe of Judah on all sides, according to their families.

verses.latin: Caleb vero filio Jephone dedit partem in medio filiorum Juda, sicut præceperat ei Dominus: Cariatharbe patris Enac, quæ est Hebron.
verses.english:
But to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, Joshua gave a portion among the tribe of Judah,
just as the Lord had commanded him.
This was Kiriath-arba—named after Arba, the father of Anak—which is now known as Hebron.

verses.latin: Delevitque ex ea Caleb tres filios Enac, Sesai, et Ahiman, et Tholmai, de stirpe Enac.
verses.english:
From that place, Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai,
who were all from the lineage of Anak.

verses.latin: Atque inde conscendens, venit ad habitatores Dabir, quæ prius vocabatur Cariathsepher, id est, civitas litterarum.
verses.english:
From there, Caleb went up and came to the inhabitants of Debir,
which was formerly called Kiriath-sepher, meaning 'the city of books' or 'city of letters'.

verses.latin: Dixitque Caleb: Qui percusserit Cariathsepher, et vastaverit eam, dabo ei Axam filiam meam uxorem.
verses.english:
And Caleb declared: 'Whoever attacks Kiriath-sepher and captures it,
I will give him my daughter Achsah to be his wife.'

verses.latin: Cepitque eam Othoniel filius Cenez, frater Caleb junior: deditque ei Axam filiam suam uxorem.
verses.english:
Othniel, the son of Kenaz and Caleb’s younger brother, captured it.
So Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as his wife.

verses.latin: Cumque pergerent simul, suasa est a viro suo ut peteret agrum a patre suo. Suspiravitque ut sedens in asino, et ait Caleb: Quid habes?
verses.english:
As she was going with her husband, he persuaded her to ask her father for a field.
With a sigh, she dismounted from her donkey.
Caleb asked her, 'What do you want?'

verses.latin: At illa respondit: Da mihi benedictionem: terram australem et arentem dedisti mihi: junge et irriguam. Dedit itaque ei Caleb irriguum superius, et inferius.
verses.english:
She replied: 'Give me a special gift! You have given me land in the arid south.
Please add some land with springs too.'
So Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Judæ per cognationes suas.
verses.english: This is the territory of the tribe of Judah, divided among their families.

verses.latin: Erantque civitates ab extremitatibus filiorum Juda juxta fines Edom a meridie: Cabsah, et Edar, et Agur,
verses.english:
The cities situated at the southernmost part of the tribe of Judah,
near the border of Edom, were Kabzeel, Eder, and Agur.

verses.latin: et Cina, et Dimona, Adada,
verses.english: And Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,

verses.latin: et Cades, et Asor, et Jethnam,
verses.english: Kadesh, Hazor, Ithnan,

verses.latin: Ziph, et Telem, et Baloth,
verses.english: Ziph, Telem, and Bealoth,

verses.latin: et Asor nova, et Carioth, Hesron, hæc est Asor.
verses.english: Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth, and Hezron—which is another Hazor.

verses.latin: Amam, Sama, et Molada,
verses.english: Amam, Shema, and Moladah,

verses.latin: et Asergadda, et Hesmon, et Bethphelet,
verses.english: Hazar-gaddah, Heshmon, and Beth-pelet,

verses.latin: et Hasarsual, et Bersabee, et Baziothia,
verses.english: Hazar-shual, Beer-sheba, and Biziothiah,

verses.latin: et Baala, et Jim, et Esem,
verses.english: Baalah, Iim, and Ezem,

verses.latin: et Eltholad, et Cesil, et Horma,
verses.english: Eltolad, Chesil, and Hormah,

verses.latin: et Siceleg, et Medemena, et Sensena,
verses.english: Ziklag, Madmannah, and Sansannah,

verses.latin: Lebaoth, et Selim, et Ain, et Remmon: omnes civitates viginti novem, et villæ earum.
verses.english:
Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon.
All these cities, with their surrounding villages, total twenty-nine.

verses.latin: In campestribus quoque: Esthaol, et Saraa, et Asena,
verses.english: Also in the western lowlands were Eshtaol, Zorah, and Ashnah,

verses.latin: et Zanoe, et Engannim, Tappua, et Enam,
verses.english: Zanoah, En-gannim, Tappuah, and Enam,

verses.latin: et Jerimoth, et Odollam, Efna, et Azecha,
verses.english: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah,

verses.latin: et Saphir, et Sarim, et Gadera, et centum villæ: quatuordecim civitates, et villæ earum.
verses.english:
Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, and a hundred villages.
These are fourteen cities, along with their associated villages.

verses.latin: Senaan, et Hadassa, et Magdal Gad,
verses.english: Zenan, Hadashah, and Migdal-gad,

verses.latin: Delean, et Masepha, et Jecthel,
verses.english: Dilean, Mizpah, and Joktheel,

verses.latin: Lachis, et Bascath, et Eglon,
verses.english: Lachish, Bozkath, and Eglon,

verses.latin: Chebbon, et Lahem, et Cetelis: decem civitates, et villæ earum.
verses.english:
Cabbon, Lahmam, and Kitlish.
These are ten cities, along with their associated villages.

verses.latin: Sors filiorum Joseph descendit ab Jordane contra Jericho et aquas ejus, et ducitur solitudo de Jericho per montes Bethel:
verses.english: The territory assigned to the descendants of Joseph began its border from the Jordan River, opposite Jericho and its springs. This boundary extended from Jericho into the wilderness through the mountains near Bethel.

verses.latin: et egreditur de Bethel Luza: et pertransit terminum Archi ad Ataroth:
verses.english: From Bethel, the border continued to Luz, then passed the territory of the Archites, reaching Ataroth.

verses.latin: et descendit contra occidentalem plagam maris Jafletim, usque ad terminos Bethoron inferioris, et Gazer: et pervenit ad mare Mediterraneum.
verses.english: Then it descended westward to the territory of the Japhletites, extending to the borders of Lower Beth-horon and Gezer. Finally, it reached the Great Sea, also known as the Mediterranean Sea.

verses.latin: Possederuntque filii Joseph Manasses et Ephraim.
verses.english: Thus, the descendants of Joseph, the tribes of Manasseh and Ephraim, took possession of this allotted land.

verses.latin: Et factus est terminus filiorum Ephraim per cognationes suas: et erat terminus possessionis eorum ad orientalem plagam Ataroth Addar.
verses.english: The specific boundary for the descendants of Ephraim, according to their family divisions, was established with its eastern side extending to Ataroth-addar.

verses.latin: Et pertransit terminus maritimus ad septentrionalem plagam Michmethath: et revertitur in orientem per Taanath Selo, atque pertransit ex eo in janua Janoe.
verses.english: The western boundary continued northward past Michmethath. Then it turned eastward, passing by Taanath-shiloh, and from there it extended to the gate of Janoah.

verses.latin: Et descendit de Janoe in Ataroth et Naaratha: et pervenit in Jericho, atque ingreditur Jordanem.
verses.english: From Janoah, it descended to Ataroth and Naarah, then reached Jericho, and finally ended at the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et de Tapphua pertransit contra occidentem in vallem Arundineti, donec perveniatur ad mare:
verses.english: From Tappuah, the boundary extended westward to the Brook of Kanah, continuing until it reached the Great Sea.

verses.latin: Haec est possessio tribus filiorum Ephraim per cognationes suas:
verses.english: This described region constitutes the tribal territory belonging to the descendants of Ephraim, organized by their family clans.

verses.latin: et urbes separatae filiis Ephraim in medio possessionis filiorum Manasse, et universae civitates cum villulis suis.
verses.english: Also, there were specific cities set aside for the descendants of Ephraim, located within the territory allotted to the descendants of Manasseh, including all those cities and their associated villages.

verses.latin: Ceciditque sors filiorum Joseph ab Jordane contra Jericho et aquas ejus ab oriente: solitudo, quae ascendit de Jericho in montem Bethel,
verses.english: The territory allotted by lot to the descendants of Joseph (which included both Manasseh and Ephraim) began at the Jordan River, facing Jericho, and its spring waters from the east. This border extended through the wilderness, going up from Jericho to the mountain of Bethel.

verses.latin: et egreditur de Bethel Luza: transitque terminum Archi ad Ataroth,
verses.english: From Bethel (which was also known as Luzah), the boundary continued, crossing the territory of the Archites at Ataroth.

verses.latin: et descendit ad occidentalem plagam maris Jafleth, usque ad terminos inferioris Bethoron, et ad Gazer: finiunturque ejus regiones mari.
verses.english: Then it descended westward to the territory of Japhlet, extending as far as the border of lower Beth-Horon, and continuing to Gezer. The total territory of Joseph's descendants ended there, by the Great Sea to the west.

verses.latin: Et possederunt filii Joseph, Manasses et Ephraim.
verses.english: Thus, the descendants of Joseph—Manasseh and Ephraim—took possession of their allotted land.

verses.latin: Et factus est terminus filiorum Ephraim per cognationes suas: et erat sors possessionis eorum ad orientalem partem Ataroth Addar in superioribus Bethoron.
verses.english: Now, the specific border for the clans of the tribe of Ephraim began. Their allotted territory extended from the eastern side of Ataroth-Addar, reaching to upper Beth-Horon.

verses.latin: Egrediunturque termini usque ad mare Metchmethath, ab aquilone, et circueunt terminos in orientem Taanath Selo, atque transeunt ab orientem Janoe.
verses.english: The boundary then extended northward to the sea near Michmethath. From there, it turned eastward to Taanath-Shiloh and passed eastward from Janoah.

verses.latin: Et descendit de Janoe in Ataroth et Naaratha: et pertingit in Jericho, egrediturque ad Jordanem.
verses.english: From Janoah, the border descended to Ataroth and Naarath. It then extended to Jericho and finally went out to the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et de Tapphua pergit contra occidentem in vallem Arundineti, suntque egressus ejus ad mare. Haec est possessio tribus filiorum Ephraim per cognationes suas.
verses.english: From Tappuah, the border went westward to the Reed Valley, and its westernmost points reached the Great Sea. This describes the full possession of the tribe of Ephraim, according to its clans.

verses.latin: Et urbes separatae filiis Ephraim in medio possessionis filiorum Manasse, omnes civitates et vici earum.
verses.english: There were also cities set aside for the descendants of Ephraim located within the territory of the descendants of Manasseh—these included all such cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Et non interfecerunt filii Ephraim Chananæum, qui habitabat in Gazer: habitavitque Chananæus in medio Ephraim usque in præsentem diem, et factus est tributarius.
verses.english: However, the descendants of Ephraim did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer. So, the Canaanites continued to live among Ephraim's people, even until the time this record was written, and they were made to perform forced labor and pay tribute.

verses.latin: Facta est autem sors tribus Manasse, quia ipse est primogenitus Joseph : Machir primogenitum Manasse patrem Galaad, qui fuit vir pugnator, habuit possessionem Galaad et Basan.
verses.english: A land portion was indeed allotted to the tribe of Manasseh, because Manasseh was the firstborn son of Joseph. Machir, who was Manasseh's firstborn son and the father of Gilead, was a great warrior, and his descendants had already taken possession of Gilead and Bashan.

verses.latin: Et facta est sors reliquis filiis Manasse juxta familias suas, filiis Abiezer, et filiis Helec, et filiis Asriel, et filiis Sechem, et filiis Hepher, et filiis Semida : isti sunt filii Manasse filii Joseph, masculi per cognationes suas.
verses.english: Then a land portion was also allotted to the rest of Manasseh's sons, each according to their family lines: for the sons of Abiezer, for the sons of Helek, for the sons of Asriel, for the sons of Shechem, for the sons of Hepher, and for the sons of Shemida. These were the male descendants of Manasseh, who was the son of Joseph, listed by their family divisions.

verses.latin: Salphaad vero filio Hepher filii Galaad filii Machir filii Manasse, non erant filii, sed tantum filiae : quarum ista sunt nomina : Maala et Noa et Hegla et Melcha et Thersa.
verses.english: However, Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, who was the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, only daughters. Their names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in conspectu Eleazari sacerdotis, et Josue filii Nun, et principum, dicentes : Dominus præcepit per manum Moysi, ut daretur nobis possessio in medio fratrum nostrorum. Deditque eis Josue juxta imperium Domini possessionem in medio fratrum patris earum.
verses.english: These women came before Eleazar the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the tribal leaders, saying: 'The Lord commanded through Moses that we should be given a land possession among our male relatives.' So Joshua, according to the Lord's command, gave them a possession among their father's relatives.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt funiculi Manasse, decem, absque terra Galaad et Basan trans Jordanem.
verses.english: Thus, ten portions of land were allotted to Manasseh, in addition to the land of Gilead and Bashan beyond the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Quinque namque filiæ fuerunt Manasse hæreditatem habentes in terra Chanaan : et terram Galaad obtinuit residuum filiorum Manasse.
verses.english: Indeed, there were five daughters of Manasseh who received an inheritance in the land of Canaan (these were the daughters of Zelophehad). And the remaining descendants of Manasseh obtained the land of Gilead.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus Manasse ab Aser, Machmethath, quæ respicit Sichem : et egreditur ad dextram habitatorum fontis Tappuah.
verses.english: The boundary of Manasseh began from Asher, at Michmethath, which faces Shechem. It then extended eastward, toward the inhabitants of the spring of Tappuah.

verses.latin: Etenim in finibus Manasse erat terra Tappuah, Manasse vero non sibi vendicavit, sed filiis Ephraim pertinebat.
verses.english: For the land of Tappuah was within the boundaries of Manasseh, but Manasseh did not claim it for itself. Instead, it belonged to the sons of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Et descendunt termini in convallem arundineti, de his civitatibus quæ sunt Ephraim in medio civitatum Manasse : et terminus Manasse ab aquilone pergit usque ad mare : et ejus exitus sunt in vallem.
verses.english: The boundaries then descended into the Valley of Reeds, passing through cities that belonged to Ephraim but were located in the midst of Manasseh's territory. The northern boundary of Manasseh stretched as far as the Mediterranean Sea, and its end was in the valley.

verses.latin: Ita ut possideret Ephraim a meridie, et a septentrione Manasse : et fiunt termini maris, et pertingunt in Aser ab aquilone, et in Issachar ab oriente.
verses.english: So Ephraim possessed territory to the south, and Manasseh to the north. Their boundary extended to the Mediterranean Sea, reaching into Asher from the north and into Issachar from the east.

verses.latin: Fuitque hæreditas Manasse in Issachar et in Aser Bethsan et filiæ ejus, et Ieblaam et filiæ ejus : et habitatores Dor et filiæ ejus, habitatores quoque Endor et filiæ ejus : similiter et habitatores Thanach et filiæ ejus, et habitatores Mageddo et filiæ ejus, et tertia pars urbis Nopheth.
verses.english: Within the territories of Issachar and Asher, Manasseh received these inherited cities: Beth-Shan and its dependent villages, Ibleam and its dependent villages. Also, the inhabitants of Dor and its dependent villages, the inhabitants of En-Dor and its dependent villages, likewise the inhabitants of Taanach and its dependent villages, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependent villages, along with a third part of the city called Nopheth.

verses.latin: Nec potuerunt filii Manasse delere civitates istas, sed cœperunt Chananæi habitare in terra hac.
verses.english: However, the sons of Manasseh were not able to utterly destroy these cities. Instead, the Canaanites continued to dwell in that land.

verses.latin: Postquam autem robusti facti sunt filii Israël, submiserunt Chananæos, et fecerunt sibi tributarios : nec delere eos voluerunt.
verses.english: But after the sons of Israel grew strong, they did subdue the Canaanites and made them pay tribute; however, they did not want to utterly destroy them.

verses.latin: Et locuti sunt filii Joseph ad Josue, dicentes : Quare dedisti mihi possessionem sortis unius et funiculi unius, cum sim populus multus, et benedixerit mihi Dominus ?
verses.english: Then the descendants of Joseph (the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh) spoke to Joshua, saying: 'Why have you given me only one portion, one lot of land, when I am such a numerous people, and the Lord has greatly blessed me?'

verses.latin: Cui respondit Josue : Si populus multus es, ascende in silvam, et succide tibi spatia in terra Pherezæi et Raphaim, quia angusta est tibi possessio montis Ephraim.
verses.english: Joshua answered them: 'If you are indeed a numerous people, then go up into the forest country and clear out new spaces for yourselves in the land of the Perizzites and Rephaim, because the hill country of Ephraim is not large enough for your current possession.'

verses.latin: Cui responderunt filii Joseph : Non poterimus ad montem ascendere : quia currus ferreos habent Chananæi, qui habitant in terra campestri, tam hi qui sunt in Bethsan cum oppidulis suis, quam hi qui sunt in valle Jezrahel.
verses.english: The descendants of Joseph replied: 'We cannot conquer the hill country, because the Canaanites who live in the lowlands have chariots made of iron. This includes those in Beth-Shan with its surrounding towns, as well as those in the Valley of Jezreel.'

verses.latin: Et ait Josue ad domum Joseph, Ephraim et Manasse : Populus multus es, et magna fortis, nec habebis sortem unam tantum.
verses.english: And Joshua said to the house of Joseph, that is, to Ephraim and Manasseh: 'You are indeed a numerous people, and you possess great strength, so you will not have just one single lot of land.'

verses.latin: Sed transibis montem, et succides tibi spatia : et purgatæ atque constructæ, cum finibus suis, tuas erunt : Chananæos enim licet ferreos currus habeant, et pervalidi sint, potes tamen eos auferre.
verses.english: Instead, you will cross over into the hill country and clear out spaces for yourselves. Once the land is cleared and settled, with its proper boundaries, it will be yours. For even though the Canaanites have iron chariots and are very strong, you are still able to drive them out.'

verses.latin: Fuit quoque sors tribui Manasse, quia ipse est primogenitus Joseph: Machir enim primogenitus Manasse, pater Galaad, qui fuit dux bellatorum, habuit possessionem Galaad et Basan.
verses.english: The land portion was also assigned to the tribe of Manasseh because he was Joseph’s firstborn son, giving him a significant claim. For Machir, Manasseh's firstborn, who was the father of Gilead and a renowned leader of warriors, had already received the territories of Gilead and Bashan.

verses.latin: Et reliquis filiis Manasse juxta familias suas: filiis Abiezer, et filiis Helec, et filiis Asriel, et filiis Sechem, et filiis Hepher, et filiis Semida: hi sunt filii Manasse filii Joseph, masculi per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The rest of the land was allotted to the other descendants of Manasseh, organized by their family clans: to the sons of Abiezer, to the sons of Helek, to the sons of Asriel, to the sons of Shechem, to the sons of Hepher, and to the sons of Shemida. These were the male descendants of Manasseh, Joseph’s son, according to their family divisions.

verses.latin: Salphaad vero filio Hepher filii Galaad filii Machir filii Manasse non erant filii, sed tantum filiae: quarum haec sunt nomina, Maala, et Noa, et Hegla, et Melcha, et Thersa.
verses.english: Now, Zelophehad, who was a descendant through Hepher, Gilead, Machir, and Manasseh, had no sons but only daughters. Their names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in conspectu Eleazari sacerdotis, et Josue filii Nun, et omnium principum, dicentes: Dominus præcepit Mosi, ut daretur possessio et in medio fratrum nostrorum. Dederuntque eis juxta imperium Domini possessionem in medio fratrum patris earum.
verses.english: They came before Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and all the tribal leaders, reminding them: 'The Lord specifically commanded Moses that we, as daughters, should also be given a land possession among our father’s kinsmen.' So, according to the Lord’s command, a land possession was given to them among their father’s brothers.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt funiculi Manasse decem, absque terra Galaad et Basan trans Jordanem.
verses.english: Thus, ten portions of land were measured out and allotted to the Manassite clans on the west side of the Jordan River, in addition to the territories of Gilead and Bashan which were already across the Jordan to the east.

verses.latin: Siquiæppe filiæ Manasse possederunt hæreditatem in medio filiorum ejus: et terra Galaad filiis Manasse, qui reliqui fuerant, data est.
verses.english: This division was made because the daughters of Manasseh were indeed given an inheritance among his sons, and the land of Gilead was specifically given to the remaining male descendants of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Fuit autem terminus Manasse ab Aser, Machmethath, quæ respicit Sichem: et pergit ad dextram civitatis fontis Tappuah.
verses.english: The border for Manasseh started from Asher, extending to Michmethath, which is situated opposite Shechem. From there, the boundary continued eastward towards the city of En-Tappuah.

verses.latin: Nam in confinio Tappuah, id est, ubi est fons Tappuah, cecidit sors filiis Manasse: Tappuah autem quæ est juxta confinia Manasse, filiorum Ephraim est.
verses.english: While the area around the spring of Tappuah was allotted to the sons of Manasseh, the actual town of Tappuah itself, though close to Manasseh's border, belonged to the sons of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Et descendunt termini in convallem arundineti, in parte australi torrentis civitatum Ephraim, quæ sunt in medio civitatum Manasse: et terminus Manasse ab aquilone torrentis, et exit ad mare transitque per ruscum.
verses.english: The border then descended to the Wadi of Reeds. On the south side of this wadi were cities belonging to Ephraim, even though they were situated within Manasseh’s territory. The northern boundary of Manasseh followed the wadi, stretching out to the Great Sea and passing by a dense thicket of broom shrubs.

verses.latin: Ita ut a meridie sit possessio Ephraim, et ab aquilone Manasse, et utramque claudat Mare, et conjungantur sibi in Zabulon, et ad aquilonem in Aser, transiens Jordanem ab oriente.
verses.english: This arrangement meant that the territory of Ephraim lay to the south, while Manasseh’s land was to the north. The Great Sea formed the western boundary for both tribes. Their borders then merged in the region of Zebulun, extended northward into Asher's territory, and finally crossed the Jordan River from the east.

verses.latin: Fuitque Manasse in Issachar et in Aser Bethsan, et filiæ ejus, et Jeblaam cum viculis suis, et habitatores Dor, cum oppidis suis, et habitatores Endor cum vicis suis: et habitatores Thanac cum vicis suis, et habitatores Mageddo cum vicis suis: tertia pars regionis Nopheth.
verses.english: Within the territories of Issachar and Asher, Manasseh possessed Beth-shean along with its villages, Ibleam with its surrounding settlements, the inhabitants of Dor and their towns, the inhabitants of En-dor and their villages, the inhabitants of Taanach and their villages, and the inhabitants of Megiddo with their villages, comprising a third part of the Naphath region.

verses.latin: Nec potuerunt filii Manasse delere civitates istas, sed cœperunt Chananei habitare in medio eorum.
verses.english: However, the sons of Manasseh were unable to completely conquer and dislodge the inhabitants of these cities. Instead, the Canaanites continued to live among them within their allotted territory.

verses.latin: Postquam autem confortati sunt filii Israël, fecerunt tributarios Chananæos, et noluerunt eos interficere.
verses.english: Later, when the sons of Israel had become stronger and more established, they did not drive out the Canaanites completely but instead subjected them to forced labor and tribute, refusing to utterly destroy them as commanded.

verses.latin: Locutique sunt filii Joseph ad Josue, dicentes: Quare dedisti mihi sortem et funiculum unum in possessionem, cum sim populus multus, et benedixerit mihi Dominus?
verses.english: Then the descendants of Joseph—the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh—spoke to Joshua, complaining: 'Why have you given us only one allotment, one single portion of land, as our inheritance? We are a very numerous people, whom the Lord has greatly blessed, and our territory is too small for us.'

verses.latin: Cui respondit Josue: Si populus multus es, ascende in silvam, et succide tibi spatia in terra Pherezei et Raphaim, quia angusta est tibi possessio montis Ephraim.
verses.english: Joshua replied to them: 'If you are indeed a numerous people, then go up into the forest country and clear out new living spaces for yourselves in the land occupied by the Perizzites and the Rephaim, because the mountainous region of Ephraim is not spacious enough for you.'

verses.latin: Responderuntque filii Joseph: Non valemus ad montis culmina scandere, cum ferreis curribus utantur Chananæi, qui habitant in campestribus terræ, in Bethsan et vicis ejus, et in valle Jezrael.
verses.english: The descendants of Joseph answered, 'We are not strong enough to take control of the mountain peaks, because the Canaanites who live in the plains—including those in Beth-shean and its surrounding villages, and those in the Valley of Jezreel—possess powerful iron chariots.'

verses.latin: Et ait Josue ad domum Joseph, Ephraim et Manasse: Populus multus es, et magna fortitudine pollens, nec habebis sortem unam tantum,
verses.english: Joshua then said to the house of Joseph, meaning Ephraim and Manasseh: 'You are indeed a numerous people, and you possess great strength. You will not be confined to just one allotted portion of land.'

verses.latin: sed ad montem transibis, et succides tibi atque purgabis ad ultimum ejus: cumque expuleris Chananæum, et ferreis curribus et fortissimus sit, poteris delere eum.
verses.english: Instead, you must go into the mountainous region and clear the forests for yourselves, expanding your territory to its very limits. Even though the Canaanites possess iron chariots and are very strong, if you truly commit to driving them out, you will indeed be able to utterly defeat and destroy them.

verses.latin: Congregatique sunt omnes filii Israël in Silo, ibique fixerunt tabernaculum testimonii, et subacta est terra eis.
verses.english: All the children of Israel assembled at Shiloh, and there they set up the Tent of Meeting, for the land had now been subdued and was under their control.

verses.latin: Remanserant autem inter filios Israël septem tribus, quæ necdum acceperant possessiones suas.
verses.english: However, seven tribes among the children of Israel had not yet received their allotted portions of land as their inheritance.

verses.latin: Ad quos Josue ait: Usquequo marcetis, socordes, et non intratis ad possidendam terram, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum dedit vobis?
verses.english: Joshua said to them, "How long will you be sluggish and indolent, refusing to go in and take possession of the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given to you?"

verses.latin: Eligite ex vobis tres viros per singulas tribus, ut mittam eos, et vadant atque circumeant terram, et describant eam juxta numerum uniuscujusque, et revertantur ad me.
verses.english: "Choose three men from each tribe among you, so that I may send them out. They are to go throughout the land and survey it, making a detailed record of it according to the needs of each tribe, and then return to me."

verses.latin: Dividite vobis terram in septem partes: Judas sit in terminis suis a meridie, et domus Joseph ab aquilone teneant partes suas.
verses.english: "You are to divide the remaining land into seven portions for yourselves. Judah's territory is already established in the south, and the house of Joseph's territory is already in the north."

verses.latin: Mediam inter hæc terram in septem partes describite, et huc ad me afferte, ut super hanc mittam vobis sortem coram Domino Deo nostro.
verses.english: "Then, make a descriptive record of this central land, dividing it into seven portions, and bring it here to me. I will cast lots for you before the Lord, our God, to assign each portion."

verses.latin: Non enim habent Levitæ partem inter vos, sed sacerdotium Domini est eorum hæreditas: Gad vero et Ruben, et dimidia tribus Manasse, jam acceperunt possessiones suas trans Jordanem ad orientalem plagam, quas dedit eis Moyses famulus Domini.
verses.english: "For the Levites will not receive a land portion among you; rather, the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance. And the tribes of Gad and Reuben, along with half the tribe of Manasseh, have already received their possessions east of the Jordan River, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave to them."

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissent viri, ut perambularent terram, præcepit eis Josue, dicens: Ite, et circuite terram, et describite eam, et revertimini ad me, ut hic coram Domino in Silo mittam vobis sortem.
verses.english: So when the men stood up to go through the land, Joshua commanded them, saying, "Go, traverse the land, and make your descriptive record of it. Then return to me, so that I may cast lots for you here in Shiloh before the Lord."

verses.latin: Perrexerunt ergo viri, et transeuntes perambulaverunt eam, et descripserunt per civitates in septem partes, in libro, et reversi sunt ad Josue in Silo.
verses.english: So the men went out, and as they passed through, they traversed the land. They made a written descriptive record of it, organized by cities and divided into seven distinct portions, and then they returned to Joshua in Shiloh.

verses.latin: Qui misit sortes in conspectu Domini in Silo, et divisit terram filiis Israël secundum partes eorum.
verses.english: Then Joshua cast lots in the presence of the Lord in Shiloh, and he divided the land among the children of Israel, assigning each tribe its portion.

verses.latin: Et ascendit sors prima filiorum Benjamin per familias suas, ut possiderent terram inter filios Juda et filios Joseph.
verses.english: The first lot drawn was for the children of Benjamin, according to their family clans, so that they might possess the land located between the territory of the children of Judah and the territory of the children of Joseph.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum ad aquilonem, a Jordane: pergensque juxta latus Jericho ab aquilone, et inde conscendens ad occidentem montuosas regiones, et perveniens in solitudinem Bethaven,
verses.english: Their northern boundary began at the Jordan River, running along the northern side of Jericho. From there, it ascended westward into the mountainous regions, eventually reaching the wilderness of Beth-aven.

verses.latin: atque transiens inde in Luzam, juxta latus Luzæ ipsius (quæ vocatur Bethel) ad meridiem: et descendens in Ataroth Addar in montem, qui est ad meridionalem plagam inferioris Bethhoron.
verses.english: From there, it passed over to Luz—which is also called Bethel—along its southern side. Then it descended to Ataroth-addar, to the mountain that lies on the southern side of Lower Beth-horon.

verses.latin: Et protenditur inde circuiens ad mare, ad latus meridionalis montis, qui respicit Bethhoron contra africum: suntque exitus ejus in Cariathbaal, quæ vocatur Cariathiarim, civitas filiorum Juda. Hæc est plaga occidentalis.
verses.english: From there, the boundary extended, circling towards the Mediterranean Sea, to the southern side of the mountain that faces Beth-horon toward the southwest. Its termination points were at Kiriath-baal—which is also called Kiriath-jearim, a city of the children of Judah. This described the western side of Benjamin's territory.

verses.latin: A meridie autem ex parte Cariathiarim egreditur terminus contra mare, et pervenit usque ad fontem aquarum Nephtoa:
verses.english: Now, the southern boundary began from the part of Kiriath-jearim, extending towards the Mediterranean Sea, and it reached the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.

verses.latin: et descendit in partem montis, qui respicit vallem filiorum Ennom, et est contra septentrionalem plagam vallis Raphaim: descenditque in Geennom juxta latus Jebusæi ad meridiem, et pervenit ad fontem Rogel,
verses.english: It descended to the part of the mountain that faces the Valley of the Sons of Hinnom—which is on the northern side of the Valley of Rephaim. Then it continued down into Ge-hinnom, along the southern side of the Jebusite territory, eventually reaching the spring of Rogel.

verses.latin: transiens inde ad aquilonem, et egreditur ad Ensem, id est, fontem Solis:
verses.english: From there it passed northward, and went out to En-shemesh—which means "Spring of the Sun."

verses.latin: et pertransit usque ad tumulos, qui sunt ex adverso ascensus Adommin, atque descendit ad Abenboen, id est, lapidem Boen filii Ruben:
verses.english: It continued past the hills that are opposite the Ascent of Adummim, and then descended to Eben-bohen—which means "the Stone of Bohen," a memorial named after Bohen, the son of Reuben.

verses.latin: et pertransit juxta latus aquilonis Bethagla, et sunt exitus ejus ad septentrionalem plagam maris salis in fine Jordanis ad meridiem. Hæc est plaga meridionalis.
verses.english: It passed along the northern side of Beth-hoglah, and its termination points were at the northern cove of the Salt Sea, at the southern end of the Jordan River. This described the southern side of Benjamin's territory.

verses.latin: Et Jordanis terminus ejus in plaga orientali. Hic est introitus et exitus filiorum Benjamin, per circuitum in familias suas.
verses.english: The Jordan River was its boundary on the eastern side. This describes the complete circuit of the boundaries for the children of Benjamin, according to their family clans.

verses.latin: Fueruntque civitates eorum: Jericho, et Bethhagla, et Vallis Casis,
verses.english: The cities belonging to the children of Benjamin were: Jericho, Beth-hoglah, and Emek-keziz (also known as the Valley of Keziz),

verses.latin: Betharaba, et Samaraim, et Bethel,
verses.english: Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, and Bethel,

verses.latin: Avim, et Aphara, et Ophra,
verses.english: Avvim, Parah, and Ophrah,

verses.latin: Civitas Amoni, et Ophni, et Gabaa: duodecim civitates, et villæ eorum.
verses.english: Chephar-ammoni, Ophni, and Gaba. These were twelve cities with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Gabaon, et Rama, et Beeroth,
verses.english: Gibeon, Ramah, and Beeroth,

verses.latin: et Mespha, et Cephira, et Amosa,
verses.english: Mizpeh, Chephirah, and Mozah,

verses.latin: et Recem, et Jarepheel, et Tharala,
verses.english: Rekem, Irpeel, and Taralah,

verses.latin: et Sela, Eleph, et Jebus, quæ est Jerusalem, Gabaath, et Cariath: quatuordecim civitates, et villæ earum. Hæc est possessio filiorum Benjamin juxta familias suas.
verses.english: And Zelah, Ha-eleph, and Jebus—which is also known as Jerusalem—Gibeath, and Kiriath. These were fourteen cities with their surrounding villages. This completes the description of the inheritance of the children of Benjamin, according to their family clans.

verses.latin: Congregatique sunt omnes filii Israël in Silo, ibique fixerunt tabernaculum testimonii, et subacta est terra eis.
verses.english: The entire assembly of the children of Israel gathered at Shiloh. There, they set up the Tabernacle of Testimony, and the land was brought under their control.

verses.latin: Remanserant autem inter filios Israël septem tribus, quae necdum acceperant possessiones suas.
verses.english: But there still remained among the children of Israel seven tribes that had not yet received their allotted portions of the land.

verses.latin: Dixitque Josue ad eos: Usquequo marcetis ignavia, et non intratis ad possidendam terram, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum dedit vobis?
verses.english: Then Joshua said to them: "How long will you neglect your duty and hesitate to take possession of the land that the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you?"

verses.latin: Eligite ex vobis tres viros per singulas tribus, ut mittam eos, et vadant atque circumeant terram, et describant eam juxta uniuscujusque multitudinem: et afferant ad me quod descripserint.
verses.english: "Choose three men from each tribe, so that I can send them out. They will go and survey the land, describing it according to its various regions, and then bring back to me what they have described."

verses.latin: Dividite vobis terram in septem partes: Judas sit in terminis suis, et domus Joseph in confiniis suis.
verses.english: "Divide the land into seven portions for yourselves. Judah will remain within its own boundaries, and the house of Joseph will stay within its own borders."

verses.latin: Vos quoque describite terram in septem partes, et afferte huc ad me, ut coram Domino Deo nostro, mittam vobis hic sortem.
verses.english: "You are also to describe the land in seven portions and bring it here to me, so that I may cast lots for you here before the Lord, our God."

verses.latin: Non enim habent Levitae partem inter vos, sed sacerdotium Domini est eorum hereditas: Gad autem et Ruben, et dimidia tribus Manasse, jam acceperant possessiones suas trans Jordanem, ad orientalem plagam, quas dedit eis Moyses famulus Domini.
verses.english: "For the Levites do not have a portion among you; rather, the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have already received their possessions across the Jordan, on the eastern side, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave to them."

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissent viri, ut perambularent terram, praecepit eis Josue, dicens: Ite, et perambulate terram, et describite eam, reversiminique ad me, ut hic coram Domino in Silo, mittam vobis sortem.
verses.english: When the men stood up to go and survey the land, Joshua instructed them, saying: "Go, survey the land and describe it, then return to me. Here in Shiloh, before the Lord, I will cast lots for you."

verses.latin: Perrexeruntque, et circuierunt terram, et descripserunt eam per urbes septem in partes, scribentes in volumine: reversique sunt ad Josue in Silo.
verses.english: So they went and traveled throughout the land, describing it by cities in seven portions, writing it down in a scroll. Then they returned to Joshua in Shiloh.

verses.latin: Qui misit sortes coram Domino in Silo, et divisit Josue terram filiis Israël, in septem partes.
verses.english: There, before the Lord in Shiloh, Joshua cast lots for them and divided the land into seven portions among the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et exivit sors tribus filiorum Benjamin primum per familias suas: et inter medium filiorum Juda et filiorum Joseph, tendebat terminus eorum.
verses.english: And the first lot came out for the tribe of the children of Benjamin, according to their families. Their territory extended between the land of the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum a plaga septentrionali, ab Jordane: pergens juxta latus Jericho ad aquilonem, et inde conscendens ad occidentem, pervenit ad montem in eremo Bethel.
verses.english: Their northern boundary began at the Jordan, went along the side of Jericho to the north, then ascended westward, reaching the mountain in the wilderness of Bethel.

verses.latin: Et transiit contra Luzam, ad latus meridionale Luzae (ipsa est Bethel): descenditque in Ataroth Addar in montem, qui est ad meridiem inferioris Bethhoron.
verses.english: It then crossed over to Luz, along the southern side of Luz (which is Bethel), and descended to Ataroth Addar, on the mountain south of lower Bethhoron.

verses.latin: Et inclinatur, et circuivit ab occidente contra mare, per meridiem montis, qui respicit Bethhoron ad africum: suntque exitus ejus in Cariathbaal, quae vocatur Cariathiarim, urbs filiorum Juda. Haec est plaga occidentalis.
verses.english: The boundary then curved and went around from the west, facing the sea, along the southern side of the mountain that overlooks Bethhoron to the southwest. Its ending points were at Cariathbaal, which is called Cariathiarim, a city of the children of Judah. This was the western side.

verses.latin: A meridie autem ex parte Cariathiarim, egreditur terminus contra mare, et pervenit usque ad fontem aquarum Nephtoa.
verses.english: From the south, starting from Cariathiarim, the boundary extended towards the sea and reached the spring of the waters of Nephtoa.

verses.latin: Et descendit in partem montis, qui respicit vallem filiorum Ennom, et est contra septentrionalem plagam vallis Raphaim: descenditque in Geennom juxta latus Jebusaei ad meridiem, et pervenit ad fontem Rogel.
verses.english: It then descended to the side of the mountain that overlooks the valley of the children of Ennom, which is opposite the northern side of the valley of Raphaim. It descended into Geennom, alongside the Jebusite territory to the south, and reached the spring of Rogel.

verses.latin: Transiens ad aquilonem, egreditur ad Ensemames, id est, fontem Solis: et pertransit usque ad tumulos, qui sunt contra ascensum Adomim.
verses.english: Crossing northward, it extended to Ensemames, which is the Spring of the Sun, and continued past the mounds that are opposite the ascent of Adomim.

verses.latin: Et descendit ad Abenboen, id est, lapidem Boen filii Ruben: et pertransit contra latera aquilonis campestrium, et descendit in campestria.
verses.english: It descended to Abenboen, which is the stone of Boen, the son of Reuben. It then passed along the northern slopes of the Arabah, and went down into the Arabah.

verses.latin: Et pertransit contra septentrionalem plagam Bethagla, suntque exitus ejus contra linguam maris Salsissimi ab aquilone, in fine Jordanis ad australem plagam.
verses.english: It continued past the northern side of Bethagla. Its ending points were at the northern tongue of the Salt Sea, at the southern end of the Jordan.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt confinia ejus ex parte orientali, Jordanis. Haec est possessio filiorum Benjamin per terminos suos in circuitu, et familias singulas.
verses.english: These were its eastern boundaries, along the Jordan. This is the possession of the children of Benjamin, with its surrounding boundaries and individual families.

verses.latin: Fueruntque civitates tribus filiorum Benjamin, juxta familias suas: Jericho, et Bethagla, et Vallis Casis,
verses.english: The cities belonging to the tribe of the children of Benjamin, according to their families, were: Jericho, Bethagla, and the Valley of Casis,

verses.latin: Betharaba, et Samarim, et Bethel,
verses.english: Betharaba, Samarim, and Bethel,

verses.latin: Avim, et Aphara, et Ophera,
verses.english: Avim, Aphara, and Ophera,

verses.latin: Civitas Emona, et Ophni, et Gabaa: civitates duodecim, et villae earum.
verses.english: The city of Emona, Ophni, and Gabaa: twelve cities with their villages.

verses.latin: Gabaon, et Rama, et Beeroth,
verses.english: Gabaon, Rama, and Beeroth,

verses.latin: Mispha, et Caphara, et Amosa,
verses.english: Mispha, Caphara, and Amosa,

verses.latin: et Recem, et Jarephel, et Tharela,
verses.english: and Recem, Jarephel, and Tharela,

verses.latin: Et Sela, Eleph, et Jebus, quae est Jerusalem, Gabaath, et Cariath: civitates quatuordecim, et villae earum. Haec est possessio filiorum Benjamin per familias suas.
verses.english: And Sela, Eleph, and Jebus (which is Jerusalem), Gabaath, and Cariath: fourteen cities with their villages. This is the possession of the children of Benjamin, according to their families.

verses.latin: Egrediente ergo sorte secunda, Simeon filiis tribuæ suæ sortitus est juxta cognationes suas:
verses.english: So the second lot was drawn, and the tribe of Simeon received their land for their clans.

verses.latin: habuitque hæreditatem suam in medio possessionis filiorum Juda.
verses.english: Their inheritance was within the territory already granted to the tribe of Judah.

verses.latin: Et obtinuit Beersabee et Samam et Molada,
verses.english: They received Beersheba, Sheba, and Moladah.

verses.latin: et Hasersual et Bala et Asem,
verses.english: And Hazar-shual, Balah, and Azem.

verses.latin: et Eltolad et Bethul et Horma,
verses.english: Also Eltolad, Bethul, and Hormah.

verses.latin: et Siceleg et Bethmarcaboth et Hasersusa,
verses.english: And Ziklag, Beth-marcahoth, and Hazar-susah.

verses.latin: et Bethlebaoth et Saruhen: civitates tredecim, et villas earum.
verses.english: And Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen. These were thirteen cities, along with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Ain quoque et Remmon et Athar et Asan: civitates quatuor, et villas earum.
verses.english: Also Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan. These were four cities, with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Simeon juxta cognationes suas. In possessione et funiculo filiorum Juda sortitus est Simeon: quia plus erat Judæ, et idcirco Simeon in possessione ejus sortitus est.
verses.english: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Simeon, for all their clans. The Simeonites received their portion within the land designated for the tribe of Judah, because the land assigned to Judah was too large for them alone, so Simeon received their inheritance from Judah's portion.

verses.latin: Et tertia sors ascendit filiis Zabulon per cognationes suas: et facta est terminus possessionis eorum usque Sarid.
verses.english: The third lot was drawn for the tribe of Zebulun, for their clans. The boundary of their inheritance extended as far as Sarid.

verses.latin: Et tendit de mari contra occidentem et Marala, et pertingit ad Dabeseth, quantum potest ire ad torrentem, qui est contra Jocnaam.
verses.english: From there, the border ran westward toward the Mediterranean Sea and Maralah. It reached Dabesheth and then continued to the wadi that is east of Jokneam.

verses.latin: Et revertitur de Sarid contra orientem in fines Ceseleththabor, et inde egreditur ad Daberaath, ascendens in Japhie.
verses.english: From Sarid, the border turned eastward, toward the territory of Chisloth-tabor. From there, it went to Daberath, and then went up to Japhia.

verses.latin: Et inde pertransit ad orientem Broc, Gethahepher, et Ittacasin: et egreditur in Remmon, Amthar et Noa.
verses.english: From there, it continued eastward to Gath-hepher and Eth-kazin, then went on to Rimmon, which curves toward Neah.

verses.latin: Et circuit de Beraseth contra aquilonem Anaath, et pertransit de effluviis Jiphthahel.
verses.english: The border then circled north of Hannathon, and its boundary extended to the Valley of Iphtahel.

verses.latin: Et Cateth et Naalol et Semeron et Jedala et Bethlehem: civitates duodecim, et villæ earum.
verses.english: It also included Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem. There were twelve cities, with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est hæreditas tribus filiorum Zabulon per cognationes suas, civitates et villæ eorum.
verses.english: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Zebulun, for their clans, including their cities and their villages.

verses.latin: Quarta autem sors exiit Issachar, filiis Issachar per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The fourth lot was drawn for the tribe of Issachar, for their clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum Jezrahel et Casaloth et Sunem,
verses.english: Their territory included Jezreel, Chesulloth, and Shunem.

verses.latin: et Hapharaim et Sion et Anaharath,
verses.english: And Hapharaim, Shihon, and Anaharath.

verses.latin: et Rabbith et Cesion et Abes,
verses.english: And Rabbith, Kishion, and Abez.

verses.latin: et Rameth et Engannim et Enhadda et Bethpheses.
verses.english: And Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez.

verses.latin: Et pertingit terminus usque Thabor et Seesima et Bethsames: et exitus earum in Jordanem: civitates sedecim, et villæ earum.
verses.english: The boundary extended to Tabor, Shahazumah, and Beth-shemesh. The eastern end of their territory reached the Jordan River. There were sixteen cities, with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Issachar per cognationes suas, civitates et villæ eorum.
verses.english: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Issachar, for their clans, including their cities and their villages.

verses.latin: Et egressa est quinta sors tribui filiorum Aser per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The fifth lot was drawn for the tribe of Asher, for their clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus eorum Halcath et Hali et Beten et Axaph,
verses.english: Their territory included Helkath, Hali, Beten, and Achshaph.

verses.latin: et Elmelech et Amaad et Mesaal: et pertingit ad Carmelum maris et Sihorlabanath.
verses.english: And Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal. It reached Mount Carmel in the west, and Shihor-libnath.

verses.latin: Et revertitur ab oriente Bethdagon, et pertransit Zebulon et vallem Jiphthahel contra aquilonem in Bethemec et Naiel, et egreditur ad Cabul ad sinistram.
verses.english: The border then turned eastward to Beth-dagon, and touched Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtahel on the north, then Beth-emek and Neiel, and extended to Cabul on the left side.

verses.latin: Et Ebron et Rohob et Hamon et Cana, usque ad Sidonem magnam.
verses.english: It also included Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, as far as Great Sidon.

verses.latin: Et revertitur terminus in Horma, et usque ad urbem munitissimam Tyr, et revertitur in Hosam: eruntque exitus ejus in mare de funiculi Achziba.
verses.english: The border then turned back to Ramah, and to the fortified city of Tyre. It then turned to Hosah, and its boundary reached the Mediterranean Sea from the district of Achzib.

verses.latin: Et Amma et Aphac et Rohob: civitates viginti duæ, et villæ earum.
verses.english: It also included Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob. There were twenty-two cities, with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Aser per cognationes suas, urbes et villæ eorum.
verses.english: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Asher, for their clans, including their cities and their villages.

verses.latin: Filiorum Nephthali sexta sors exiit per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The sixth lot was drawn for the tribe of Naphtali, for their clans.

verses.latin: Et cœpit terminus de Heleph et Elon in Sananim, et Adami, quæ est Neceb, et Jebnael usque Lecum: et exitus eorum usque ad Jordanem.
verses.english: Their border started from Heleph, from the oak tree in Zaanannim, and Adami, which is Nekeb, and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum, and its eastern end reached the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et revertitur terminus contra occidentem in Azanotthabor, atque inde pertransit in Hucuca, et pertingit ad Zabulon ab australi plaga, et in Aser ab occidente, et in Juda super Jordanem contra orientem.
verses.english: The border then turned westward to Aznoth-tabor, and from there it went to Hukkok. It reached Zebulun on the south, and Asher on the west, and Judah on the Jordan River on the east.

verses.latin: Civitates munitissimæ, Assedim, Ser, Ammath, Racath et Cenereth,
verses.english: The fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth.

verses.latin: et Edema et Arama et Asor,
verses.english: And Adamah, Ramah, and Hazor.

verses.latin: et Cedes et Edrai et Enhasor,
verses.english: And Kedesh, Edrei, and En-hazor.

verses.latin: et Jeron et Magdalel, Horem et Bethanath et Bethsames: civitates decem et novem, et villæ earum.
verses.english: And Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh. These were nineteen cities, with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Nephthali per cognationes suas, urbes et villæ eorum.
verses.english: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Naphtali, for their clans, including their cities and their villages.

verses.latin: Septima sors exiit tribui filiorum Dan per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The seventh lot was drawn for the tribe of Dan, for their clans.

verses.latin: Et cecidit sors secunda Simeoni, per cognationes suas: fuitque ejus hæreditas in medio possessionis filiorum Juda.
verses.english: The second lot of territory then fell to the tribe of Simeon, based on their families and clans. Their allotted inheritance was situated within the existing territory of the tribe of Judah.

verses.latin: Habueruntque in possessionem suam Bersabee et Sabee et Molada
verses.english: The cities they received as their possession included Beersheba, Sheba, and Moladah,

verses.latin: et Hasersual et Bala et Asem
verses.english: along with Hazar-shual, Balah, and Azem,

verses.latin: et Eltolad et Bethul et Horma
verses.english: and Eltolad, Bethul, and Hormah,

verses.latin: et Siceleg et Bethmarchaboth et Hasarsusa
verses.english: and Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susah,

verses.latin: et Bethlebaoth et Sarohen: civitates tredecim, et villæ earum.
verses.english: and Beth-lebaoth and Sharuhen. This portion included thirteen cities and all of their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Remmon et Athar et Asan: civitates quatuor, et villæ earum.
verses.english: Also, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan. These four cities, with their villages, were also part of Simeon's inheritance.

verses.latin: Omnes viculi per circuitum urbium istarum, usque ad Baalath Beer Ramath contra Nageb. Hæc est hæreditas tribus filiorum Simeon juxta cognationes suas.
verses.english: All the villages surrounding these cities, stretching as far as Baalath Beer-Ramath in the region of the Negev desert, were also theirs. This entire portion was the inheritance given to the tribe of Simeon, according to their families and clans.

verses.latin: In portione et funiculo filiorum Juda cesserunt possessiones Simeon: eo quod amplior esset pars Judæ, et idcirco Simeon in ejus sorte possedit.
verses.english: The cities that Simeon received as their inheritance were allotted from the portion of land originally assigned to the tribe of Judah. This was because Judah's territory was quite extensive, and so Simeon’s people were given their possession within Judah's assigned land.

verses.latin: Ceciditque sors tertia filiis Zabulon per cognationes suas: fuitque terminus hæreditatis eorum usque Sarid.
verses.english: The third lot of territory then fell to the sons of Zebulun, based on their families and clans. The boundary of their inheritance extended as far as Sarid.

verses.latin: Et ascendit de mari et Merala, et pervenit ad Debbaseth, usque ad torrentem qui est contra Jocnaam.
verses.english: From there, their boundary went up from the sea, by Maralah, and reached Dabbasheth. It continued to the wadi that lies opposite Jokneam.

verses.latin: Et reversus est de Sarid contra orientem in fines Ceseleth Tabor, et inde pergit ad Dabereth, ascendens in Japhie.
verses.english: From Sarid, it turned eastward toward the border of Chisloth-Tabor, and from there it proceeded to Daberath, and then ascended to Japhia.

verses.latin: Et inde transit usque ad Gethhepher et ad Thacasin, et exit in Remmon Amthar et Noa.
verses.english: From Japhia, it continued to Gath-hepher and Eth-kazin, and then went out to Rimmon-Methoar and Neah.

verses.latin: Et circuit eam a septentrione Hanathon, suntque egressus ejus vallis Jiphtahel.
verses.english: The boundary then encircled it on the north side at Hannathon, with its extremities extending into the Valley of Iphtahel.

verses.latin: Et Catah et Naalol et Semeron et Jerala et Bethlehem: civitates duodecim, et villæ earum.
verses.english: Included were Kattah, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem. In total, there were twelve cities and all their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est hæreditas tribus filiorum Zabulon per cognationes suas: urbes et viculi earum.
verses.english: This was the inheritance given to the tribe of Zebulun, based on their families and clans, including all the cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Quartadecima sors egressa est Issachar filiis per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The fourteenth lot of territory was then given to the sons of Issachar, based on their families and clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque ejus hæreditas Jezrahel et Casaloth et Sunem
verses.english: Their inheritance included Jezreel, Chesulloth, and Shunem,

verses.latin: et Hapharaim et Sion et Anaharath
verses.english: along with Hapharaim, Shion, and Anaharath,

verses.latin: et Rabboth et Cesion et Abes
verses.english: and Rabbith, Kishion, and Abez,

verses.latin: et Rameth et Engannim et Enhadda et Bethpheses.
verses.english: and Rameth, En-gannim, En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez.

verses.latin: Et pervenit terminus ejus usque Thabor et Seesima et Bethsames, eruntque exitus ejus Jordanis: civitates sedecim, et villæ earum.
verses.english: Their boundary then reached as far as Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth-shemesh, with its limits extending to the Jordan River. In total, there were sixteen cities and all their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio filiorum Issachar per cognationes suas: urbes et viculi earum.
verses.english: This was the possession given to the sons of Issachar, based on their families and clans, including all the cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Ceciditque sors quinta tribui filiorum Aser per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The fifth lot of territory then fell to the tribe of the sons of Asher, based on their families and clans.

verses.latin: Fuitque terminus ejus Halcath et Hali et Beten et Axaph
verses.english: Their boundary included Helkath, Hali, Beten, and Achshaph,

verses.latin: et Helcath et Hali et Beten et Axaph et Alamelech et Amad et Mesaal: et pervenit usque ad Carmelum maris et Sihor Labanath.
verses.english: and Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph again, along with Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal. The boundary extended as far as Mount Carmel, which is by the sea, and to the stream of Shihor-Libnath.

verses.latin: Et reversa est ab oriente Bethdagon, et pervenit usque Zabulon et vallem Jiphthahel contra aquilonem in Bethemec et Nehiel. Egrediturque in Cabul ad sinistram.
verses.english: The boundary then turned eastward to Beth-dagon and reached as far as the territory of Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtahel to the north, extending to Beth-emek and Neiel. It then proceeded to Cabul, towards its left (or northern) side.

verses.latin: Et Ebron et Rohob et Hamon et Cana usque ad Sidonem magnam.
verses.english: Also, Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, with the boundary extending all the way to the great city of Sidon.

verses.latin: Reversaque est sors in Horma usque ad civitatem munitissimam Tyr, et ad Husan: eruntque exitus ejus in mare de funiculo Achziba.
verses.english: The boundary of their allotted territory then turned towards Hosah, extending as far as the strongly fortified city of Tyre. Its limits then stretched out to the sea from the region of Achzib.

verses.latin: Et Umma et Aphec et Rohob: civitates viginti duæ, et villæ earum.
verses.english: Also, Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob were included. In total, there were twenty-two cities and all their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Aser per cognationes suas, urbes et viculi earum.
verses.english: This was the possession given to the tribe of the sons of Asher, based on their families and clans, including all the cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Sexta sors egressa est filiis Nephtali per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The sixth lot of territory was then given to the sons of Naphtali, based on their families and clans.

verses.latin: Et cœpit terminus de Heleph et Elon in Sananim et Adami, quæ est Neceb, et Jebnael usque Lecum: et sunt exitus ejus Jordanis.
verses.english: Their boundary began from Heleph, from Elon-bezaanannim, and Adami-nekeb, and extended to Jabneel, as far as Lakkum. Its limits then reached to the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et reversus est terminus contra occidentem in Azanoth Thabor, atque inde pergit in Hucuca, et pertransit in Zabulon contra meridiem, et in Aser contra occidentem, et in Juda ad Jordanem contra orientem.
verses.english: The boundary then turned westward to Aznoth-Tabor, and from there it proceeded to Hukkok. It passed through the territory of Zebulun towards the south, and through the territory of Asher towards the west, and through the territory of Judah towards the Jordan River on the east.

verses.latin: Civitates munitissimæ, Assedim, Ser, et Emath, et Reccath, et Cenereth,
verses.english: Among their fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth,

verses.latin: et Edema, et Arama, et Hasor,
verses.english: and Adamah, Ramah, and Hazor,

verses.latin: et Cades, et Edri, et Enhasor,
verses.english: and Kedesh, Edrei, and En-hazor,

verses.latin: et Jeron, et Magdalel, et Horem, et Bethanath, et Bethsames: civitates decem et novem, et villæ earum.
verses.english: and Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh. In total, there were nineteen cities and all their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Hæc est possessio tribus filiorum Nephtali per cognationes suas, urbes et viculi earum.
verses.english: This was the possession given to the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, based on their families and clans, including all the cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Septima sors egressa est tribui filiorum Dan per cognationes suas.
verses.english: The seventh lot of territory was then given to the tribe of the sons of Dan, based on their families and clans.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Josue, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Joshua, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël, et dic: Separate urbes fugitivorum, de quibus locutus sum ad vos per manum Moysi:
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel and say: ‘Set aside for yourselves the cities of refuge, about which I spoke to you through Moses.’”

verses.latin: ut fugiat ad eas quicumque animam occiderit nescius, et non sit reus sanguinis eorum, qui proximus est ut se vindicet.
verses.english: “So that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee to them, and not be guilty of the blood of those whose relative is close to avenge them.”

verses.latin: Cum ad unam ex his urbibus profugerit, stabit ante portam civitatis, et loquetur senioribus urbis quae se probant: sicque suscipient eum in civitatem, et dabunt ei locum ad habitandum.
verses.english: “When he flees to one of these cities, he will stand at the gate of the city and speak his case to the elders of that city; and they will take him into the city and give him a place to live.”

verses.latin: Cumque propinquus interfecti sanguinem persequens, ingressus fuerit civitatem, non tradent in manum ejus homicidam: quoniam ignorans percussit proximum suum, et nullum ante biduum odium contra eum habuisse probatur.
verses.english: “And if the avenger of the slain man's blood enters the city, they will not hand over the killer to him; because he struck his neighbor without intending to, and it is proven that he held no hatred against him before this event.”

verses.latin: Et manebit in civitate illa, donec stet ante judicium populi, et usque ad obitum sacerdotis magni, qui in illo fuerit tempore. Tunc revertetur homicida, et ibit in domum suam, in civitatem et locum unde fugerat.
verses.english: “And he will remain in that city until he stands before the judgment of the people, and until the death of the high priest who is serving at that time. Then the killer will return and go to his own home, to the city and place from which he had fled.”

verses.latin: Consecraverunt igitur Cedes in Galilæa montis Nephthali, et Sichem montis Ephraim, et Cariath Arbe, hæc est Hebron, in monte Juda.
verses.english: So they consecrated Kedesh in Galilee, in the mountain region of Naphtali, and Shechem in the mountain region of Ephraim, and Kiriath-Arba, which is Hebron, in the mountain region of Judah.

verses.latin: Et trans Jordanem contra Jericho ad orientalem plagam, posuerunt Bosor in solitudine campestri de tribu Ruben, et Ramoth in Galaad de tribu Gad, et Gaulon in Basan de tribu Manasse.
verses.english: And across the Jordan, opposite Jericho, on the eastern side, they designated Bezer in the wilderness on the plain, from the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead, from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan, from the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Hæ civitates constitutæ sunt cunctis filiis Israël, et advenis qui inter eos morabantur, ut fugeret ad eas qui animam nescius occidisset, et non moreretur in manu proximi, poscente ultionem sanguinis, donec staret ante concilium.
verses.english: These cities were designated for all the children of Israel and for the foreigners who dwelled among them, so that anyone who killed a person unintentionally might flee to them, and not die at the hand of the avenger of blood, who sought vengeance, until he stood before the assembly for judgment.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Josue, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Joshua, giving him this command:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dic: Separate urbes fugitivorum, de quibus locutus sum ad vos per manum Moysi:
verses.english: "Speak to the children of Israel and tell them: 'Set aside the cities of refuge, those which I spoke about to you through Moses,

verses.latin: ut fugiat ad eas quicumque animam occiderit inscius, et non sit reus sanguinis propinqui, qui ultor est mortis.
verses.english: so that anyone who unintentionally kills another person, without knowing it, can flee to them. Such a person will not be considered guilty of murder by the avenger of blood—the relative who seeks vengeance for the deceased.

verses.latin: Cum ad unam ex his urbibus fuerit profugus, stabit ante portam civitatis, et loquetur senioribus urbis ea quae se probant innocentem: sicque recipient eum ad se, et dabunt ei locum ad habitandum.
verses.english: When someone flees to one of these cities, he is to stand at the gate of the city and explain his case to the elders of that city, proving his innocence. They will then receive him and give him a place to live among them.

verses.latin: Et cum propinquus sanguinis eum fuerit persecutus, non tradent in manus ejus homicidam, eo quod ignoranter percusserit proximum suum, et nullum ante biduum odium habuerit in eum.
verses.english: If the avenger of blood pursues him, the elders must not hand over the manslayer to his custody. This is because the manslayer killed his neighbor unintentionally and without any prior hatred towards him.

verses.latin: Aderitque in civitate illa, donec stet ante judicium plebis pro causa sua, et usque ad obitum pontificis illius, qui eo tempore fuerit: tunc revertetur et ibit in civitatem et domum suam, de qua fugerat.
verses.english: He is to remain in that city until he stands before the judgment of the community regarding his case, and he must stay there until the death of the high priest who is serving at that time. Only then may he return and go back to his own city and home from which he fled.

verses.latin: Consecraveruntque Cedes in Galilaea montis Nephthali, et Sichem montis Ephraim, et Cariatharbe, id est Hebron, in monte Juda.
verses.english: So they consecrated Kedesh in Galilee, located in the mountainous region of Naphtali; and Shechem in the mountainous region of Ephraim; and Kiriath-Arba, which is Hebron, in the mountainous region of Judah.

verses.latin: Et trans Jordanem contra orientem Jericho, ultra omnem orientalem plagam, posuerunt Bosor in solitudine civitatem planam de tribu Ruben, et Ramoth in Galaad de tribu Gad, et Gaulon in Basan de tribu Manasse.
verses.english: And across the Jordan River, to the east of Jericho, beyond all the eastern plains, they designated Bezer in the wilderness, a city on the plain from the tribe of Reuben; and Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad; and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Hae constitutae sunt civitates omnibus filiis Israel, et advenis qui habitabant inter eos, ut fugeret ad eas qui feceret animam ignoranter, et non moreretur in manu propinqui sanguinis, donec staret ante populum.
verses.english: These cities were appointed for all the children of Israel, and for the foreigners who lived among them, so that anyone who unintentionally caused a person's death could flee to them. This ensured they would not die by the hand of the avenger of blood before they could stand trial before the community.

verses.latin: Accesserunt autem principes familiarum Levi ad Eleazarum sacerdotem, et Josue filium Nun, et majores natu per singulas tribus filiorum Israël, in Silo terræ Chanaan:
verses.english: Then the heads of the Levitical families approached Eleazar the priest, and Joshua, son of Nun, and the tribal leaders from each tribe of the sons of Israel, in Shiloh in the land of Canaan.

verses.latin: locutique sunt ad eos: Dominus præcepit per manum Moysi, ut darentur nobis urbes ad habitandum, et suburbana earum ad pascenda jumenta.
verses.english: And they spoke to them, saying, “The Lord commanded through Moses that cities should be given to us for our habitation, along with their pasturelands for our livestock.”

verses.latin: Dederuntque filii Israël de possessionibus suis, juxta imperium Domini, civitates, et suburbanas earum.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel gave from their own tribal territories, according to the Lord’s command, these cities and their surrounding pasturelands.

verses.latin: Et egressa est sors de familiis Caath: fueruntque filii Aaron sacerdotis de stirpe Caath Levitarum, habentes per sortes de tribu Juda, et de tribu Simeon, et de tribu Benjamin, civitates tredecim.
verses.english: And the first lot was drawn for the families of Kohath. The sons of Aaron the priest, who were of the Kohathite lineage of the Levites, received thirteen cities by lot from the tribe of Judah, and from the tribe of Simeon, and from the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et reliquis filiis Caath, id est, Levitis, de familiis suis, de tribu Ephraim, et de tribu Dan, et de dimidia tribu Manasse, decem civitates.
verses.english: To the rest of the sons of Kohath, that is, the Levites of their families, ten cities were given from the tribe of Ephraim, and from the tribe of Dan, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Porro filiis Gerson, de familiis suis, de tribu Issachar, et de tribu Aser, et de tribu Nephthali, et de dimidia tribu Manasse in Basan, civitates tredecim.
verses.english: Furthermore, to the sons of Gershon, according to their families, thirteen cities were given from the tribe of Issachar, and from the tribe of Asher, and from the tribe of Naphtali, and from the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.

verses.latin: Et filiis Merari per familias suas, de tribu Ruben, et de tribu Gad, et de tribu Zabulon, civitates duodecim.
verses.english: And to the sons of Merari, according to their families, twelve cities were given from the tribe of Reuben, and from the tribe of Gad, and from the tribe of Zebulun.

verses.latin: Dederuntque filii Israël Levitis civitates et suburbana earum, sicut præcepit Dominus per manum Moysi, sortes mittentes.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel gave to the Levites these cities and their pasturelands, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses, by casting lots.

verses.latin: De tribubus filiorum Juda et Simeon, dederunt civitates quarum hæc sunt nomina:
verses.english: From the tribes of the sons of Judah and Simeon, they gave these cities, whose names are as follows:

verses.latin: urbes Aaron de familiis Caath, stirpis Levi: quia illis sors prima successit.
verses.english: They were cities for Aaron, from the families of Kohath, of the lineage of Levi, because their lot came up first.

verses.latin: Cariatharbe patris Enac, quæ vocatur Hebron, in monte Juda, et suburbana ejus per circuitum.
verses.english: They gave Kirjath Arba—the city of Arba, father of Anak—which is also called Hebron, in the hill country of Judah, and its pasturelands all around it.

verses.latin: Agros autem et villas ejus, dedit Caleb filio Jephone ad possidendum.
verses.english: However, the fields and the villages around Hebron, they had given to Caleb, son of Jephunneh, for his possession.

verses.latin: Igitur filiis Aaron sacerdotis dederunt Hebron, et Lobna, et Jether, et Esthemo,
verses.english: Therefore, to the sons of Aaron the priest, they gave Hebron, and Libnah, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa,

verses.latin: et Holon, et Dabir,
verses.english: and Holon, and Debir,

verses.latin: et Asan, et Jeta, et Bethsames, cum suburbanis suis: civitates novem de duabus tribubus his.
verses.english: and Ashan, and Jutta, and Beth Shemesh, with their pasturelands: these nine cities from these two tribes.

verses.latin: De tribu autem Benjamin, Gabaon, et Gabae, et Anathoth, et Almon, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: From the tribe of Benjamin, they gave Gibeon, and Geba, and Anathoth, and Almon, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates tredecim, cum suburbanis suis, dederunt filiis Aaron sacerdotis.
verses.english: All thirteen cities, with their pasturelands, they gave to the sons of Aaron the priest.

verses.latin: Reliquis vero filiis Caath Levitis, de tribu Ephraim, dederunt urbes et suburbana earum, Sichem civitatem confugii, et Gezer,
verses.english: To the rest of the Kohathite Levites, from the tribe of Ephraim, they gave these cities and their pasturelands: Shechem, a city of refuge, and Gezer,

verses.latin: et Cibsaim, et Bethoron, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: and Kibzaim, and Beth Horon, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu quoque Dan, Elthece, et Gabathon, et Ajalon, et Gethremmon, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: Also from the tribe of Dan, they gave Eltekeh, and Gibbethon, and Aijalon, and Gath Rimmon, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: De dimidia tribu Manasse, Thanach, et Gethremmon, cum suburbanis suis: civitates duæ.
verses.english: From the half-tribe of Manasseh, they gave Taanach, and Gath Rimmon, with their pasturelands: two cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates decem, et suburbana earum, datæ sunt filiis Caath reliquis.
verses.english: All ten cities, and their pasturelands, were given to the remaining sons of Kohath.

verses.latin: Filiis quoque Gerson de stirpe Levi, de dimidia tribu Manasse, dabant civitates confugii, Gaulon in Basan, et Bosram, cum suburbanis suis: civitates duæ.
verses.english: To the sons of Gershon, from the lineage of Levi, from the half-tribe of Manasseh, they gave these cities of refuge: Golan in Bashan, and Beeshterah, with their pasturelands: two cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Issachar, Cesion, et Dabereth, et Jaramoth, et Engannim, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: From the tribe of Issachar, they gave Kishion, and Dabareh, and Jarmuth, and En Gannim, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Aser, Masal, et Abdon, et Helcath, et Rohob, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: From the tribe of Asher, they gave Mishal, and Abdon, and Helkath, and Rehob, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Nephthali, Cedes in Galilæa civitatem confugii, et Hammoth Dor, et Carthan, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: From the tribe of Naphtali, they gave Kedesh in Galilee, a city of refuge, and Hammon-dor, and Kiriathaim, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates tredecim, et suburbana earum, filiis Gerson per familias suas.
verses.english: All thirteen cities, and their pasturelands, were given to the sons of Gershon according to their families.

verses.latin: Filiis autem Merari Levitis per familias suas, de tribu Zabulon, Jecnam, et Cartha, et Damna, et Naalol, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: To the sons of Merari, the Levites, according to their families, from the tribe of Zebulun, they gave Jokneam, and Kartah, and Dimnah, and Nahalal, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Ruben trans Jordanem, Dabir, et Jasa, et Cademoth, et Mephaath, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: From the tribe of Reuben beyond the Jordan River, they gave Bezer, and Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Gad, Ramoth in Galaad civitatem confugii, et Manaim, et Hesebon, et Jazer, cum suburbanis suis: civitates quatuor.
verses.english: From the tribe of Gad, they gave Ramoth in Gilead, a city of refuge, and Mahanaim, and Heshbon, and Jazer, with their pasturelands: four cities.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt civitates filiorum Merari per familias suas, duodecim.
verses.english: These are the twelve cities for the sons of Merari, according to their families.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates Levitis, in medio possessionis filiorum Israël, fuerunt quadraginta octo, et suburbana earum.
verses.english: All the cities for the Levites, within the territory of the sons of Israel, were forty-eight, along with their pasturelands.

verses.latin: Ex his urbes singulæ, et per circuitum suburbana habebant sua.
verses.english: Each one of these cities had its own pasturelands surrounding it.

verses.latin: Completumque est omne negotium, quod locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, ut daret filiis Israël terram: et possederunt eam.
verses.english: So all the work that the Lord had spoken to Moses, concerning giving the land to the sons of Israel, was now completed. And they possessed the land.

verses.latin: Et ingrediuntur in ea, et habitant in illis, et in omnibus finibus suis.
verses.english: They entered into the land and settled in their assigned territories, and throughout all their borders.

verses.latin: Nulla de multis promissis, quæ Dominus filiis Israël pollicitus est, inanis fuit: omnia impleta sunt.
verses.english: Not one of the many good promises that the Lord had made to the sons of Israel failed; every single one was fulfilled.

verses.latin: Hi sunt fines eorum per familias suas.
verses.english: These are their assigned territories according to their families.

verses.latin: Ex civitatibus autem et suburbanis earum, quas acceperunt filii Aaron sacerdotis, qui erant de stirpe Caath Levitarum, decem et novem fuerunt civitates.
