verses.english: From the cities and their pasturelands that the sons of Aaron the priest received, who were of the lineage of Kohathite Levites, there were nineteen cities.

verses.latin: Reliquis vero Caathitis, id est, Levitis, viginti duæ civitates.
verses.english: But to the rest of the Kohathites, that is, the Levites, there were twenty-two cities.

verses.latin: Filiis autem Gersonitis, triginta sex civitates.
verses.english: And to the Gershonite sons, thirty-six cities.

verses.latin: Accesseruntque principes familiarum Levi ad Eleazarum sacerdotem, et Josue filium Nun, et ad singulorum tribuum principes familiarum,
verses.english: Then the heads of the Levitical families went to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua, the son of Nun, and to the heads of the families of each of the other tribes.

verses.latin: locuti sunt ad eos in Silo terrae Chanaan, dicentes: Mandavit Dominus per manum Moysi, ut darentur nobis urbes ad habitandum, et suburbana earum ad pascua pecorum.
verses.english: They spoke to them in Shiloh, in the land of Canaan, saying: “The Lord commanded through Moses that we should be given cities to live in, along with their surrounding lands for the pasture of our livestock.”

verses.latin: Dederuntque filii Israel de possessionibus suis juxta imperium Domini, civitates, et suburbana earum Levitis.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel, according to the Lord’s command, gave cities and their surrounding lands from their own possessions to the Levites.

verses.latin: Egressa estque sors familiarum Caath, et acceperunt filii Aaron sacerdotes de tribu Juda, et de tribu Simeon, et de tribu Benjamin, civitates tredecim.
verses.english: The lot then came out for the families of Kohath. The sons of Aaron, who were priests, received thirteen cities from the tribal territories of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et reliquis filiis Caath, id est, Levitis, et non sacerdotibus, de tribubus Ephraim, et Dan, et dimidia tribu Manasse, civitates decem.
verses.english: For the rest of the sons of Kohath—the Levites who were not priests—ten cities were given from the tribal territories of Ephraim, Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Filiis autem Gerson de tribubus Issachar, et Aser, et Nephthali, et dimidia tribu Manasse, urbes tredecim.
verses.english: To the sons of Gershon, thirteen cities were given from the tribal territories of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the other half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Et filiis Merari per suas cognationes de tribubus Ruben, et Gad, et Zabulon, civitates duodecim.
verses.english: And to the sons of Merari, according to their family clans, twelve cities were given from the tribal territories of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.

verses.latin: Dederuntque filii Israel Josue, sicut praeceperat Dominus, urbes, et suburbana earum, per sortem Levitis.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel gave these cities and their surrounding lands to the Levites by lot, just as the Lord had commanded through Joshua.

verses.latin: Has ergo dederunt de tribu filiorum Juda et de tribu filiorum Simeon civitates, quarum nomina haec sunt:
verses.english: These are the names of the cities that were given from the tribal territory of the sons of Judah and from the tribal territory of the sons of Simeon:

verses.latin: civitates filiis Aaron de familiis Caath, stirpis Levi: (prima enim sors in eorum manibus fuerat)
verses.english: These cities were for the sons of Aaron from the families of Kohath, who were from the tribe of Levi, because their lot had been chosen first.

verses.latin: Cariatharbe patris Enac, quae vocatur Hebron in monte Juda, et suburbana ejus per circuitum.
verses.english: They received Kiriath-Arba, which is the city of Arba, the father of Anak—this city is Hebron in the mountainous region of Judah—along with its surrounding pasture lands.

verses.latin: Agros autem, et villas ejus dederat Caleb filio Jephone ad possidendum.
verses.english: However, the fields and villages surrounding Hebron had already been given to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, for his possession.

verses.latin: Dederunt ergo filiis Aaron sacerdotis Hebron civitatem effugii, et suburbana ejus, et Lobnam cum suburbanis suis,
verses.english: Therefore, to the sons of Aaron the priest, they gave Hebron, a city of refuge, along with its pasture lands. They also gave Libnah with its pasture lands,

verses.latin: et Jether, et Esthemo, et Holon, et Dabir, et Asan, et Jeta, et Bethsames, et suburbana earum: novem civitates de duabus tribubus his.
verses.english: and Jattir, and Eshtemoa, and Holon, and Debir, and Ain, and Juttah, and Beth-Shemesh, each with their pasture lands. That makes nine cities from these two tribes.

verses.latin: De tribu autem Benjamin, Gabaon et Geba, et Anathoth, et Almon, et suburbana earum: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: From the tribe of Benjamin, they received Gibeon and Geba, Anathoth and Almon, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates, tredecim, cum suburbanis suis, filiis Aaron sacerdotum.
verses.english: All these cities for the sons of Aaron, the priests, totalled thirteen, each with its surrounding pasture lands.

verses.latin: Porro reliquis familiarum filiorum Caath Levitis, de tribu Ephraim, dederunt Sichem civitatem effugii, et in monte Ephraim, cum suburbanis ejus, et Gazer, cum suburbanis suis,
verses.english: Now for the remaining Levites of the Kohathite families, from the tribe of Ephraim, they gave Shechem—a city of refuge in the mountainous region of Ephraim—along with its pasture lands. Also Gezer with its pasture lands,

verses.latin: et Cibsaim cum suburbanis suis, et Bethoron cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: and Kibzaim with its pasture lands, and Beth-Horon with its pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu quoque Dan, Elthece, et Gabathon, et Ajalon, et Gethremmon, cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: From the tribe of Dan, they received Eltekeh, and Gibbethon, and Aijalon, and Gath-Rimmon, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De dimidia tribu Manasse, Thanach, et Gethremmon, cum suburbanis suis: duae civitates.
verses.english: From the half-tribe of Manasseh, they received Taanach and Gath-Rimmon, each with their pasture lands. That makes two cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates decem, et suburbana earum, datae sunt filiis Caath inferioribus.
verses.english: All these cities, totalling ten with their pasture lands, were given to the other, non-priestly, sons of Kohath.

verses.latin: Filiis quoque Gerson de cognatione Levi, de dimidia tribu Manasse, Bezer civitatem effugii, et Basan, cum suburbanis suis,
verses.english: For the sons of Gershon, from the clan of Levi, from the other half-tribe of Manasseh, they received Bezer—a city of refuge—and Bosra with its pasture lands.

verses.latin: et Daberath, et Jarmuth, et Endor, et Enhazor, et Beelzebub, et Nesran, et Cebron, et Rohob, et Rames, et Thaanach, et Gazer: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: And from the tribe of Issachar, they received Kishion and Daberath, and Jarmuth, and En-Gannim, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Issachar, Cesion, et Dabereth, et Jarmuth, et Engannim, cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: This verse seems to be a slight textual variant of the previous one, listing cities for Issachar. It means: From the tribe of Issachar, they received Kishion, Daberath, Jarmuth, and En-Gannim, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Aser, Masal, et Abdon, et Helcath, et Rohob, cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: From the tribe of Asher, they received Mishal, and Abdon, and Helkath, and Rehob, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Nephthali, Cedes in Galilaea civitatem effugii, et Amoth, et Cariathaim, cum suburbanis suis: tres civitates.
verses.english: From the tribe of Naphtali, they received Kedesh in Galilee—a city of refuge—and Hammoth-Dor, and Kartan, each with their pasture lands. That makes three cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates filiorum Gerson per familias suas, tredecim civitates cum suburbanis suis.
verses.english: All these cities for the sons of Gershon, according to their families, totalled thirteen cities with their pasture lands.

verses.latin: Filiis autem Merari Levitis per familias suas, de tribu Zabulon, Jecnam, et Cartha, et Remmono, et Nahalol, cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: For the sons of Merari, Levites according to their families, from the tribe of Zebulun, they received Jokneam, and Kartah, and Rimmon, and Nahalal, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Ruben, Bosor, et Jessa, et Cedemoth, et Mephaath, cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: From the tribe of Reuben, they received Bezer, and Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: De tribu Gad, Ramoth in Galaad civitatem effugii, et Manaim, et Esebon, et Jaezer, cum suburbanis suis: quatuor civitates.
verses.english: From the tribe of Gad, they received Ramoth in Gilead—a city of refuge—and Mahanaim, and Heshbon, and Jazer, each with their pasture lands. That makes four cities.

verses.latin: Haec sunt civitates filiorum Merari per cognationes suas, duodecim civitates.
verses.english: These are the cities for the sons of Merari according to their clans, totalling twelve cities.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates Levitarum, inter possessionem filiorum Israel, quadraginta octo civitates, et earum suburbana.
verses.english: All the cities of the Levites, within the possession of the sons of Israel, amounted to forty-eight cities, each with its surrounding pasture lands.

verses.latin: Ipsaeque urbes, et suburbana earum per circuitum.
verses.english: These were the specific cities, each with their pasture lands all around them.

verses.latin: Et facta est Pax perfecta in terra universa, sicut juravit Dominus patribus eorum, et datum est eis, et possederunt eam.
verses.english: And the Lord gave them rest on every side, just as he had sworn to their fathers. The children of Israel took possession of the entire land and settled in it.

verses.latin: Nullusque eis hostium resistere ausus est, sed omnes nationes subacti sunt eorum imperio.
verses.english: No enemy dared to resist them; rather, all the surrounding nations were subjected to their rule.

verses.latin: Nec in omnibus, quae locutus est Dominus, quidquam relictum est, quod non fecerit. Omnia impleta sunt.
verses.english: Not one thing failed of all the good promises the Lord had spoken to the house of Israel. Everything was fulfilled.

verses.latin: Haec sunt urbes, quas dedit Dominus filiis Israhel,
verses.english: These are the cities which the Lord gave to the sons of Israel,

verses.latin: juxta divisionem quatuor tribuum, quae enumeratae sunt supra.
verses.english: according to the division of the four tribes listed above.

verses.latin: Et dedit Dominus pacem in omnibus finibus eorum, et subduxit eis hostes suos, sicut jusjurandum fuit patribus eorum.
verses.english: And the Lord gave them peace in all their borders, and He removed their enemies from them, just as He had sworn to their fathers.

verses.latin: Omnia impleta sunt, sicut juravit Dominus. Et dedit eis Dominus terram suam.
verses.english: Everything was fulfilled, just as the Lord had sworn. And the Lord gave them their land.

verses.latin: Tunc vocavit Josue Rubenitas et Gaditas et dimidiam tribum Manasse,
verses.english: Then Joshua called the descendants of Reuben, and the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: et dixit ad eos: Vos fecistis omnia quæ præcepit vobis Moyses famulus Domini: mihi quoque in omnibus obedistis,
verses.english: And he said to them: "You have done everything that Moses, the servant of the Lord, commanded you. You have also obeyed me in all things.

verses.latin: nec reliquistis fratres vestros spatio longissimo, usque in præsentem diem, custodientes imperium Domini Dei vestri.
verses.english: You have not abandoned your brothers for a very long time, even to this present day, guarding the command of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur revertimini, et ite in tabernacula vestra ad terram possessionis vestræ, quam vobis dedit Moyses famulus Domini trans Jordanem.
verses.english: Now, therefore, return and go to your homes in the land you possess, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave to you across the Jordan River."

verses.latin: Ita tamen ut custodiatis attente, et opere compleatis mandatum, et legem quam præcepit vobis Moyses famulus Domini: ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et ambuletis in omnibus viis ejus, et observetis mandata illius, et adhæreatis ei, cultuque et in omni opere serveatis illi.
verses.english: "But be careful to diligently keep and completely fulfill the commandment and the law that Moses, the servant of the Lord, commanded you: that you love the Lord your God, and walk in all His ways, and observe His commands, and cling to Him, and serve Him in all worship and in every work."

verses.latin: Et benedixit Josue, et dimisit eos: qui reversi sunt in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: And Joshua blessed them and sent them away. So they returned to their homes.

verses.latin: Dimidio quoque tribus Manasse, dederat Moyses possessionem in Basan: et idcirco mediæ parti quæ superfuit, dedit Josue sortem in ceteris fratribus suis trans Jordanem ad occidentalem plagam. Cumque dimitteret eos in tabernacula sua, et benedixisset illis,
verses.english: Moses had also given a possession in Bashan to half of the tribe of Manasseh. And therefore, to the remaining half-portion, Joshua gave an inheritance among their other brothers on the west side of the Jordan River. When he sent them away to their homes, and had blessed them,

verses.latin: dixit ad eos: In multa substantia atque divitiis revertimini ad sedes vestras, cum argento et auro, ære et ferro, et veste multiplici: dividite prædam receptam de hostibus cum fratribus vestris.
verses.english: he said to them: "Return to your settlements with much wealth and riches, with silver and gold, bronze and iron, and many garments. Divide the spoil taken from your enemies with your brothers."

verses.latin: Reversique sunt, et abierunt filii Ruben et filii Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse a filiis Israël de Silo, quæ sita est in Chanaan, ut intrarent Galaad terram possessionis suæ, quam obtinuerant juxta imperium Domini in manu Moysi.
verses.english: So the sons of Reuben, and the sons of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh returned and departed from the sons of Israel, from Shiloh, which is located in the land of Canaan. They went to enter Gilead, the land of their possession, which they had obtained according to the command of the Lord through Moses.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent ad tumulos Jordanis, in terram Chanaan, ædificaverunt juxta Jordanem altare valde grande.
verses.english: When they came to the Jordan River banks, in the land of Canaan, they built a very large altar near the Jordan.

verses.latin: Et audierunt filii Israël celeberrime, quod ædificassent filii Ruben et Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse altare in terra Chanaan, super Jordanis tumulos, contra filios Israël.
verses.english: And the sons of Israel heard a widely spread report that the sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh had built an altar in the land of Canaan, on the banks of the Jordan, facing the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt omnes filii Israël in Silo, ut ascenderent et pugnarent contra eos.
verses.english: And all the sons of Israel gathered at Shiloh, intending to go up and fight against them.

verses.latin: Interea miserunt ad filios Ruben et Gad et dimidiam tribum Manasse, in terram Galaad Phinees filium Eleazari sacerdotem,
verses.english: Meanwhile, they sent Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, to the sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, in the land of Gilead.

verses.latin: et decem principes cum eo, singulos de singulis tribubus Israël, viros principes familiarum suarum.
verses.english: And with him were ten princes, one from each of the tribes of Israel, men who were heads of their families.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent ad filios Ruben et Gad et dimidiam tribum Manasse in terram Galaad, locuti sunt ad eos, dicentes:
verses.english: When they came to the sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, they spoke to them, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit omnis ecclesia Domini: Quæ est ista transgressio? cur reliquistis Dominum Deum Israël, ædificantes altare sacrilegum, et a cultu illius recedentes?
verses.english: "Thus says the entire assembly of the Lord: 'What is this transgression? Why have you abandoned the Lord, the God of Israel, by building a sacrilegious altar, and withdrawing from His worship?'"

verses.latin: An parum nobis est quod peccavimus in Beelphegor, et usque in præsentem diem permanet scelus, et propter hoc facta est plaga in populo Domini?
verses.english: "Is it not enough for us that we sinned at Baal-Peor, and the wickedness remains to this present day, and because of this a plague came upon the Lord's people?

verses.latin: Et vos hodie reliquistis Dominum, et cras in universum Israël ira ejus desaeviet.
verses.english: And if you today abandon the Lord, tomorrow His wrath will rage against all of Israel."

verses.latin: Quod si putatis immundam esse terram possessionis vestræ, transite ad terram in qua est tabernaculum Domini, et habitate inter nos: tantum a Domino, et a nostro consortio ne discedatis, ædificato altare præter altare Domini Dei nostri.
verses.english: "But if you think that the land you possess is unclean, cross over to the land where the Lord's Tabernacle is, and live among us. Only do not depart from the Lord and from our fellowship by building an altar other than the altar of the Lord our God.

verses.latin: Nonne Achan filius Zare prævaricatus est mandatum Domini, et super omnem populum Israël ira ejus incubuit? et ille erat unus homo, atque utinam solus perexisset in scelere.
verses.english: Did not Achan, the son of Zerah, commit a transgression against the Lord's command, and His wrath fell upon all the people of Israel? And he was just one man, and if only he had perished alone in his wickedness!"

verses.latin: Et responderunt filii Ruben et Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse principibus legationis Israël:
verses.english: And the sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered the princes of Israel's delegation:

verses.latin: Dominus Dominus Deus fortis, Dominus Dominus Deus fortis, ipse novit, et Israël simul intellige: si prævaricationis animo, aut contemptu Domini hoc altare ereximus, non nobis parcas,
verses.english: "The Lord, the Mighty God! The Lord, the Mighty God! He Himself knows, and Israel, you also understand: if with an intention of transgression or contempt for the Lord we have erected this altar, do not spare us.

verses.latin: quin potius ipse te vindica: et si ea mente fecimus ut holocausta et sacrificia et pacificas hostias super eo poneremus, anathema simus.
verses.english: Rather, let Him Himself take vengeance on you. And if we did this with the intention of placing burnt offerings and sacrifices and peace offerings upon it, may we be accursed.

verses.latin: Et non magis metuentes hoc, et cogitantes quod in ceterum dicerent filii vestri filiis nostris: Quid vobis et Domino Deo Israël?
verses.english: But we acted out of concern, fearing this, and considering what your children might say to our children in the future: 'What do you have to do with the Lord, the God of Israel?'

verses.latin: terminum posuit Dominus inter nos et vos, o filii Ruben et Gad, Jordanem fluvium: et idcirco non habetis partem in Domino. Sicque averterent filii vestri, filios nostros ne colerent Dominum.
verses.english: The Lord has placed a boundary between us and you, O sons of Reuben and Gad, the Jordan River. And therefore, you have no part in the Lord.' And thus your children might turn our children away from worshipping the Lord.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem diximus: ædificemus nobis altare non in holocausta, neque ad victimas offerendas,
verses.english: For this reason, we said: 'Let us build an altar for ourselves, not for burnt offerings, nor for offering sacrifices,

verses.latin: sed in testimonium inter nos et vos et posteritatem nostram, ut serviamus Domino et cultum illius frequentemus, in holocaustis et sacrificiis et pacificis victimis: et nequaquam dicant ultra filii vestri filiis nostris: Non est vobis pars in Domino.
verses.english: but as a witness between us and you, and our descendants, that we may serve the Lord and frequently observe His worship with burnt offerings and sacrifices and peace offerings.' This way, your children will never again say to our children: 'You have no share in the Lord.'"

verses.latin: Quod si quando voluerint hoc dicere, respondebitis eis: En altare Domini quod fecerunt patres nostri, non in holocausta, neque in victimas, sed in testimonium nostrum et vestrum.
verses.english: "And if ever they wish to say this, you will answer them: 'Behold the altar of the Lord which our fathers made, not for burnt offerings, nor for sacrifices, but as a witness for us and for you.'"

verses.latin: Absit ut a Domino recedamus, et ejus cultum relinquamus, ædificato altari ad holocausta, et sacrificia, et victimas pacificas offerendas præter altare Domini Dei nostri, quod statutum est ante tabernaculum ejus.
verses.english: "Far be it from us to depart from the Lord, and to abandon His worship, by building an altar for offering burnt offerings, and sacrifices, and peace offerings, apart from the altar of the Lord our God, which is established before His Tabernacle."

verses.latin: His auditis Phinees sacerdos, et principes legationis Israël, qui erant cum eo, placati sunt.
verses.english: When they heard this, Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the Israelite delegation who were with him, were appeased.

verses.latin: Et dixit Phinees filius Eleazari sacerdos ad Rubenitas et Gaditas et ad dimidiam tribum Manasse: Hodie scimus quod nobiscum sit Dominus, eo quod non secuti sitsetis consilium prævaricationis hujus, et liberastis filios Israël de manu Domini.
verses.english: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, said to the Reubenites and Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh: "Today we know that the Lord is with us, because you have not followed this counsel of transgression, and you have delivered the sons of Israel from the hand of the Lord."

verses.latin: Reversique sunt Phinees filius Eleazari sacerdos et principes de filiis Ruben et Gad de terra Galaad in terram Chanaan ad filios Israël, et retulerunt eis verba.
verses.english: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, and the princes returned from the sons of Reuben and Gad, from the land of Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the sons of Israel, and reported the words to them.

verses.latin: Placuitque sermo omnibus audientibus. Et laudaverunt Deum, et ultra nihil moliti sunt ascendere contra eos, atque pugnare.
verses.english: And the report pleased all who heard it. And they praised God, and no longer attempted to go up against them and fight.

verses.latin: Edificaveruntque filii Ruben et Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse altare, et vocaverunt illud Testimonium, eo quod esset testimonium: Quia Dominus ipse est Deus.
verses.english: And the sons of Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh built the altar, and they called it "Witness", because it was a witness that the Lord Himself is God.

verses.latin: Tunc vocavit Josue Rubenitas et Gaditas et dimidiam tribum Manasse,
verses.english: Then Joshua called for the Reubenites, the Gadites, and half of the tribe of Manasseh,

verses.latin: et dixit ad eos: Vos fecistis omnia quae praecepit vobis Moyses famulus Domini: et mihi quoque in cunctis quae vobis mandavi, obedistis:
verses.english: and said to them: "You have done everything that Moses, the Lord's servant, commanded you; and you have also obeyed me in everything I commanded you.

verses.latin: non dereliquistis fratres vestros longo jam tempore usque in praesentem diem, custodientes mandata Domini Dei vestri.
verses.english: You have not abandoned your brothers for a long time, even until this very day, carefully observing the commands of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur revertimini et ite in tabernacula vestra, ad terram possessionis vestrae, quam vobis dedit Moyses famulus Domini trans Jordanem.
verses.english: Now, therefore, return and go to your homes, to the land of your inheritance which Moses, the Lord's servant, gave you beyond the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Ita tamen ut custodiatis diligentius et opere impleatis mandatum et legem, quam praecepit vobis Moyses famulus Domini: ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et ambuletis in omnibus viis ejus, et observetis mandata illius, et adhaereatis ei, culturi illum in omni corde et in omni anima vestra.
verses.english: However, make sure you carefully observe and fulfill the command and the law that Moses, the Lord's servant, commanded you: to love the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, to keep His commands, and to hold fast to Him, serving Him with all your heart and with all your soul.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Josue eos, et benedixit illis.
verses.english: Joshua then called them together and blessed them.

verses.latin: Et duabus tribubus et dimidiae tribui Manasse, dederat Moyses possessionem in Basan: et idcirco mediae parti Manasse, dedit Josue sortem in parte altera Jordanis ex occidentali plaga.
verses.english: And to the two tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh, Moses had given an inheritance in Bashan. Because of this, Joshua gave the other half of Manasseh their share of the land on the other side of the Jordan River, on the western side.

verses.latin: Cumque dimitteret eos, et abire juberet in tabernacula sua, ait ad eos: Cum multa substantia atque divitiis revertimini ad sedes vestras, cum argento et auro et aere ac ferro et veste multiplici: dividite praedam direptionis cum fratribus vestris.
verses.english: And when he sent them away and commanded them to go to their homes, he said to them: "Return to your homes with much wealth and riches, with silver and gold and bronze and iron and many garments. Divide the spoils of your plunder with your brothers.

verses.latin: Reversique sunt et abierunt filii Ruben et filii Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse a filiis Israel de Silo, quae est in Chanaan, ut intrarent in Galaad terram possessionis suae, quam obtinuerant juxta imperium Domini in manu Moysi.
verses.english: So the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh returned and departed from the other sons of Israel, from Shiloh which is in Canaan. They went to enter Gilead, the land of their inheritance, which they had obtained according to the command of the Lord through Moses.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent ad tumulos Jordanis in terram Chanaan, aedificaverunt juxta Jordanem altare valde grande.
verses.english: When they came to the Jordan's banks, in the land of Canaan, they built a very large altar by the Jordan.

verses.latin: Et audierunt filii Israel a sermonibus dicentium: Aedificaverunt filii Ruben et Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse altare ex adverso terrae Chanaan, in partibus Jordanis, contra filios Israel.
verses.english: And the other sons of Israel heard a report, saying: "The sons of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh have built an altar opposite the land of Canaan, in the region of the Jordan, facing the other sons of Israel."

verses.latin: Cumque audissent, convenerunt omnes filii Israel in Silo, ut ascenderent et pugnarent contra eos.
verses.english: When they heard this, all the sons of Israel gathered at Shiloh, intending to go up and fight against them.

verses.latin: Miseruntque ad filios Ruben et Gad et ad dimidiam tribum Manasse in terram Galaad Phinees filium Eleazari sacerdotis,
verses.english: However, they first sent Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, to the sons of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead.

verses.latin: et decem principes cum eo, singulos de singulis tribubus, principes familiarum suarum de cunctis pariter tribubus Israel.
verses.english: They also sent ten chiefs with him, one from each tribe, who were heads of their families from all the tribes of Israel.

verses.latin: Qui cum venissent ad filios Ruben et Gad et dimidiam tribum Manasse in terram Galaad, locuti sunt ad eos:
verses.english: When these men came to the sons of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, they spoke to them,

verses.latin: Haec mandat omnis ecclesia Domini: Quae est ista transgressio, qua praevaricati estis mandatum Domini Dei Israel, aedificantes altare sacrilegum, et aversi a cultu ejus?
verses.english: saying: "This is what the entire assembly of the Lord commands: 'What is this transgression by which you have violated the command of the Lord God of Israel, building a sacrilegious altar and turning away from His worship?'

verses.latin: An parum vobis est scelus Phogor, pro quo et usque in praesentem diem multa plaga et calamitas facta est in populo Domini,
verses.english: Is the sin of Peor not enough for you, for which, even to this present day, a great plague and calamity came upon the Lord's people?

verses.latin: et nunc iterum relinquitis Dominum, et cras in universo Israele furor ejus commovebitur?
verses.english: And now you are again abandoning the Lord, so that tomorrow His wrath will be stirred up against all Israel?

verses.latin: Quod si putatis immundam esse terram possessionis vestrae, transite ad terram in qua est tabernaculum Domini, et habitate inter nos: excepto altari Domini Dei nostri, ne alterum aedificetis altare.
verses.english: If you think the land of your inheritance is unclean, then cross over to the land where the Lord's Tabernacle is, and live among us. Do not build another altar besides the altar of the Lord our God.

verses.latin: Nonne Achan filius Zarae praevaricatus est mandatum Domini, et super omnem Israel ira ejus incubuit? Et ille unus homo fuerat, atque utinam solus perisset in scelere suo.
verses.english: Did not Achan, the son of Zerah, violate the Lord's command, and His wrath fell upon all Israel? He was only one man, and would that he alone had perished in his wickedness!"

verses.latin: Responderuntque filii Ruben et Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse principibus legationis Israel:
verses.english: Then the sons of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh answered the chiefs of the Israelite delegation,

verses.latin: Deus Dominus scit, et ipse Israel intelligat: si praevaricationis animo, vel contemptu Domini hoc altare construximus, non nobis parcat hodie:
verses.english: saying: "The Lord God knows, and let Israel itself understand: If we built this altar with an intention of transgression or contempt for the Lord, may He not spare us today!

verses.latin: sed magis si ea mente fecimus, ut holocausta et sacrificia et pacificas victimas super eo poneremus, Ipse quaerat et judicet.
verses.english: But if we did it with the intention of placing burnt offerings, sacrifices, or peace offerings upon it, may He Himself investigate and judge.

verses.latin: Et non haec magis cogitatione ac sollicitudine quadam fecimus, dicentes: Ne aliquando filii vestri dicant filiis nostris cras: Quid vobis et Domino Deo Israel?
verses.english: Did we not rather do this with a certain thought and concern, saying: 'Lest perhaps your sons say to our sons tomorrow: What do you have to do with the Lord God of Israel?

verses.latin: Terminum posuit Dominus inter nos et vos, o filii Ruben et filii Gad, Jordanem fluvium: et idcirco non est vobis pars in Domino. Et per hanc occasionem avertent filii vestri filios nostros a timore Domini.
verses.english: The Lord has set the Jordan River as a boundary between us and you, O sons of Reuben and sons of Gad. Therefore, you have no portion in the Lord. And by this occasion, your sons might turn our sons away from fearing the Lord.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem diximus: Faciamus nobis altare non in holocausum neque ad victimas immolandas,
verses.english: Therefore we said: 'Let us build ourselves an altar, not for burnt offerings nor for sacrificing victims,

verses.latin: sed in testimonium inter nos et vos et soboles nostras atque vestras, ut serviamus Domino et impleamus cultum illius, et holocausta et victimas pacificas jugiter offeramus: ac ne quando dicant filii vestri cras filiis nostris: Non est vobis pars in Domino.
verses.english: but as a witness between us and you and our descendants and yours, that we may serve the Lord and fulfill His worship, and that we may continually offer burnt offerings and peace offerings. This is so that your sons may never say to our sons tomorrow: You have no portion in the Lord.'

verses.latin: Quod si voluerint dicere, respondebunt eis: Ecce altare Domini, quod fecerunt patres nostri non in holocausum, neque in sacrificium, sed in testimonium nostrum et vestrum.
verses.english: And if they should desire to say so, our sons will respond to them: 'Behold the altar of the Lord, which our fathers made, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice, but as a witness for us and for you.'

verses.latin: Absit a nobis hoc scelus, ut recedamus a Domino, et ejus cultum relinquamus, aedificato altari ad holocausta et sacrificia et victimas pacificas, praeter altare Domini Dei nostri, quod est ante tabernaculum ejus.
verses.english: Far be this wickedness from us, that we should withdraw from the Lord and abandon His worship, by building an altar for burnt offerings and sacrifices and peace offerings, other than the altar of the Lord our God, which is before His Tabernacle!"

verses.latin: His auditis, Phinees sacerdos et principes legationis Israel, qui erant cum eo, placati sunt. Et intellexerunt quod filii Ruben et Gad et dimidia tribus Manasse non suo facerent altare consilio, sed timore.
verses.english: When Phinehas the priest and the chiefs of the Israelite delegation who were with him heard these things, they were appeased. And they understood that the sons of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh had not built the altar out of their own design, but out of fear of future generations separating from God.

verses.latin: Dixitque Phinees filius Eleazari sacerdotis ad eos: Nunc scimus quod nobiscum sit Dominus, eo quod non estis hujus criminis rei, et erupuistis filios Israel de manu Domini.
verses.english: Then Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, said to them: "Now we know that the Lord is with us, because you are not guilty of this crime, and you have delivered the sons of Israel from the hand of the Lord."

verses.latin: Reversusque est cum principibus a filiis Ruben et Gad de terra Galaad, in terram Chanaan, ad filios Israel, et rettulerunt eis verba.
verses.english: So Phinehas and the chiefs returned from the sons of Reuben and Gad, from the land of Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the other sons of Israel, and reported their words to them.

verses.latin: Placuitque sermo cunctis audientibus. Et laudaverunt Deum filii Israel, et nequaquam ultra dixerunt ut ascenderent atque pugnarent contra eos, et delerent terram possessionis eorum.
verses.english: The report pleased all who heard it. And the sons of Israel praised God, and they no longer spoke of going up and fighting against them and destroying the land of their inheritance.

verses.latin: Appellaveruntque filii Ruben et Gad altare quod aedificaverant, Testimonium, eo quod esset testimonium: Quoniam Dominus ipse est Deus.
verses.english: And the sons of Reuben and Gad called the altar they had built "Witness," because it was a witness that the Lord Himself is God.

verses.latin: Multo post tempore, postquam Dominus dabat Israeli quietem ab universis hostibus per circuitum, et Josue senuerat, et erat aetate processa,
verses.english: Much later, after the Lord had given Israel a time of peace from all their surrounding enemies, and Joshua had grown old, and his age had advanced significantly,

verses.latin: vocavit Josue omnem Israelem, et majores natu, et principes, et judices, et magistros, dixitque ad eos: Ego senui, et progressa provectaque est aetas mea:
verses.english: Joshua called together all of Israel—their elders, their leaders, their judges, and their officers. He then said to them: "I have become old, and my life's journey has advanced and moved forward past my youth.

verses.latin: et vos videtis omnia quae fecerit Dominus Deus vester huic genti, et universis per circuitum nationibus: quomodo pro vobis ipse pugnaverit:
verses.english: You yourselves have seen all the Lord your God has done for this nation, and for all the nations around you. You have seen how He Himself fought for you.

verses.latin: et nunc quia divisit vobis sortes omnium terrarum harum, a Jordane usque ad mare Magnum, et a solis ortu ad occasum, vosque sortitus est, sicut praeceperat Dominus Deus vester,
verses.english: Now, because He has divided among you the assigned portions of all these lands, from the Jordan River to the Great Sea (the Mediterranean), and from where the sun rises in the east to where it sets in the west, and has given them to you by lot, just as the Lord your God commanded you,

verses.latin: Dominus Deus vester ipse vos expugnabit, et subvertet eos ante vos, et possidebitis terras eorum, sicut pollicitus est vobis.
verses.english: The Lord your God Himself will drive them out before you. He will overturn them from your path, and you will take possession of their lands, just as He promised you.

verses.latin: Confortamini igitur, et estote solliciti ut custodiatis, et faciatis omnia quae scripta sunt in volumine legis Moysi: et ne declinetis ab his nec ad dexteram nec ad sinistram:
verses.english: Therefore, strengthen yourselves and be careful to keep and perform all that is written in the book of the Law of Moses. Do not deviate from these commands, neither to the right nor to the left.

verses.latin: ne saltem commisceamini cum gentibus his, quae residuae sunt inter vos: neque nominetis deos eorum, neque juretis per eos, neque serviatis eis, neque adoretis illos:
verses.english: Do not even mix with these nations that remain among you. Do not mention the names of their false gods, nor swear by them, nor serve them, nor worship them.

verses.latin: sed adhaerete Domino Deo vestro, sicut fecistis usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Instead, cling steadfastly to the Lord your God, just as you have done up to this present day.

verses.latin: Et tunc expugnabit Dominus in conspectu vestro gentes magnas, et fortissimas, et nullus poterit resistere vobis.
verses.english: And then, the Lord will drive out before you great and very strong nations. No one will be able to resist you.

verses.latin: Unus e vobis persequetur mille viros, quia Dominus Deus vester ipse pugnabit pro vobis, sicut pollicitus est.
verses.english: One man among you will pursue a thousand men. This will happen because the Lord your God Himself will fight for you, just as He promised.

verses.latin: Hoc tantum providete, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum.
verses.english: Just be sure of this: that you love the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Quod si volueritis recedere, et adhaerere reliquiis gentium harum quae inter vos sunt, et copulari eis, et misceri,
verses.english: But if you choose to turn away and cling to the remnants of these nations that are among you, and join yourselves to them, and intermarry with them,

verses.latin: scitote quod tunc Dominus Deus vester non auferet eos, sed erunt vobis in foveam atque in laqueum, et in offendiculum lateri vestro, et in spinas in oculis vestris, donec vos auferat atque exterminet de terra hac optima, quam tradidit vobis.
verses.english: know for certain that then the Lord your God will not drive them out from before you. Instead, they will become for you a pit and a snare, a stumbling block at your side, and thorns in your eyes, until He removes you and utterly destroys you from this good land that He has given you.

verses.latin: Ecce ego hodie ingredior viam universae terrae, et vos scietis in omni corde vestro, et in tota anima vestra, quia non cecidit de omnibus sermonibus bonis quos locutus est Dominus Deus vester super vos, nec unus quidem ex eis irritus fuit:
verses.english: Behold, today I am going the way of all the earth (meaning, I am about to die). And you know in all your heart and in all your soul that not one of all the good promises which the Lord your God spoke concerning you has failed; not one of them has proven void.

verses.latin: sed sicut impleta sunt opere omnia quae locutus est vobis, bona pariter et mala: sic adducet super vos Dominus omne malum quod locutus est, donec vos auferat atque exterminet de hac terra optima, quam tradidit vobis.
verses.english: But just as all the good things that the Lord your God spoke to you have been fulfilled in deed, both good and evil, so also the Lord will bring upon you every evil He has spoken, until He removes you and utterly destroys you from this good land that He has given you.

verses.latin: Cum transgressi fueritis pactum Domini Dei vestri, quod vobiscum pepigit, et servieritis diis alienis, et adoraveritis eos: statim consurget furor Domini contra vos, et auferemini velociter de terra hac optima, quam tradidit vobis.
verses.english: When you transgress the covenant of the Lord your God, which He made with you, and you serve foreign gods and worship them, immediately the wrath of the Lord will rise against you. You will then swiftly be removed from this good land that He has given you.

verses.latin: Congregavitque Josue omnes tribus Israël in Sichem, et vocavit majores natu, et principes, et judices, et magistros: steteruntque coram conspectu Domini.
verses.english: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel together in Shechem. He called all the elders, leaders, judges, and officers of the people to come, and they stood before the presence of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ait ad populum: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Trans fluvium habitaverunt patres vestri ab initio, Thare pater Abraham, et Nachor: servieruntque diis alienis.
verses.english: Then Joshua said to all the people: "Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'Your ancestors, including Terah, the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived across the Euphrates River from the very beginning, and they worshipped false gods.

verses.latin: Tulique patrem vestrum Abraham de Mesopotamiæ finibus, et adduxi eum in terram Chanaan: multiplicavique semen ejus, et dedi illi Isaac.
verses.english: But I took your father Abraham from the region of Mesopotamia and led him into the land of Canaan. I gave him many descendants, and I gave him Isaac.

verses.latin: Et Isaaci dedi Jacob et Esau. Et dedi Esau montem Seir ad possidendum: Jacob vero et filii ejus descenderunt in Ægyptum.
verses.english: To Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the land of Mount Seir to possess as his own, but Jacob and his sons eventually went down into Egypt.

verses.latin: Misique Moysen et Aaron, et percussi Ægyptum multis signis atque portentis.
verses.english: Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I punished Egypt with many miraculous signs and wonders.

verses.latin: Et eduxi vos et patres vestros de Ægypto: et venistis ad mare: prosecutique sunt Ægyptii patres vestros cum curribus et equitatu usque ad mare Rubrum.
verses.english: And I brought you and your fathers out of Egypt, and you arrived at the sea. The Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and cavalry all the way to the Red Sea.

verses.latin: Et clamastis ad Dominum: qui posuit tenebras inter vos et Ægyptios, et adduxit super eos mare, et operuit illos. Viderunt oculi vestri quæ in Ægypto fecerim: et habitastis in solitudine multo tempore.
verses.english: You cried out to the Lord, and He placed a thick darkness between you and the Egyptians. Then He brought the sea over them and drowned them. Your own eyes saw what I did in Egypt. Afterwards, you lived in the wilderness for a very long time.

verses.latin: Et introduxi vos in terram Amorrhæi, qui habitabat trans Jordanem: cumque pugnarent contra vos, tradidique eos in manus vestras, et possedistis terram eorum, atque interfecistis illos.
verses.english: Then I brought you into the land of the Amorites, who lived on the other side of the Jordan River. When they fought against you, I gave them into your hands, and you took possession of their land and utterly destroyed them.

verses.latin: Surrexit quoque Balac filius Sephor rex Moab, et pugnavit contra Israël. Misitque et accersivit Balaam filium Beor, ut malediceret vobis:
verses.english: Then Balak, the son of Zippor, king of Moab, rose up and fought against Israel. He sent for and summoned Balaam, the son of Beor, to put a curse on you.

verses.latin: et nolui audire eum. Sed e contrario benedixi vobis per illum, et liberavi vos de manu ejus.
verses.english: But I refused to listen to Balaam. Instead, I used him to bless you, and so I delivered you from Balak's power.

verses.latin: Et transistis Jordanem, venistisque ad Jericho. Pugnaveruntque contra vos viri de Jericho, et Amorrhæus, et Pherezæus, et Chananæus, et Hethæus, et Gergesæus, et Jebusæus, et Eveus: et tradidi illos in manus vestras.
verses.english: Then you crossed the Jordan River and came to Jericho. The men of Jericho fought against you, along with the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Jebusites, and Hivites. But I delivered them into your hands.

verses.latin: Misique ante vos crabrones: et ejeci eos de locis suis, duos reges Amorrhæorum, non in gladio nec in arcu tuo.
verses.english: I sent the hornets before you, and they drove out the two kings of the Amorites from their lands—not by your own sword, nor by your bow.

verses.latin: Dedique vobis terram in qua non laborastis, et urbes quas non ædificastis, ut habitaretis in eis: vineas et oliveta quæ non plantastis.
verses.english: I gave you a land for which you had not labored, and cities that you had not built, so that you might live in them. I also gave you vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur timete Dominum, et servite ei perfecto et verissimo corde: et auferte de medio vestri deos quibus servierunt patres vestri in Mesopotamia et in Ægypto, et servite Domino.
verses.english: Now therefore, fear the Lord and serve Him with an undivided and most sincere heart. Cast away from among you the false gods that your fathers served in Mesopotamia and in Egypt, and serve the Lord only.

verses.latin: Sin autem malum vobis videtur ut serviatis Domino, eligite vobis hodie quod cui potius servire debeatis, utrum diis quos servierunt patres vestri in Mesopotamia, an diis Amorrhæorum in quorum terra habitatis: ego autem et domus mea serviemus Domino.
verses.english: But if it seems wrong to you to serve the Lord, then choose for yourselves today whom you will serve instead: either the gods that your fathers served in Mesopotamia, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you are now living. But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.

verses.latin: Responditque populus, et ait: Absit a nobis ut relinquamus Dominum, et serviamus diis alienis.
verses.english: Then the people answered and said: "It is unthinkable for us to abandon the Lord and serve other gods!

verses.latin: Dominus enim Deus noster ipse eduxit nos, et patres nostros de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis: fecitque videntibus nobis signa ingentia, et custodivit nos in omni via per quam ambulavimus, et in cunctis populis per quos transivimus.
verses.english: For the Lord our God is the one who brought us and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery. He performed mighty signs before our very eyes and preserved us throughout all the journey we undertook, and among all the peoples through whom we passed.

verses.latin: Et ejecit universas gentes, et Amorrhæum habitatorem terræ, per quam ingrediebamur. Idcirco et nos serviemus Domino, quia ipse est Deus noster.
verses.english: He also drove out all the nations from before us, even the Amorites who lived in the land that we were entering. Therefore, we too will serve the Lord, for He alone is our God."

verses.latin: Dixitque Josue ad populum: Non poteritis servire Domino: Deus enim sanctus est, et fortis, et æmulator, nec ignoscet sceleribus vestris atque peccatis.
verses.english: Then Joshua said to the people: "You will not be able to serve the Lord truly, because He is a holy God, a strong God, and a jealous God. He will not overlook your wicked deeds or your sins.

verses.latin: Si dimiseritis Dominum, et servieritis diis alienis, convertetur et affliget vos, et subvertet postquam vobis benefecerit.
verses.english: If you abandon the Lord and serve foreign gods, He will turn against you, bring disaster upon you, and utterly destroy you, even after all the good He has done for you."

verses.latin: Dixitque populus ad Josue: Nequaquam, sed Domino serviemus.
verses.english: But the people said to Joshua, "No! We will certainly serve the Lord!"

verses.latin: Et Josue ad populum: Testes, inquit, vos estis, quia ipsi elegeritis vobis Dominum ut serviatis ei. Responderuntque: Testes.
verses.english: Joshua then said to the people, "You yourselves are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen the Lord to serve Him." And they answered, "We are witnesses."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, ait, auferte deos alienos de medio vestri, et inclinate corda vestra ad Dominum Deum Israël.
verses.english: Then Joshua said, "Now, therefore, remove the foreign gods that are among you, and turn your hearts fully to the Lord, the God of Israel."

verses.latin: Dixeruntque populus ad Josue: Domino Deo nostro serviemus, et voci ejus obediemus.
verses.english: The people said to Joshua, "We will serve the Lord our God, and we will obey His voice."

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Josue in die illo fœdus, et proposuit populo præcepta atque judicia in Sichem.
verses.english: So Joshua made a covenant with the people on that day, and he laid out statutes and ordinances for them in Shechem.

verses.latin: Scripsitque omnia verba hæc in volumine legis Domini: et tulit lapidem pergrandem, posuitque eum subter quercum quæ erat in Sanctuario Domini.
verses.english: Joshua wrote all these words in the book of the Law of the Lord. Then he took a very large stone and set it up there under the oak tree that was by the sanctuary of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad omnem populum: En lapis iste erit vobis in testimonium, quod audierit omnia verba Domini quæ locutus est vobis: ne forte postea negare velitis, et mentiri Domino Deo vestro.
verses.english: And he said to all the people: "Look, this stone will be a witness against you, for it has heard all the words that the Lord spoke to us. It will stand as a reminder, lest you later deny and lie to the Lord your God."

verses.latin: Dimisitque Josue populum, singulos in possessionem suam.
verses.english: So Joshua sent the people away, each person to their own inherited land.

verses.latin: Post hæc igitur mortuus est Josue filius Nun, servus Domini, centum et decem annorum.
verses.english: After these events, Joshua, the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum in finibus possessionis suæ in Thamnathsare, quam dederant ei de monte Ephraim: a septentrionali parte montis Gaas.
verses.english: They buried him within the borders of his own inherited land at Timnath-serah, which had been given to him in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north side of Mount Gaash.

verses.latin: Servivitque Israël Domino cunctis diebus Josue, et senioris qui longo post Josue tempore vixerunt, et sciebant omnia opera Domini quæ fecerat Israeli.
verses.english: Israel served the Lord throughout all the days of Joshua, and throughout all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua and who had known all the great works that the Lord had done for Israel.

verses.latin: Ossa quoque Joseph, quæ tulerant filii Israël de Ægypto, sepelierunt in Sichem, in parte agri quem emerat Jacob a filiis Hemor patris Sichem centum novellis agnis: et fuit in possessionem filiorum Joseph.
verses.english: The bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel had carried up from Egypt, they buried in Shechem, in the portion of the field that Jacob had bought from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for one hundred young lambs. This place became the possession of the descendants of Joseph.

verses.latin: Eleazar quoque filius Aaron mortuus est: et sepelierunt eum in Gabaa Phinees filii sui, quæ data est ei in monte Ephraim.
verses.english: Eleazar also, the son of Aaron, died. They buried him in Gibeah, the town of his son Phinehas, which had been given to him in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Congregavit autem Iosue omnes tribus Israel in Sichem, et vocavit majores natu, et principes, ac judices, et magistros: steteruntque in conspectu Domini.
verses.english: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel together in Shechem, and he called all their elders, their leaders, their judges, and their officers to assemble. And they presented themselves before the presence of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ait ad populum Iosue: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Trans fluvium habitaverunt patres vestri ab initio, Thare pater Abraham, et Nachor: servieruntque diis alienis.
verses.english: Then Joshua spoke to all the people, saying, 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'Your ancestors lived beyond the River Euphrates from the earliest times. This included Terah, the father of Abraham and Nahor. And they served other gods there.''

verses.latin: Tuli ergo patrem vestrum Abraham de Mesopotamiæ finibus, et adduxi eum in terram Chanaan: multiplicavique semen ejus, et dedi illi Isaac.
verses.english: So I took your ancestor Abraham from the land of Mesopotamia and brought him into the land of Canaan. I gave him many descendants, and I gave him Isaac.

verses.latin: Et dedi Isaac Iacob et Esau. Et dedi Esau montem Seir ad possidendum: Iacob vero et filii ejus descenderunt in Ægyptum.
verses.english: And to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. To Esau I gave Mount Seir to possess as his own, but Jacob and his sons went down into Egypt.

verses.latin: Et misi Moysen et Aaron, et percussi Ægyptum multis signis atque portentis, sicut scriptum est. Et eduxi vos et patres vestros de Ægypto.
verses.english: Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt with many miraculous signs and wonders, just as it is written. And I led you and your ancestors out of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et venistis ad mare: prosecutique sunt Ægyptii patres vestros cum curribus et equitatu usque ad mare Rubrum.
verses.english: And you came to the sea. The Egyptians pursued your ancestors with chariots and horsemen all the way to the Red Sea.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum: qui posuit tenebras inter vos et Ægyptios, et adduxit super eos mare, et operuit illos. Viderunt oculi vestri quæ in Ægypto fecerim: et habitastis in solitudine multo tempore.
verses.english: Then your ancestors cried out to the Lord. He put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and He brought the sea over them and drowned them. Your own eyes saw what I did in Egypt, and you lived in the wilderness for a long time.

verses.latin: Et introduxi vos in terram Amorrhæi, qui habitabant trans Iordanem. Cumque pugnarent vobiscum, tradidi illos in manus vestras, et possedistis terram eorum, atque interfecistis illos.
verses.english: Then I brought you into the land of the Amorites, who lived beyond the Jordan River. When they fought against you, I handed them over into your power, and you took possession of their land, and I destroyed them before you.

verses.latin: Surrexitque Balac filius Sephor rex Moab, et pugnavit contra Israel. Misitque et vocavit Balaam filium Beor, ut malediceret vobis.
verses.english: Then Balak, the son of Zippor, who was the king of Moab, arose and fought against Israel. He sent for and summoned Balaam, the son of Beor, so that he might curse you.

verses.latin: Et nolui exaudire eum: sed e contrario benedixi vobis, et liberavi vos de manu illius.
verses.english: But I would not listen to Balaam. Instead, I blessed you completely, and I delivered you from his hand.

verses.latin: Et transistis Iordanem, et venistis ad Iericho. Pugnaveruntque contra vos viri de Iericho, et Amorrhæus, et Pherezæus, et Chananæus, et Hethæus, et Gergesæus, et Hevæus, et Iebusæus: et tradidi illos in manus vestras.
verses.english: Then you crossed the Jordan River and came to Jericho. The men of Jericho fought against you, as did the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites. But I delivered them into your power.

verses.latin: Misique ante vos crabrones: et ejeci eos de locis suis, duos reges Amorrhæorum, non in gladio nec in arcu tuo.
verses.english: I sent hornets before you, and they drove out the two kings of the Amorites from their places, not by your sword or by your bow.

verses.latin: Et dedi vobis terram, in qua non laborastis, et urbes quas non ædificastis, ut habitaretis in eis: vineas et oliveta, quæ non plantastis, ex quibus nunc comeditis.
verses.english: And I gave you a land for which you had not toiled, and cities that you had not built, so that you might live in them. And I gave you vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant, from which you now eat.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo timete Dominum, et servite ei perfecto corde ac veritate: et auferte deos, quibus servierunt patres vestri in Mesopotamia et in Ægypto: et servite Domino.
verses.english: Now, therefore, fear the Lord and serve Him with a perfect heart and with truth. Remove the gods whom your ancestors served in Mesopotamia and in Egypt, and serve the Lord alone.

verses.latin: Sin autem malum vobis videtur ut serviatis Domino, eligite vobis hodie quod placet, cui servire, utrum diis, quibus servierunt patres vestri in Mesopotamia, an diis Amorrhæorum, in quorum terra habitatis: ego autem et domus mea serviemus Domino.
verses.english: But if it seems evil to you to serve the Lord, then choose for yourselves today whom you wish to serve. Will it be the gods whom your ancestors served in Mesopotamia, or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you now live? As for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.

verses.latin: Responditque populus, et ait: Absit a nobis ut relinquamus Dominum, et serviamus diis alienis.
verses.english: And the people answered and said: 'Far be it from us that we should abandon the Lord and serve foreign gods!'

verses.latin: Dominus enim Deus noster ipse eduxit nos, et patres nostros de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis: et fecit coram nobis signa ingentia, et custodivit nos in omni via per quam ambulavimus, et in cunctis populis per quos transivimus.
verses.english: For the Lord our God is He who brought us and our ancestors out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery. He performed great signs before our eyes and protected us on every road by which we traveled and among all the peoples through whom we passed.

verses.latin: Et ejecit universas gentes, et Amorrhæum habitatorem terræ, quos intraveramus. Ergo et nos serviemus Domino, quia ipse est Deus noster.
verses.english: And He drove out all the nations, including the Amorites, the inhabitants of the land into which we entered. Therefore, we also will serve the Lord, because He Himself is our God.

verses.latin: Dixitque Iosue ad populum: Non poteritis servire Domino: Deus enim sanctus et fortis æmulator est, nec ignoscet sceleribus vestris atque peccatis.
verses.english: Then Joshua said to the people: 'You will not be able to serve the Lord, for He is a holy God, and a strong, jealous God. He will not forgive your wicked deeds and your sins.'

verses.latin: Si dimiseritis Dominum, et servieritis diis alienis, convertetur et affliget vos, atque subvertet, postquam vobis benefecerit.
verses.english: If you forsake the Lord and serve foreign gods, He will turn against you and afflict you. He will utterly destroy you, after He has done so much good for you.

verses.latin: Dixitque populus ad Iosue: Nequaquam, sed Domino serviemus.
verses.english: But the people said to Joshua: 'By no means! We will indeed serve the Lord!'

verses.latin: Et Iosue ad populum: Testes, inquit, vos estis quia ipsi elegeritis vobis Dominum ut serviatis ei. Responderuntque: Testes.
verses.english: And Joshua said to the people: 'You yourselves are witnesses that you have chosen the Lord for yourselves, to serve Him.' And they responded: 'We are witnesses!'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, ait, auferte deos alienos de medio vestri, et inclinate corda vestra ad Dominum Deum Israel.
verses.english: Now, therefore, he said, 'Remove the foreign gods that are among you, and turn your hearts towards the Lord, the God of Israel.'

verses.latin: Dixitque populus ad Iosue: Domino Deo nostro serviemus, et voci ejus obediemus.
verses.english: And the people said to Joshua: 'We will serve the Lord our God, and we will obey His voice.'

verses.latin: Percussit ergo in die illo Iosue fœdus, et proposuit populo præcepta atque judicia in Sichem.
verses.english: So on that day, Joshua made a covenant with the people and established for them statutes and ordinances in Shechem.

verses.latin: Scripsitque omnia verba hæc in volumine legis Domini: et tulit lapidem pergrandem, posuitque eum subter quercum quæ erat in sanctuario Domini.
verses.english: And he wrote all these words in the book of the Law of the Lord. He also took a large stone and set it up there under the oak tree that was in the sanctuary of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad omnem populum: En lapis iste erit vobis in testimonium, quod audierit omnia verba Domini quæ locutus est vobis: ne forte postea negare velitis, et mentiri Domino Deo vestro.
verses.english: And he said to all the people: 'Behold, this very stone will be a witness against you. For it has heard all the words of the Lord which He has spoken to you. Therefore, do not deny Him afterwards and lie to the Lord your God.'

verses.latin: Dimisitque Iosue populum, singulos in possessionem suam.
verses.english: Then Joshua sent the people away, each to his own inheritance.

verses.latin: Post hæc Iosue filius Nun servus Domini mortuus est, centum et decem annorum.
verses.english: After these events, Joshua, the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died, being one hundred and ten years old.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum in finibus possessionis suæ in Thamnathsare, quæ est in monte Ephraim, a septentrionali plaga montis Gaas.
verses.english: And they buried him within the boundaries of his own inherited land in Timnath-serah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north side of Mount Gaash.

verses.latin: Servivitque Israel Domino cunctis diebus Iosue, et seniorum, qui longo vixerunt tempore post Iosue, et qui noverant omnia opera Domini, quæ fecerat in Israel.
verses.english: And Israel served the Lord throughout all the days of Joshua, and during the days of the elders who lived for a long time after Joshua, and who had known all the works of the Lord that He had done for Israel.

verses.latin: Ossa quoque Ioseph, quæ tulerant filii Israel de Ægypto, sepelierunt in Sichem, in parte agri, quam emerat Iacob a filiis Hemor patris Sichem centum novellis agnis: et fuit in possessionem filiorum Ioseph.
verses.english: Also, the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel had brought up from Egypt, they buried in Shechem, in the portion of land that Jacob had purchased from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for a hundred pieces of silver. And it became the inheritance of the sons of Joseph.

verses.latin: Eleazar quoque filius Aaron mortuus est: et sepelierunt eum in Gabaath Phinees filii ejus, quæ data est ei in monte Ephraim.
verses.english: Eleazar, the son of Aaron, also died. And they buried him in Gibeah of Phinehas, his son, which had been given to him in the hill country of Ephraim.
